{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2018-03-00470-0-000002954", "text": "Assistant Professor in Econometrics

Â«A place where knowledge is createdÂ» - As one of Europe's leading universities of economics and business administration, the University of St.Gallen (HSG), Switzerland, is committed to the education of over 8000 students and is one of the largest employers in the region, providing around 2300 employees with an attractive and innovative environment for research.
The School of Economics and Political Science of the University of St. Gallen wishes to appoint an Assistant Professor in Econometrics as soon as possible (or by mutual agreement).
Assistant Professor in Econometrics
Applicants should have a Ph.D. in Economics, Econometrics, or Statistics and a promising track record in research.

We appreciate applications from all areas of Econometrics, but we give preference to candidates with experience in applied and theoretical microeconometrics and machine learning.
The appointment is for 6 years (non-tenure track). The teaching load will be one class (two hours) per week (24 weeks p.a.). In addition, the successful candidate will be responsible for counselling students and faculty in applied econometrics and data science. Applications from qualified women are particularly welcome.

Candidates are requested to submit their application along with the usual supporting documents (motivation letter, CV, teaching evaluations and relevant publications) in electronic form. Two letters of reference are required. Closing date: 25 March 2018.
Please find further information about our research and study programs on [wwwadr] Enquiries can be addressed to the Head of the Hiring Committee, Prof. Enrico De Giorgi.

Interested candidates are asked to submit their application documents electronically
Apply online
University of St.Gallen | School of Economics and Political Science | Dufourstrasse 50| 9000 St.Gallen | [wwwadr] |"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2018-03-00481-0-000004055", "text": "E-Discovery Manager â€“ Forensic Technology and Discovery Services in Zurich

E-Discovery Manager â€“ Forensic Technology and Discovery Services in Zurich
ðŸ” Schweiz

ðŸ“
	Assurance

	SWI000HM 

ðŸ“…
	Thu 01 Feb 02:31 

We are looking for an eDiscovery Manager â€“ Forensic Technology and Discovery Services in Zurich

EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services. The rapidly growing Forensic Technology & Discovery Services (â€œFTDSâ€) department is currently seeking the right candidate for an excellent career opportunity in the eDiscovery (â€œeDâ€) team in Zurich. Being part of the Fraud Investigation & Dispute Services (â€œFIDSâ€) department the innovative eD team is involved in conducting investigations into fraudulent behavior and activities of misconduct to prevent or combat fraud, bribery and corruption.

The eD team is a global group of technical specialists that apply technical skills to the full life cycle of data management, including data scoping, processing and analysis, reporting and visualization, as well as presentation for review. This incorporates advanced data analysis technologies such as machine learning, correlation engines, social network analysis, statistical as well as natural language analysis, predictive coding, and heavy automation.
Our FTDS data center provides state of the art forensic technology infrastructure and tools necessary to uncover even the most complex cases.

You will have a unique, career changing opportunity to play a key role in the strategy and growth of the eD team.

Tasks that you promote

	As a manager, you are responsible with your teams for multiple client engagements. You build your career by managing projects, leading a team and ensuring client satisfaction
	Advising clients on a comprehensive range of issues during forensic- and regulatory investigations in relation to financial crime, corruption offenses, information theft and other offenses.
	Planning and supervising engagement teams in carrying out both reactive and proactive data analysis of large volumes of unstructured and structured data.
	Closely working with clients, fraud investigators, internal and external auditors, lawyers and regulatory authorities in sensitive and sometimes adversarial situations.
	Developing new service offerings and solutions in a fast changing environment

Your profile to succeed together

	Degree (Bachelor or Master) in Computer Science, Business Information Technology, or related fields
	Strong track record of working with SQL and additional scripting or other programming languages (e.g. Ruby, ECMA Script or Python)
	Expertise in collecting, processing and analysing large volumes of unstructured and structured data
	A minimum of 5 yearsâ€™ experience of working with common eDiscovery and forensic software products (preferably NUIX or Relativity by kCura)
	Strong understanding of various operating systems, database technologies, IT environments, and networks
	Solution-oriented and proactive approach to the delivery and implementation of projects as well as the ability to build strong relationships with your teams and clients.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English is required â€“ German and any additional language is considered as a plus.
	Excellent problem solving and interpersonal skills

More opportunities for your development

Do you have challenging plans? Stick to them and realize your goals with us! Design your career with EY in a culture that promotes diversity and education. In an environment that constantly opens new doors through knowledge sharing, flexibility and recognition. We offer you to join our highly motivated team of advisory professionals. You will be working and learning in a highly dynamic and cross-functional team - being able to boost your learning curve through the combination of intensive team work, challenging client projects and being part of the network of one of the worldâ€™s leading professional services firms.

Doreen Schwarz is looking forward to receiving your application

Do the next step and apply for this position online. Ref No: SWI00HM. For further information please contact our recruitment team ([email] / +41 58 286 33 66)."}

ArztsekretÃ¤rin / Med. Praxisassistent 60-80%

Position Title
WorldWide Medical Affairs Director - Neuroscience (Migraine)
Job Description
Responsible for providing medical and scientific leadership into medical brand teams and other brand related functions from pre-launch through Life Cycle Management. Global Medical Affairs Director supports the Global Brand Medical Director in the execution of Medical Advisor activities in alignment with Global Medical Affairs functions.
1. For the assigned Medical Affairs studies (Phase IIIB-IV, Post Marketing Surveillance, non-interventional studies without regulatory impact) within program/brand, as a member of the Global Medical Affairs Team (GMAT), the Global Medical Affairs Director provides medical scientific input to, e.g.:
a.Key activities related to planning, execution and reporting of Global Medical Affairs studies and ensure timely and on budget delivery.
b.Develop or contribute to study-related documents (e.g. concept sheets, protocols, case report forms, statistical plan, data analysis plan, study reports, publications).
c.Develop/contribute and review presentation materials for study/program-related advisory boards, investigator meetings, protocol training meetings for Novartis local medical organizations and external speaker at meetings when required.
d.On-going review of clinical study data, final analysis and interpretation, in collaboration with the Brand Safety Leader, appropriate Global Clinical Team (GCT) members and the GBT (Global Brand Team).
e.Act as medical key contact point for assigned Medical Advisor studies.
2. Serve as a disease area scientific and medical expert for internal customers/stakeholders, e.g., Global Clinical Team , Scientific Review Committee, research, exploratory development, device development, Marketing, Novartis Country Pharma Organizations (CPOs), and other line functions within Global Medical Affairs and external customers e.g., Health Care Professionals (HCPs) ,Market Access and Patient Advocacy Groups (PAGs).
3. Build together with the Global Brand Medical Director Medical Affairs strategy
a.Provide support on the Medical Affairs Plan and other lines functions plans (Clinical Development Plan, International Product Strategy, etc.)
b.Provide input on scientific content of Program/brand(s) publication plan to assigned Medical Communication Leaders (MCLs)
c.Support/lead data mining and Real World Evidence (RWE) activities and support/lead process.
d.Provides medical support/ input to Global Brand Medical Director and to Medical Communication Leader or deputize in selected cases for internal and external medical education and communication initiatives (e.g., speaker training, advocacy, Medical Experts strategy, advisory boards, Medical Science Liaison support and education, launch support, congress planning and execution)
Minimum requirements
MD or PhD, â‰¥ 6 years of clinical research experience preferably in the Health Industry MD, PharmD or PhD with knowledge/experience in medical affairs activities, â‰¥ 6 y Fluent English (oral and written)

	â€¢  Advanced medical/scientific writing and communication skills.

	â€¢  Proven ability to interpret, discuss and represent efficacy, statistical and safety data relating to the assigned area.

	â€¢  Proven ability to work both independently and in a cross functional team setting, including a highly-matrixed environment.

	â€¢  Demonstrated ability to establish strong scientific partnership with key investigators in assigned Therapeutic Area.

	â€¢  Medical and/or scientific expertise within a disease area required.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2018-03-01972-0-000001981", "text": "Data Scientist

Sign In
	Language
English UK  (English UK) 
Career Opportunities: Data Scientist (45573)
Req ID 45573 - Posted 13/02/2018 - Switzerland - R&D - Full-time
	Job Description Print Preview

Firmenich is the largest private company in the Fragrance & Flavors industry, founded in 1895 in Geneva, Switzerland.

Led by our passion for taste and smell, we put our creativity and innovation to work to develop fragrances and flavors for the worldâ€™s most desirable brands, delighting billions of consumers every day.

We currently have an open positions for a

Data Scientist

with a PhD in Data Science or equivalent in Geneva, Switzerland.

The Knowledge Science group is part of the Corporate R&D division. Fundamental research on AI/ML in the context of chemistry, sensory as well as creativity is at the core of the groupâ€™s activity with the goal to deliver data-driven business functions across the company. Our working environment includes latest hardware equipment and tools from the IT and collaborations with key AI players (academic and industrial) around the world.

Focus on state-of-the-art Machine Learning techniques including classification, generative modelling, and reinforcement learning. Solid experience with typical frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Matlab, ..) required.

Design with generative models and development of generative models (variational autoencoders, generative adversarial nets and beyond) for complex structures under constraints. ChemInformatics knowledge a plus.

The ideal candidates should meet the following criteria:

	Solid background in programming, good knowledge on LINUX operating system as well as informatics and statistics skills and robust knowledge on Database structures and best practices analytic tools.
	Fluent in French & English language (spoken and written/proficiency level).
	Be an effective communicator, self-motivated, and able to drive insights into actions
	Interpersonal/communication skills are therefore a must to thrive in a multi-functional leadership team
	Ability to connect and explore large datasets, build and test predictive models, and translate insights into business improving action is critical.
	Leveraging such technologies for solving ad hoc business problems, innovating on potential future solutions and translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions.

Basic skills & experience in:

	Bayesian Analysis, Bayesian Decision Theory
	Probabilistic Modeling and Computation
	Machine Learning, including Deep Learning
	Uncertainty Quantification
	Optimization
	Unix/Linux
	Scientific Computing: Matlab, Python, C++, Java
	High-Performance Parallel and Distributing Computing
	Deep Learning frameworks: Keras, Tensorflow, PyTorch
	Data Visualization
	Data Management Systems"}

Data Integration Engineer

The Blue Brain Project (BBP) applies advanced neuroinformatics, data analytics, high-performance computing, and simulation-based approaches to the challenge of understanding the structure and function of the mammalian brain in health and disease.
The team you would join has built and open sourced a data integration platform, Blue Brain Nexus, to support large-scale neuroscience data integration, search and analysis to enable and accelerate the delivery of BBPâ€™s scientific goals.

Experience and preferred skills:

	Familiarity with REST services and JSON data structure,
	Experience with large scale data integration in the life sciences,
	Experience with data engineering tools (e.g. Luigi, Airflow, Pinball, Talend)
	Agile software development, unit and integration testing. 

Experience in any of the following areas would be a plus:

	Neuroscience ,
	Other programming languages such as Java, Scala, C, C++, R, Matlab,
	Scalable data processing framework (Apache Spark),
	Scripting languages (Bash),
	Ontology engineering,
	Semantic web technologies (RDF/OWL, SPARQL, triple stores),
	DevOps technologies (Jenkins, Puppet, Docker, OpenShift, OpenStack), 

We offer :

	An internationally visible and rising project in simulation-based research in neuroscience,
	A young, dynamic, inter-disciplinary, and international working environment,

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2018-03-09001-0-000006660", "text": "Research Assistant for Information Retrieval and Natural Language Processing (Information Engineerin

ZHAW â€” Winterthur
School fo Engineering

Zurich University of Applied Sciences ZHAW is one of Switzerland's largest multidisciplinary universities of applied sciences, with over 12,000 students and 3,000 faculty and staff.

As one of the leading Engineering Faculties in Switzerland, the ZHAW School of Engineering (SOE) emphasises topics which will be relevant in the future. Our 13 institutes and centres guarantee superior-quality education, research and development with a focus on the areas of energy, mobility, information and health.

The Institute of Applied Information Technology specializes in smart information systems, covering the areas of Distributed Software Systems, Human-Information Interaction, Information Security, Information Engineering and Service Engineering.

Within the Research Group Information Engineering of the Institute of Applied Information Technology ([wwwadr]), we are looking for a highly motivated and excellent candidate as
Research Assistant for Information Retrieval and Natural Language Processing (Information Engineering Group)
Your responsibilities:
â€¢	Contribute to research projects in the areas of information retrieval, information extraction, message understanding, natural language processing and content-based recommender systems
â€¢	Become an expert in the aforementioned fields, with a track record of published own research results and successful technology transfer
The successful candidate has finished a Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science at a research university or a university of applied sciences within the last two years. He or she must demonstrate some prior experience in information retrieval or related fields (e.g., coursework or project work). We expect a good command as well as a passion for programming. Good communication skills in English and in German are an asset for the work in multidisciplinary teams. The ideal candidate has an affinity to related fields in Information Engineering, such as big data and machine learning/artificial intelligence, and will demonstrate a flair for academic work, identifying unsolved problems and proposing novel ideas for future activities. Particular emphasis is given to developing prototypes, experimenting hands-on with data, and scientific evaluation and publication of results.

We offer a competitive, technically stimulating, and exciting environment. For high-potential candidates, the pursuit of a doctorate in conjunction with a partner university is possible. Responsibility is provided with respect to contributing to and furthering research agendas in the abovementioned fields. The candidate will have the opportunity to work in projects with industrial partners and help in acquiring funding for collaborative research. The position will also involve publishing, for example by writing papers, contributing to open source software, presenting at scientific conferences, etc. As well as providing an excellent work environment, we provide intellectual liberty and competitive compensation based on Swiss standards at one of the leading houses for data science research in Switzerland.
Do you have any questions about this position?
For additional information, please contact Prof. Dr. Martin Braschler, Head of Information Engineering Group, phone +41 58 934 69 52, e-mail [email].

Are you interested?
If you would like to apply, please use the online platform only to send your full application, attn. Esther Huber, HR Consultant in Winterthur.
For further information on ZHAW or our Institute, go to: [wwwadr]"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2018-03-09001-0-000006704", "text": "Department Manager Data Science and Issue Management

NestlÃ© â€” Lausanne

Department Manager Data Science and Issue Management(Job Number: 180001EM)

Description

Department Manager Data Science and Issue Management

NestlÃ© Research Center, Lausanne, Switzerland           Undefined period of time contract, act. rate 100%

Over the last 5 years, the 600-staff NRC has published around 1000 scientific publications in peer review journals and files about 80 patents every year. The NRC also has around 100 research collaborations with universities or research institutes around the world. The NRC is organized with three large research institutes for Nutritional Science, Materials Science and Food Safety & Analytical Science. Research Units focusing on Clinical Development, and PetCare, complement these major Institutes. The NRC plays an important role in providing the science behind healthier products (learn more about the NRC at [wwwadr]).

Lausanne is home to the two strongholds of NestlÃ©'s fundamental research: the NestlÃ© Research Center (NRC) and the NestlÃ© Institute of Health Sciences (NIHS) that investigate the complex interactions between nutrition, health and wellness.

Demonstrating excellent communication skills and leadership, you will be responsible to propose the overall research strategy and to ensure appropriate competence and resource allocation to support R&D, Organization, Businesses and Operations in key areas such as early issue management, laboratory management and data science.  

Key responsibilities

	Drive â€œbig dataâ€ initiatives of the Institute, ensuring availability of appropriate tools to support key projects and help devise new digital surveillance approaches at Operational level
	Coach and develop scientists to cope with current and future needs of the company 
	Build a strong external alliance and ensure internal aligned strategy (digital, bioinformatics) with the key functions                                   
	Develop/build a research strategy to address future challenges in data sciences, aligned to the Institutes research priorities
	Attract talents, lead and develop staff to ensure availability and capacity in bioinformatics/statistics, laboratory performance and early issue identification & management                                              

Required Profile

	Preferably PhD in Mathematics/ Statistics, or related field
	Strong expertise in â€œbig dataâ€, Machine learning and Artificial Intelligence applied to life sciences
	Externally recognized expertise and credibility in the field of bioinformatics and data sciences
	Experience and high-level competence in data science / software tools and approaches
	Experience in elaborating and implementing research strategy/program
	At least 5 years' experience in leading and managing expert groups
	Experience in coaching and developing people
	Fluent in English 

Show us that you have strong enthusiasm for research in bioinformatics and strong interest and commitment for consumer safety. Your capacity to work in a fast pace and constantly changing environment, combined with capacity to enable results through others will be key element. Your courage to speak out, defend opinions and influence with integrity is what will set you apart among the other candidates. If your profile corresponds to the description and if you wish to make a difference to our performance, please apply in English at [wwwadr]

The NestlÃ© Group is the world's largest food and beverage company with 89,5 billion Swiss Francs in sales in 2016. It is present in 191 countries around the world, has 418 factories and its 328,000 employees are committed to NestlÃ©'s purpose of enhancing quality of life and contributing to a healthier future. NestlÃ© offers a wide portfolio of products and services for people and their pets throughout their lives. Its more than 2000 brands range from global icons like NescafÃ© or Nespresso to local favourites. Company performance is driven by its Nutrition, Health and Wellness strategy. NestlÃ© is based in the Swiss town of Vevey where it was founded more than 150 years ago. Learn more about our Group and reasons to join us on [wwwadr]

Primary Location: Switzerland-VD-Lausanne
Job: Research/Development
Organization: Nestec S.A.
Schedule: Full-time

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2018-03-09003-0-000017500", "text": "Java developer 100% (m/f)  with flair for machine learning algorithms

About the company

Formed in 2017 by the combination of Misys and D+H, we provide the broadest portfolio of financial services software in the world today: spanning retail banking, transaction banking, lending, capital markets and treasury. We are the third largest FinTech Company in the world.

Our solutions enable customers to deploy mission critical technology on premises or in the cloud. With our scale and geographical reach we drive valued solutions and opportunity for customers regardless of size or geography. Through our open, secure, and reliable solutions, we empower customers to accelerate growth, optimize cost, mitigate risk and continually evolve to meet their changing needs.

As part of our Innovation team based in Baden, Switzerland, we are looking for a dynamic, highly skilled, passionate and agile Java developer with flair for machine learning algorithms to help us build cool products for the FinTech industry.
Java developer 100% (m/f) with flair for machine learning algorithms

Responsibilities & Deliverables:

	Design, develop and implement mission critical systems - MVP, Prototypes, Pilot and Productization
	Review design suggestions and ensure the delivered code fulfils the expected level of quality
	Innovation using modern AI and machine learning technologies
	Liaise with the business to capture and specify epics and break them down into user stories
	Ability to produce high quality code quickly in MVP quality for early market testing
	Be an active team player in an Agile development environment

Required Experience:

	Education to degree level in Computer Science or other technical related field
	The ideal candidate should typically have 5+ yearsâ€™ professional experience in software development, or equivalent capabilities
	Ability to manage optimization using algorithms, statistical learning, predictive techniques or machine learning
	Hands-on Enterprise level system development using Core Java (up to Java 8) and JEE (JBoss Wildfly/EAP 7, Tomcat) or similar app servers; advanced experience of OSGi, Cloud, Maven and Messaging Systems such as MQ, JMS, HornetQ
	Hands-on experience of using Oracle (INGRES a bonus) â€“ SQL, interfacing and optimization
	Strong preference will be given to candidates who have recently worked in the field of AI and machine learning
	Nice to have experience with banking/financial services domain experience

What will work well with our team?

	We take a pragmatic approach to our work in an environment that blends fun with professionalism
	Good communication skills (English language skills, German or French an advantage) and easy going manner
	We strongly believe in a team with great attitude and positive mindset working in an open and collaborative culture
	Comfortable working under pressure to firm deadlines in an agile and lean way, in a multiple scrum team environment
	Passion to produce great quality software and seeing innovation ideas coming quickly to market
	Understanding of FinTech environment/software products
	Curious mind and creative thinking above the average required

Why work for Finastra?

At Finastra we are changing the world of financial services. We unlock the potential of people and businesses in finance, creating a platform for open innovation through our incredible ecosystem and talent in more than 40 countries across the world. We revel in global knowledge sharing, diversity and opportunity and that puts Finastra in the best position to create client value as we cooperate and co-create, together. Each one of our 10,000 people is part of one team, leveraging the wealth of our collective knowledge, passion and creativity. This is your opportunity to join a world-class FinTech team, working with people who are leading the financial services/FinTech industry through innovation, growth and value.

What we offer:

A challenging and interesting role in an international, matrix-structured and dynamic corporate environment. This is your chance to join a highly innovative team in a global environment with a potential for development. You will encounter a friendly atmosphere with an entrepreneur mentality. We offer you a permanent employment with a competitive package.

If you think you are the right person to explore this opportunity and also passionate about creating forward-thinking solutions that fit clientsâ€™ needs, then we look forward to receiving your online application.

Finastra Switzerland GmbH, BÃ¤derstrasse 29, CH-5400 CH-Baden, Fabio Ciaffone / [email]"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2018-03-09014-0-000026775", "text": "Consulting - Supply Chain Management, Procurement, (Senior) Consultant

Logo: Deloitte
Consulting - Supply Chain Management, Procurement, (Senior) Consultant

Location: Zurich, German Region, Switzerland

Firm Service: Management Consulting

Reference Code: 100361
Job Description

We are international, entrepreneurial and growing fast. Grow your career with us! 

Deloitte is one of the world's leading auditing and advisory firms in the areas of Audit and Risk Advisory, Tax, Consulting and Financial Advisory. In Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Bern, Basel, Geneva, Lausanne and Lugano.

Our Consulting team is looking for you! 

Deloitte Consulting is one of the fastest growing business consultancy firms in Switzerland. Our experts develop strategies and solutions that help our customers manage even the most complex of problems. Is business consultancy your kind of work? Then we're the right company for you.

Our Procurement advisory team is growing fast in Switzerland in response to the market demand for our consulting services. We are a global leader in (Digital) Procurement transformation with a substantial track record in improving Sourcing & Procurement functions across all industries. 

Deloitte offers you national and international career opportunities as well as a broad internal and external training programme.

What you can expect from us 

You will work with a variety of high profile clients across all the major industry sectors. Typical projects might include new procurement operating models, from analysis, vision and strategy to transforming the entire client function including shared services and Procurement technology. We are also on the forefront of Digital Procurement advisory where you will be in touch with Cognitive and AI technology solutions. Our projects focus on making sustainable change happen with our clients, in spirit of Deloitte: less talking, more doing.

	â€¢  We offer you a varied and challenging role in a fast growing company.

	â€¢  Given our customer base, our projects have a strong international flavour and offer you the chance to be self-motivated and creative. 

	â€¢  As a member of our highly motivated, multicultural team, you can expect new challenges every day.

Your qualifications

	â€¢  University degree (master's, MBA or PhD). 

	â€¢  Up to 5 year's professional experience in a relevant consulting or industry role. 

	â€¢  Experience in handling Sourcing & Procurement processes, Source-to-Contract (S2C, incl. category management, supplier relationship management), Procure-To-Pay (P2P)

	â€¢  Some understanding of advanced category management, sourcing skills, digital procurement and procurement technology (e.g. SAPAriba) would be of advantage

	â€¢  You communicate confidently in English and least another language, preferably German or French. Any further languages would be an advantage.

Any questions? Get in touch.

We look forward to hearing from you! Please submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates, using our online career portal [wwwadr] 

If you have any questions, please contact Rebecca Bickford on [email].

Requisition code: 100361"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2018-03-09018-0-000024380", "text": "Risk Advisory - Risk Analytics, Consultant

Risk Advisory - Risk Analytics, Consultant
Deloitte Switzerland

Zurich, German Region, Switzerland

	Share via LinkedIn Share via Xing Share via Facebook Share via Twitter Share via Email 

Position summary

We are international, entrepreneurial and growing fast. Grow your career with us!

Deloitte Switzerland Risk Advisory

Our risk advisory experts advise our clients on how to effectively manage and optimize strategic, technological, operational, and financial risks in the midst of transformation.

Deloitte Switzerland is made up of intellectually curious, smart people, including experts in advanced analytics, including machine learning, artificial intelligence and cognitive analytics. Our people are at the heart of our organisation and it is their entrepreneurial spirit that is making an impact to clients and driving our success. The innovative culture of our people not only differentiates Deloitte in Switzerland but also acts as one of our greatest competitive advantages in the marketplace. We work on some of the most advanced, transformational projects happening in Switzerland which provides growth opportunities for our people. In addition, you will have the opportunity to identify areas of work which are of particular interest to you. You can drill deep and become an expert, grow as a generalist or specialise within an industry sector. Your mix of work will help foster your leadership skills and youâ€™ll develop a peer group whom you respect and have fun with.

Deloitte Risk Analytics Services

The financial services marketplace continues to undergo a significant transformation in deriving valuable information to proactively manage key business and technology risks, achieve greater efficiency and effectiveness in operations, and stay ahead of the curve in customer experience and relationship management. Supporting as an integrated part of our core Risk Advisory Services, our Risk Analytics function works with leading global banks, asset managers, wealth managers and insurers to combine significant knowledge of business strategy and risk with a range of analytical tools and technologies to derive valuable management-level insights to complex challenges. The team combines a wealth of in-depth industry knowledge with both business advisory experience and technical expertise. With this team, our clients receive the full spectrum of insights on key strategic, regulatory, financial, operational and insurance related risks, and new opportunities to grow, through current state assessments to large-scale transformation programmes.

As an experienced and respected business, risk and information technology professional, you will be a major contributor to lead the delivery of high quality results to our national and international financial services clients in Switzerland.

What we offer

	We offer you a varied and challenging task in our fast growing company
	As an interface between technology and business, you are involved in projects on the following topics: Financial Crime, Regulation & Legal Change, Business Risk, Innovation and Technology
	In the various projects, you gradually assume tasks and responsibility for solving complex problems.
	To start with us in a multicultural, team-oriented environment with flat hierarchies. 

What we expect

	Degree from a university or technical college in computer science, business informatics, mathematics, physics or the like.
	Experience with data tools such as SQL, Access/Excel, SAS or R.
	Practical experience with programming languages such as Python Java, C#, .Net or ABAP.
	You think analytically and in a structured manner to address complex business-related topics with support of data analysis.
	You communicate confidently in German and English. Any further languages would be an advantage. 

About Deloitte

Deloitte is one of the worldâ€™s leading professional services firms in the areas of Audit and Risk Advisory, Tax, Consulting and Financial Advisory. In Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Bern, Basel, Geneva, Lausanne and Lugano.

Our approach combines insights and innovation from multiple disciplines with global business and industry expertise to help our clients excel anywhere in the world. As trusted advisors to some of Switzerlandâ€™s largest organizations, we delivery outstanding impact on the reputation and success of clients in Switzerland and globally. In pursuing this we contribute to a sustainable and prosperous society, and are firm believers in the positive impact business can and should have on the world it operates in.

We also foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work in an agile and dynamic environment. We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture.  We are open to discussing with candidates the different ways in which we are able to support agile ways of working. 	What you can expect?

You will be working with experienced researchers here in Zurich and challenging large data sets that are normally unavailable to the public, while using technologies of the future (Scala, Spark, SciPy). For this position, we are looking for hackers: people who can whip up quick solutions using the best languages and frameworks available.
We are looking for interns to help build prototypes and deliver projects for our Smart City and mobility customers, using data to understand transportation, tourism, and urban planning problems. 	â€¢  Well-versed in at least one JVM programming language (we use Scala)

	â€¢  Competent Linux/Mac user and comfortable with the command line.

	â€¢  Familiar with relational databases, preferably PostgreSQL.

	â€¢  Working knowledge of mathematics and statistics.

	â€¢  Familiarity with a distributed computing framework such as Hadoop, Spark, or Storm. We also use Mesos and Docker.

	â€¢  Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and tools: you know the difference between clustering and classification, and heteroskedasticity doesnt need a dictionary.

	â€¢  Familiarity with location data and tools for Geographic Information Systems (GIS). We like PostGIS, QGIS, and OpenStreetMaps.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2019-03-00009-0-000000147", "text": "Sourcing Manager / Strategic BI Manager

Sourcing Manager / Strategic BI Manager

Locations: Zug, Switzerland

Functions: Sourcing

Start a new job search

Apply

Get Referred

Job Description

Requisition ID: 1905715978W

Johnson & Johnson Consumer Europe is a leading supplier of Fast Moving Consumer / OTC Goods. Our products are produced and distributed in all major EMEA countries and exported overseas.

The EMEA Strategic Sourcing team sources Raw Materials, Packaging Materials and Externally Manufactured finished goods for the J&J Group of Consumer Companies which are aligned with the demand from the GFOâ€™s and the Global Supply Chain.

We do this by building and implementing sourcing strategies that develop a world class network of best value suppliers meeting J&J Business needs of supply quality and reliability, responsiveness, cost competitiveness and access to technology innovation that fuels superior growth. 

The position of Sourcing Manager / Strategic Business Intelligence Manager is combining the responsibility of managing a distinct category / supplier portfolio as well providing BI Strategies, Analytics and tools to the entire EMEA Sourcing Team. In this role, you will be responsible for one or more commodity / technology areas, with a total average spend of approx. $50MM. The complexity of a Strategic Sourcing Manager portfolio is a product of the number of materials (up to several hundred), the concerned technologies, the number of supplier relationships to manage (up to 50), the number of SKUs (up to several thousand) and the number of Brands/Franchises supported (up to 25). In parallel you will be focusing on BI technologies, providing Analytics & Insights to the full team, drive the deployment of our Data Lake platform and enable better E2E decision making for all Sourcing Managers.

This is only possible through having great knowledge of suppliers, their industries, products/ services and being an excellent collaborator with Business Value Chains (Plant Materials Management and Planning, Manufacturing, New Product Introduction) R&D, Franchise Management, Quality, Technical Assurance, Legal, Regulatory teams and ad hoc project teams. Business Intelligence, the supporting tools and processes are an essential part of the distinct Sourcing Manager role but also build the backbone for Sourcing Excellence of our teams and hence must equally be focused on.

A Strategic Sourcing Manager / Strategic BI Manager will be expected to have comprehensive understanding and knowledge of both J&J external and internal environments, namely:

	â€¢  Supplier strategies, operations,  processes, economic viability and any associated risks

	â€¢  Technical attributes of materials /services

	â€¢  Cost structure of materials/services

	â€¢  Supplier sustainability and innovation capabilities

	â€¢  J&J Franchise Business Strategy

	â€¢  J&J R&D Pipeline initiatives J&J Quality and Technical Assurance Requirements

	â€¢  Our end-to-end Strategic Sourcing processes and supporting tools

	â€¢  J&J IT infrastructure and advanced BI technologies internally and externally

	â€¢  Source Finance processes and Source performance measurements

	â€¢  Internal Data Requirements & Data ownership

Qualifications

TYPE OF EXPERIENCE

	Experience working in an international and cross-functional environment is required

	Experience in Manufacturing, Supply Chain, Strategic Sourcing and/or Purchasing is required

	Experience working in the area of FMCG (Fast Moving Consumer Goods) and/or OTC is very desirable

PROFILE

	Self starter with high integrity and ethical behavior

	Partnership, collaboration and teamwork skills

	Analytical Decision Making skills

	Demonstrated ability to work in a matrix environment and customer / supply base

	Curiosity for advanced BI technologies (e.g. Machine Learning, Blockchain etc.)

	Cultural sensitivity â€“ previous exposure to cultural diversity

	Knowledge of general manufacturing principles and practices

	Knowledge of new product commercialization processes

	Knowledge of compliance requirements (cGMP, GMPâ€™s, DEA, etc)

	Fluent in English, writing, reading, speaking and listening

	Personal computer proficiency

Primary Location

Switzerland-Zug-Zug-

Organization

Cilag GmbH International (8525)

Job Function

Sourcing

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2019-03-00142-0-000003796", "text": "Assistant in Audit & Technology Assurance for Corporate and Financial Services Industry (Geneva or ZÃ¼rich 100%)

Career Start: Assistant in Audit & Technology Assurance for Corporate and Financial Services Industry (Geneva or ZÃ¼rich 100%)

Deloitte Switzerland

	Zurich, German Region, Switzerland Geneva, French Region, Switzerland 

Add to job cart

Back to search results

Position summary

The Audit profession is rapidly transforming. New technologies enable smarter and more advanced audits.

We offer a career path that enables you to build a dual profile both as an (1) Financial Statement Audit professional and (2) a Technology Audit specialist. As a member of our Audit & Technology Assurance unit you will work in both areas: Audit and Technology. On the Audit side you will work on Financial Statement Audit Mandates and follow the professional qualification path to become a Certified Public Accountant. On the Technology side you will work directly as part of our Audit Technology team and learn how to apply smart technologies such as Data Analytics, Cognitive and Robotics Process Automation to transform the audit process. In your everyday role you will work in multidisciplinary teams. Your projects will take you to several countries and you will work with international teams from the UK, France, Asia, US and many others.

Deloitte offers you national and international career opportunities as well as a comprehensive internal and external training program (e.g. Certified Public Accountant Qualification, Data Science Professional training and certification, Data Visualization training, etc.).

Responsibilities

	â€¢  Participate in Financial Statement Audits as part of our national and international engagements

	â€¢  You will be auditing areas such as balance sheets, income statements, cash flow statements as well as different areas of internal control frameworks

	â€¢  You will be embarking on a long-term career path and follow the professional qualification to become a Chartered Accountant as well as other relevant trainings for your profile

	â€¢  With the dual profile audit and technology you will develop a future oriented auditor profile that allows you to understand and apply the key audit approach and technologies relevant for delivering state-of-the art audits

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2019-03-00470-0-000003001", "text": "Post-Doctoral Researcher in Deep Learning

Â«A place where knowledge is createdÂ» - As one of Europe's leading universities of economics and business administration, the University of St.Gallen (HSG), Switzerland, is committed to the education of over 8500 students and is one of the largest employers in the region, providing around 3100 employees with an attractive and innovative environment for research.

The newly founded Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning [AI:ML] group headed by Prof. Dr. Damian Borth at the University of St. Gallen (HSG) is seeking two candidates for PhD positions in Deep Learning. Both PhD positions are part of a research project funded in the area of Deep Learning with particular focus on generative approaches.

Post-Doctoral Researcher in Deep Learning

The ideal candidate will have a PhD in computer science or closely related field, with demonstrated background in statistical analysis, signal processing, machine learning and deep learning. In this position, you will focus on developing novel deep neural networks (DNN) architectures and learning algorithms to generate synthetic data of multiple modalities and style transfer to multiple visual and auditory styles.

In addition to the outlined research direction, the candidate will also assist in managing the project, directing the research of undergraduate and graduate students, supervising research across the team, and coordinating project deliverables for the sponsor.

We are looking for you, if you have

	completed PhD in Computer Science or equivalent degree by the time of appointment.

	confidence in leading a group of PhD researchers to design and evaluate novel deep neural networks (DNN) architectures

	experience with NVIDIA GPU platform (DGX-2 is a plus) for large-scale DNN training.

	experience with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch and/or TensorFlow.

	a rising track record in peer-reviewed research in the respective topic area

	experience in supervising students and teaching university-level courses is a plus

	excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

Your international mindset paired with your ambition to excel in research and teaching are core qualifications that you bring to our team and projects.

You can expect to collaborate within a newly founded group of highly motivated individuals in a high velocity research environment at one of the most beautiful places in Switzerland surrounded by the Lake Constance and the Swiss mountains.

The University of St.Gallen (HSG) commits itself to increasing the number of international and female scholars among its faculty. Therefore, we especially welcome applications from international scholars and women.

Candidates should submit their application, including a cover letter, curriculum vitae, references, publications list, teaching experience, and three publications that best represent their current research profile, in electronic form with the button below.

Applications will be considered until the position is filled.

Apply online

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2019-03-00483-0-000003868", "text": "Senior Asset Management IT Management Consultant (80%-100%)

Location: 

Adliswil, ZH, CH

Senior Asset Management IT Management Consultant (80%-100%) 

About Swiss Re

The Swiss Re Group is one of the worldâ€™s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. It anticipates and manages risk â€“ from natural catastrophes to climate change, from ageing populations to cybercrime. The aim of the Swiss Re Group is to enable society to thrive and progress, creating new opportunities and solutions for its clients. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, where it was founded in 1863, the Swiss Re Group operates through a network of around 80 offices globally. It is organised into three Business Units, each with a distinct strategy and set of objectives contributing to the Groupâ€™s overall mission.

About the Role

For this position, we invite people with a consistent track record within the consultancy industry focused on global financial markets and digital technologies. You will support the AM IT Management with the development and implementation of the digital strategy as well as several additional initiatives around Digital/Innovation topics and people development across our different locations.

We want you to burn for the following topics:

	designing the digital future of Swiss Re Asset Management

	engaging with multi-functional networks across the entire company

	working with the department head and the management team on strategic digital, human capital and functional topics

	networking and collaborate? with Swiss and international FinTechs and with peers in the financial markets

	leading projects

	working  in different locations (Bratislava, London, New York, Zurich)

Then you need to apply for this position!

About the Team

With more than USD 150 bn of assets under management, Swiss Re Asset Management manages the assets generated through the core insurance and reinsurance business. With the advent of technologies such as cognitive computing, smart analytics or machine learning the asset management landscape will radically change in the next years in terms of distribution, investment process and investment administration. We in Asset Management IT drive this digital transformation with innovation spirit and out of the box thinking. Our passionate and smart team is happy to welcome a new peer who has a background in management consulting and digital technologies and who is seeking for this exciting possibility We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.

About You

	You have 3-5 years' experience in the consultancy industry - you worked on strategic topics around the financial markets industry, digital transformation programs or similar; best with a focus on Asset Management.

	You hold an excellent degree in an applicable discipline: e.g., computer science, business administration, engineering, international business/finance, statistics, applied mathematics, physics, operational research - Master or Ph.D. preferred.

	You pitched proposals to clients and senior management and communicated complex analysis results in a clear, precise and actionable manner.

	You are innovative, change driven, committed and collaborative by nature and you delivered projects and worked within integrated, multi-disciplinary project teams.

	You understand social media and its power and have excellent verbal and written English skills.

	A flexible, independent and can-do workstyle is required as well as the ability to work well on multiple and conflicting priorities.

Helpful knowledge/experience (considered as a plus)

	Digital topics like cognitive computing, machine learning and robo-advisors

	Trading, Finance, Risk

	Systems thinking background

	Multi-lingual

To be able to get a most precise insight of your motivation and skills please attach a letter to your application that makes it obvious to us that we need to take you to the next level in the selection process. We are looking forward to receive your inspiring application (including your certificates/diplomas and reference letters).

Keywords:	

Reference Code: 83714"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2019-03-00489-0-000003896", "text": "Managing Consultant SAP S/4HANA FI/CO Processes (m/f/x)

Managing Consultant SAP S/4HANA FI/CO Processes (m/f/x)

Job Description

Welcome to IBM Services team!

As one of the world's leading technology consultancies, we are the smart evolutionary organisation that is taking our clients across all industries to a new digital age. We drive the implementation of future technologies and open up completely new ways of cooperation for our customers: between humans as well as between humans and machines.

What does this mean for you? A variety of agile projects and best development opportunities with a global player who appreciates your creativity and individuality, who unleashes your potential and turns your professional life into a gripping success story.

We see SAP S/4HANA as the foundation for the intelligent future. Our process consultants design and implement SAP S/4HANA processes and complement them with Robotics, Industry 4.0, Blockchain, IoT, Cloud, Watson / Cognitive Technologies and Data Analytics solutions.

As Managing Consultant, you will guide our customers from strategic definition, project scoping through to successful implementation. You will be the key driver behind innovation.

Your responsibilities

	You will work closely with our clients and help them develop analyses and concepts in order to optimize and implement their business processes

	You will advise, select, implement and further develop SAP S/4HANA solutions in the areas of digitalization, Internet of Things, Watson, Industry 4.0, Cloud, Watson

	You will work on international SAP S/4HANA projects and apply Agile principles to your work

	You will be leading project teams

	You will be actively involved in our IBM internal communities

You can expect

	A global network of experts working on the future of Intelligent Enterprise

	Tailored role that takes into account your passions, strengths and personal interests

	Personal career development in a global company that adapts to your life aspirations and development

	Performance-based payment

	Flexible working model

	Attractive additional benefits, such as company cars, pension plan and company health program ("GesundheitsTicket")

	Mentoring and targeted training in new topics and trends

	An environment where you are encouraged to develop, where fresh ideas and new perspectives are more than welcomed

Your Profile

	Experience in SAP S/4HANA FI/CO

	Good understanding of the needs of the client

	A strong communicator with excellent negotiation skills and growth mindset

	Strong ability to analyse complex situations and solving problems

Ringier is Switzerland's largest internationally active media company, producing over 120 newspapers and magazines. It also runs printing plants, several radio and TV stations and well over 200 web and mobile platforms AND HAS a worldwide staff of about 6,500 employees.

With a history stretching back more than 180 years, Ringier stands for pioneering spirit and individuality as well as independence, freedom of expression and diversity of information. The company is characterised by product excellence, quality journalism and exceptional entertainment. Founded in Switzerland in 1833, Ringier has been family run for five generations.

12 years ago, Ringier took on the challenge to transform into a digital powerhouse. In 2016, Ringier built the Data Services department reporting directly to the group executive board, to unleash the power of technology and data to break the data silos of portfolio companies and enable a Ringier ecosystem. Embracing the agile methodology and engineering excellence principle, the Data Services team has built Sherlock Platform --the cloud-native enterprise data hub with built-in Artificial Intelligence capabilities-- to collect, consolidate, and understand the data to generate business insights. The platform won several Global BIGGIES and INMA prizes in 2018. To support the creation of a new type of SaaS-based offering with the great Problem/Solution/Market-fit, we are searching for a:

Product Owner (f/m)

	Startup environment with secured funding

	Training on the job (own responsibilities with senior support)

	A flexible and central workplace in Munich

Managing the product backlog and conducting the overarching release planning

Create an adequate feedback system and KPIs as to direct the product development efforts

	Operational level

Creation of use cases, requirements and user stories for product development; working with developers to answer questions and clarifying requirements

Leads requirements gathering effort on an epic level as needed - consulting with product management, implementations, customers, and other stakeholders

Run workshops in different settings with customers, partners, developers, corporate

Can support (pre-)sales activities both on a strategic as well as operational level

Your profile

	Several years of professional experience in agile software product development (SCRUM/Kanban) necessary

	Experience working with near-shore development teams

	Experience in managing the complete lifecycle of a product

	Particular experience in New Product Development processes and achieving product/market fit

	Problem-oriented approach and excellent communication and people skills

	Fluent in German and English

	Preferably some experience / background in the media industry

Are you interested? We are looking forward to your application.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2019-03-00544-0-000004225", "text": "Assistant Manager or Manager Technology Assurance Corporate Sector

KPMG

Apply now

Assistant Manager or Manager Technology Assurance Corporate Sector

Are you looking for a new and diverse challenge where you actively contribute to the growth of the Assurance Technology Group (ATG) at KPMG? Our and our clients' business environment is continuously changing at great speed. Technological innovations are at the top of our agenda. KPMG's ATG combines the fields of Audit and Technology, thus bringing innovative risk solutions to our clients. Topics involved are data analytics, test automation and cloud security as well as future trends, such as robotics and artificial intelligence.

Location: Zurich

Start date: By arrangement

Responsibilities & Profile

Your responsibilities

	You will act as engagement manager for external and internal audits and risk advisory projects covering ERP system landscapes, IT-supported business processes, analytics and technology innovation

	You will manage engagement teams on client projects (allocating work packages, monitoring engagement executing, mentoring staff) and support solution development activities

	You will continuously develop your knowledge and expertise in technology domains and as such you help our clients and KPMG to innovate

	You will closely collaborate with other KPMG teams both in Switzerland and internationally while working on multidisciplinary projects

	You independently generate new business through proactive building relationship and solution development

Your profile

	Bachelor or Master Degree in economics or business informatics; CISA certification is a strong plus

	More than 4 years of professional experience in performing IT audits of ERP systems and business processes, preferably within a Big 4 environment

	Experience in leading teams and coaching people

	Well-founded risk & compliance knowledge and excellent understanding of technology trends and innovation (e.g. SAP HANA, robotics)

	Flexible regarding working hours and location. Strong focus on clients and in finding the best/innovative solution for them

	Communicative, motivated, solution oriented and client-focused personality

	Fluency in German and English is crucial for this role

	Willing to travel domestically and abroad on client engagements

Benefits

Targeted career development and internal and external attractive training and further education options

Possibilities for global and Switzerland-wide mobility across all sectors and locations

25-30 days of leave, option for compensation of overtime (with the exception of management staff); management staff receive an additional 4 to 6 days of leave

Maternity leave of 16 weeks, paternity leave of 5 days and free advice from the external family service

Ancillary benefits may apply to certain positions (e.g. fixed-contract positions).

KPMG as an employer

Your future team

We are known for our professionalism, expertise and personal engagement. We offer you an attractive business environment and working atmosphere, support your training and continuing education and foster your career and personal development. You will be able to expand your knowledge and Know-how with on-the-job trainings, coaching sessions, internal trainings and certifications.

About KPMG

KPMG is known for providing clear and consistent solutions in the areas of auditing and advisory services. The broad palette of services across many subject matters and industries allows the provision of multidisciplinary services from a single source for our clients on the one hand and diverse careers and development options for our employees on the other hand. Our dealings are fair and frank and we strive to always look at the results of our work through the eyes of our clients. At KPMG, we are aware that if we add value for our clients, we also do the same for ourselves.

Contact person

David Boll

Human Resources

+41 58 249 67 21

kpmg.ch/careers

David Boll

To apply for this vacancy, please provide your cover letter, CV and all relevant certificates. We look forward to receiving your application."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2019-03-00941-0-000000297", "text": "Postdoctoral Position

Postdoctoral Position: Chemical Screen on Hydra Regeneration

A postdoctoral position is available in the group of Charisios Tsiairis to identify factors regulating Hydra regeneration employing high content chemical screening. Our laboratory is located at the Friedrich Miescher Institute for Biomedical Research (FMI) and we combine genetics, live cell imaging and quantitative analysis to understand how cells communicate and change their behavior in order to build a functional tissue.

The successful candidate will study regeneration of the freshwater polyp Hydra and the ability of a piece of tissue to re-organize around newly established Wnt signaling centers. We aim to screen a set of chemicals with characterized biological targets in order to discover components affecting the appearance of the Wnt organizer and the downstream patterning events. We will employ transgenic Hydras with fluorescent markers for organizer to visualize and quantitatively extract the effect of each chemical perturbation. This effort involves surgical manipulations of Hydra animals, use of robotics, high throughput imaging and image analysis. We are looking for a highly motivated individual who has experience in chemical screening and/or quantitative image analysis. Some familiarity with the Hydra/Cnidarian model system is welcome but not absolutely necessary. Excellent communication and organization skills, and the ability to work as a team member are expected. A competitive salary and access to state-of-the-art research facilities will be provided.

The FMI, affiliated with the University of Basel and the Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research, is an international institute aimed at understanding the basic molecular mechanisms of health and disease. It is situated in Basel, Switzerland, a city in the centre of Europe offering an outstanding scientific and cultural environment.

Applications should be submitted electronically at [wwwadr] and include a motivation letter, CV and names and email addresses of referees.

The FMI is committed to raising the proportion of women in science; we thus strongly encourage female researchers to apply

For further information, please contact Charisios Tsiairis, [email].

[wwwadr]

[wwwadr]"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2019-03-01211-0-000003115", "text": "Global Senior Manager Digital Finance

Novartis Schweiz

Global Senior Manager Digital Finance

Sourcing Statement

You are applying to be part of the Novartis Talent Pool. We are not currently recruiting for this role but we are building a pipeline for future opportunities. If you would like to be considered for a similar position in future, then please submit your CV.

Stellenbeschreibung

Within our team in Basel headquarters, Global Senior Manager Digital Finance (GMDF) serves as advisor to Senior Pharma Management (incl. CFO and CEO) for both tactical and strategic questions. At global scale, she or he combines business understanding, financial skills and digital tools to trans-late internal and external information into financially driven plans and recommendations that shape the business of the Pharmaceuticals Business Unit within the Novartis Group. Directly interacting with finance colleagues in our major business entities (large countries and re-gions) along short- and long-term horizons (from next month and next quarter to 5 years), the GMDF develops a comprehensive financial picture for the entire Business Unit. Internal and external risk assessments and mitigation strategies complement every plan. Self-driven and autonomous, the GMDF can also assume the role of a consultant and drive high visibility projects within our matrix organization.

She or he is not afraid of being disruptive at a global scale. As a digital native, the GMDF knows when, where and how to employ machine learning and AI approaches for financial insights and guides the relevant in-house experts to develop them. She or he is a modern team player and collaborates to win with virtual teams across the globe, including colleagues in Barcelona and Hyderabad.

When joining our team, you are joining us for the long term. You will find a company that will stretch you and invest in your professional growth. That will expose you to some of the best business and finance leaders in the pharmaceutical industry. That is fast-paced and sees change as an opportunity. That will make you work with digital experts, from data scientists to app developers.

Mindestanforderungen

	â€¢  University or post-graduate degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration or a highly quantitative field

	â€¢  Aptitude for analytics and strong quantitative problem-solving skills

	â€¢  High learning agility, creative and innovative mind-set, resilience

	â€¢  English skills allowing to communicate complex ideas effectively

	â€¢  3-8 years of relevant work experience, part of which in a leading management consulting firm.

Why consider Novartis?

927 million. Thatâ€™s how many lives our products touched in 2017. And while weâ€™re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more peopleâ€™s lives?

We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where youâ€™re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where youâ€™re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where youâ€™re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the worldâ€™s toughest medical challenges.

We are Novartis. Join us and help us reimagine medicine.

Land: Switzerland

Standort: Basel

ABB's Corporate Research switchgear group focusses its research and development on improving the understanding of the complex physical behavior of switching devices. {"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2019-03-01776-0-000000211", "text": "Internship - Analog front-end electronics for metal thickness gauging

Internship - Analog front-end electronics for metal thickness gauging

JETZT BEWERBEN   STELLE ALS FAVORIT SPEICHERN

ABB Corporate Research, in close collaboration with varied ABB business areas, is developing the foundations for the next generation of ABB products. We would like to give a highly-motivated student the opportunity to complete a six-month internship in the area of analog circuit design. You will be part of the Integrated Sensor Systems group, joining a team of electrical engineers and data scientists. ABBâ€™s millmate thickness gauging system is based on pulsed eddy current technology, which uses magnetic fields for measuring metal sheet thickness in industrial environments. The interaction between an applied magnetic field and the electrically conductive strip indicates the thickness - without influence from material composition or conditions at the measuring interface. During your internship, you will be working on the analog front-end for the next generation millmate thicknes gauge. More precisely, you will be looking at ways to increase the speed and lower the noise of the present electronics in order to enable the new product to measure thinner strips with higher accuracy.

Aufgaben :

	â€¢  Get familiar with the operating principle of ABBâ€™s millmate thickness gauge as well as the present analog front-end electronics

	â€¢  Propose, design, develop, and test the new front-end electronics. The main requirements are larger bandwidth and lower noise compared to the present design

	â€¢  Test the newly developed electronics in conjunction with the primary sensor

Anforderungen:

	â€¢  Master student in Electrical Engineering or related field; official enrollment essential

	â€¢  Solid understanding of analog electronics and physics

	â€¢  Ability to perform SPICE simulations, set up experiments, and carry out measurements

	â€¢  Fluent command of English, both written and spoken

Application Details:

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2019-03-01786-0-000001650", "text": "R&D Imaging Data Analysis Expert

R&D Imaging Data Analysis Expert

Switzerland, Basel-City, Basel Headquarter

At Roche, we believe itâ€™s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now â€“ even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patientsâ€™ lives and we are fearless in both decision and action. And we believe that good business means a better world.

That is why we come to work each day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigor, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow.

Who We Are

The Roche Pharma Research and Early Development Informatics team is the bridge between digital technology and science. We help drive medical innovation and are integral to the realisation of truly Personalised Healthcare and the development of innovative treatments for our patients.

We are shaping the digitalisation of Pharma R&D at Roche, and we are growing. To continue to be the best scientific Informatics partner in the pharmaceutical industry, we need innovative, dedicated people from a wide variety of backgrounds as we realise our vision.

Currently, we are looking for two Research Informatics talents with expertise in (pre-)clinical imaging/omics data analysis and decision making to join us in driving an innovative strategy for Ophthalmology Precision Medicine for patients.

The Position

These responsibilities capture a portion of what your work will look like:

	You will be a thought leader and a key contributor to our strategic Ophthalmology Precision Medicine (OPM) initiative, with a focus on multi-modal (pre-)clinical imaging/omics data analysis and decision making by applying artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), deep learning (DL), and statistical data analysis methods

	You will establish and nurture effective partnerships with a wide range of researchers, clinicians, internal IT specialists and software companies to help answer existing scientific questions, and to recognize possibilities to apply advanced analytics for improving personalized prevention and personalized intervention

	You will propose and prototype appropriate informatics solutions and rigorously validate scientific models for answering OPM related questions, and collaborate with technical teams to optimise the solutions towards higher performance, robustness, and scalability to optimally support (pre-)clinical decision making

Who You Are

Youâ€™re someone who wants to influence your own development. You are looking for a company where you receive the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Working in a multi-cultural environment motivates you. As a fast learner you actively drive the quality of the requirements.

Qualifications:

	You have a university degree, preferably a PhD, in Computer Science, applied Mathematics, Statistics, Software Engineering or similar and several years of professional experience in life science or research informatics

	You are a quick learner, inspired by curiosity, who enjoys entering into new areas to build expertise and courageously and creatively takes initiative to see your ideas implemented through team work in a dynamic customer oriented environment

	You have advanced knowledge of multi-modal image and omics data analysis including the application of AI/ML/DL and statistical data analysis methods, and a profound understanding of their advantages/drawbacks for solving a given problem

	You bring a broad experience of algorithm development and end-to-end informatics solution delivery using both open source and commercial solutions

	You are attracted by the challenges of managing informatics projects, and navigate consciously and fluidly between strategic conceptual thinking and detail-oriented planning, prioritisation, and task management

	Your profile is rounded off by having very good presentation and communication skills in English

If you are proud of contributing and feel you have the dedication to teamwork and innovation that we are seeking, then Roche is the organization for you. Every role at Roche plays a part in making a difference to patientsâ€™ lives. If you want work in a passionate team, make your mark & improve lives, apply now.

Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

If you have questions, please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2019-03-01786-0-000001653", "text": "Data Scientist, PHC Analytics

Data Scientist, PHC Analytics

Switzerland, Basel-City, Basel Headquarter

United Kingdom, Hertfordshire, Welwyn

As a data scientist within our Personalized Health Care function specialising in supporting Roche country level teams (affiliates), you will work with stakeholders throughout the global organisation to use meaningful data to generate impactful evidence and insights on our molecules/ medicines and patients, that support R&D, advance scientific and medical knowledge, and enable personalized patient care and access.

You will collaborate with peers within the function and affiliates located around the world to develop evidence generation strategies, identify evidence gaps and data sources, design and execute studies, and implement analyses to address molecule and disease area questions. Source data will be diverse -- real-world data, including patient registries, electronic medical records, claims, biobanks, and clinical trials. The evidence and insights will be used to inform the research and development of our molecules, and support healthcare decisions by patients, physicians, health authorities, payers, and policy-makers. This will require a deep understanding of molecule and disease area strategies, healthcare environments, as well as strong scientific and technical data science expertise. You will need strong strategic, collaboration and communication skills, as well as a visionary mindset, to transform the way we use data and analytics to develop and deliver medicines for our patients.

As Data Scientist you will typically be responsible for a molecule/indication and partner with cross-functional teams and external organizations with considerable independence.

Responsibilities:

	Identify evidence needs & recommend data solutions: Ask the right scientific questions, understand the evidence needs for research and development, regulatory and market access, and ideate and make recommendations on fit-for-purpose data and analytics solutions.

	Develop data strategy & gain access to data: Develop strategic plans to access fit-for-purpose data sources to support evidence generation, and gain access to data through collaboration or data generation.

	Dive into data: Develop a comprehensive and deep understanding of the data we work with and foster learning with colleagues using analytical tools and applications to broaden data accessibility and advance our proficiency/efficiency in understanding and using the data appropriately.

	Be an expert in applying methods: Stay current with and adopt emergent analytical methodologies, tools and applications to ensure fit-for-purpose and impactful approaches.

	Produce high quality analyses: Apply rigor in study design and analytical methods; plan for data processing; design a fit-for-purpose analysis plan, assess effective ways of presenting and delivering the results to maximize impact and interpretability; implement and/or oversee the study, including its reporting; ensure compliance with applicable pharma industry regulations and standards.

	Interpret and share results: Communicate findings to internal stakeholders, regulatory, health technology assessment (HTA) bodies and scientific communities; publish results; participate in external meetings and forums to present your insights (e.g. congress/conference).

	Collaborate & craft: Collaborate and contribute to functional, cross-functional, enterprise-wide or external data science communities, networks, collaboratives, initiatives or goals on knowledge-sharing, methodologies, innovations, technology, IT infrastructure, policy-shaping, processes, etc. to enable broader and more effective use of data and analytics to support business.

Please, note that depending on your experience and qualifications, we may offer one of these titles: Associate Data Scientist, Data Scientist, Senior Data Scientist or Principle Data Scientist.

Minimum Qualifications:

	MSc, PhD or similar qualification in a quantitative data science discipline (e.g., statistics/ biostatistics, epidemiology, health economics, outcomes research, public health)

	Proven track record of developing and execution of data science research projects, patient-level data analyses (e.g., real world data, surveys, clinical trials, registries, claims) with publications and presentations

	Demonstrated experience with managing project scope and driving delivery in an evolving environment requiring proactivity and effective problem-solving and prioritization when faced with challenges

	Demonstrated strong collaboration skills and excellent communication skills

	Demonstrated entrepreneurial mindset and self-direction, ability to teach others and willingness to learn new techniques

	Proficiency in English, both written and verbal

Preferred/Additional Qualifications:

	PhD degree in a quantitative discipline as listed in Minimum Qualifications

	Fluency in statistical programming languages (R,Python, etc.)

	Experience implementing advanced analytics approaches (machine learning, longitudinal data analysis, etc.)

	Experience with technologies required to undertake analyses on large data sources or with computationally intensive steps (SQL, parallelization, Hadoop, Spark, etc.)

	Experience producing interactive outputs (Shiny, etc.)

	Contributor to open source packages, libraries or functions

	Experience implementing reproducible research practices like version control (e.g., using Git) and literate programming

Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

	Wer wir sind

	At Roche, 94,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, weâ€™ve become one of the worldâ€™s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

	Roche is an equal opportunity employer and strictly prohibits unlawful discrimination based upon an individualâ€™s race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, mental/physical disability, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job-Fakten

	Kontaktieren Sie uns

	Dr. Ignacio Fernandez Garcia"}
