{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2019-03-01875-0-000001295", "text": "Landscape Coordinator for Landscape Finance Lab

Landscape Coordinator for Landscape Finance Lab

Posted on 21 February 2019

Location: Flexible. All locations will be considered

Established in April 2016, the Landscape Finance Lab is incubating a portfolio of landscapes programs. Its purpose is to:

	Enable high quality landscape programs in global biodiversity priority places - using jurisdictional REDD+, land degradation neutrality, catchment management and landscape sourcing approaches

	Test innovative financing mechanisms - including private sector investment funds, impact investing platforms and public sector grant funding windows

	Build sector learning, capacity and impact through a global online learning community and producing tools, guidance and learning publications for them

The Lab portfolio and relative amount of work is constantly growing and there is a need for a Coordinator that will support the WWF Landscape Finance Lead and Landscape Lead to manage and develop the landscape programs portfolio.

We are recruiting the role of Landscape Coordinator for our International Secretariat to help us achieve our new ambitious goals, and build a future where people live in harmony with nature.

Location:

Flexible. All locations will be considered.

Work percentage:

50%

Contract type:

One year renewable contract

The Role:

The Landscapes Coordinator will support the Landscape Lead in managing the work of the Lab on incubating landscape programs, including service delivery to landscapes, development and management of the landscapes portfolio, coordination with other relevant Labâ€™s work, in particular on markets, finance and business solutions, as well as support to the Labâ€™s strategic management.

Main responsibilities:

Assist the Landscape Lead developing and managing of the landscapes portfolio

	Ensure the adequacy and development of the Labâ€™s value proposition and service offer on landscape incubation

	Monitor and actively manage the performance of the landscape portfolio though adequate tools (cf. portfolio dashboard, incentives, assigning and supporting the Labâ€™s landscape leads, team meetings...), including on the platform

	Develop financial instruments and raise fund for the Labâ€™s landscape incubation work

	Manage the matching funds for landscape incubation to support the development and progress of the landscape portfolio (cf. Labâ€™s call for proposal to landscapes...)

	Actively find new Landscape ideas, including to support markets incubation

	Identify relevant partners on sustainable landscapes and ensure effective management of these partnerships

	Actively look for new funding to support Landscapes and the Labâ€™s support to them, strengthening relations with relevant donors and investors (as World Bank FCPF Carbon Fund, GC, LDNF...)

	Manage the production of landscape knowledge products (e.g. State of Landscape Finance Report or others)

	Ensure effective coordination with WWF work areas, in particular the Sustainable Landscapes community (ACAI) and WWF country offices

	Support the extension of the Lab Expert Hub (foresight and identification of technical needs, web watching and contact with relevant expert)

With the Landscape Lead, ensure effective delivery of Lab support to landscapes 

	Ensure adequate processes, templates and tools for landscapes incubation, and, in coordination with the community lead, their use and presentation on the Labâ€™s platform

	Supervise and coordinate the work on landscapes, from the Labâ€™s core team and consultants.

	Act as Landscape advisor, leading the Labâ€™s support and relationship with some targeted landscapes

	Support Landscapes advisers in the Lab, through adequate tools and processes, strategic orientation, as well as technical support and review at different stages (cf. prefeasibility review...)

	Build technical capacity of the team on sustainable landscapes, ensuring common understanding and standardized language, including through trainings

	Dialogue with landscape leads to identify needs and define relevant supports (monthly calls, workspace, exchanges)

	Maintain an internal Wiki to capture agreements on the Labâ€™s approaches to landscape incubation and service to clients

Support the Labâ€™s work on markets, finance and SME business solutions

	Assist the relevant Lab team members with service offer and systems and tools development, partnerships management, project execution, as well as commercial development on markets, finance and business solutions, ensuring in particular their relevance and suitability for the Labâ€™s work on landscapes and from the landscapes perspective

Support lab management

	Participate in Lab team meetings as needed

	Support the development of business model and plan for the Lab, in particular the value proposition

	Support the Labâ€™s strategic management

	Assist in preparing communications on landscape programs

	Support the Community Manager with the upload of information on landscape  programs on the Lab Platform

	Other activities as directed

Required Qualifications, Skills and Competencies:

	Min. 10 years experience in project and team management, and in coordinating the development and implementation of projects

	Experience in building partnerships and developing multi-stakeholder mechanisms,

	Fundraising experience for international projects (liaising with donors, drafting concepts and proposals, developing budgets)

	Good understanding of landscape approaches to conservation and their success factors, climate finance, REDD+, integrated land use management, multi-stakeholder platforms, blended finance

	Involvement in drafting large donor concept notes and project proposals an advantage,

	Experience in working with the private sector an advantage

	Knowledge of another language (French, Spanish) an advantage

	Adheres to WWFâ€™s values, which are: Knowledgeable, Optimistic, Determined and Engaging

	Demonstrates WWF behaviours in ways of working: strive for impact, listen deeply, collaborate openly and innovate fearlessly 

How to apply?

***Read carefully ***  

Send your covering letter and CV  as one file and in English to [email] with the subject line â€œApplication for Landscape Coordinatorâ€.

Send	as one single file.

We will not accept applications without a CV and Covering Letter.

Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2019-03-01972-0-000001953", "text": "Senior Data Scientist

Senior Data Scientist

Location: Geneva, Switzerland.

The Knowledge Science team is part of the Corporate R&D division. Fundamental research on AI/ML in the context of chemistry, sensory and creativity is at the core of the teamâ€™s activity with the goal to deliver data-driven business functions across the company. Our working environment includes latest hardware equipment and tools from the IT and collaborations with key AI players (academic and industrial) around the world.

We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist, grounded with a strong  Machine Learning expertise and passionate about mathematical modeling and optimization processes. Being a  core member of the data science team, you will work in close collaboration with business unit professionals and managers to solve complex business problem through advanced algorithms and machine learning approaches.

This role is at the heart of the Firmenich's digitalization strategy and will offer a high visibility within senior level executives. The successfull candidate will have to demonstrate excellent team leading skills and communication abilities to foster a strong data-driven culture within the company.

Your reponsabilities:

	Conduct research on Artificial Intelligence in the field of the Fragrance and Flavours Industry.

	Turn business and technical challenges into algorithmic and data-driven solutions.

	Supervised deployment of models and algorithms within the production environement. Ensure conitnuous improvement through industrialized machine learning pipeline.

	Collaborate and communicate to all levels of the company and externally (academic, start-up...).

	Build new and improved solutions for data collection, management and usage.

	Become an authorithy in Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence within the company.

Qualifications:

	Advanced degree (PhD preferred) in a quantitative field like computer science, engineering, statistics, physics.

	Demonstrated experience with machine learning, operation research and datamining in professional environement.

	Proven ability to manage R&D projects and supervise research teams.

	Deep understanding of statistics, probabilites, artificial neural networks, minimization algorithms.

	Excellent command of Python/Matlab and related DL frameworks (Tensorflow, PyTorch, Mathworks DL toolbox...).

	Knowledge of SQL, no-SQL, javascript and DevOps methodologies appreciated.

	Ability to work in an international atmosphere, involving high-level collaborations with both academic and business partners.

	Willing to assume additional responsibilities and to become a respected know-how carrier in our team"}

CMK Associate Manager â€“ Digital Marketing Data Analyst Baby Care (m/f)

Description:

Are you an intellectually curious individual who is passionate about uncovering human needs and desires?

Are you able to discover the story in all the noise and identify what truly matters?

If so, then a role in the Consumer and Market Knowledge (CMK) organization is for you! In CMK we directly influence business strategy, product design, pricing, media investments... and much more! We use our boundless curiosity to discover what consumers want, why they want it & how we can we influence them through immersive exploration, in-depth analysis and good research. In CMK you will work on finding out what our brands should stand for, who our target shoppers are, how we best reach them, how we can create exciting in-store & on-line shopper experiences, And...

Whatâ€™s next?

Your role in CMK is like an internal, active and influential business strategy consultant, whose role it is to ensure that consumer and shopper insights are the foundations of our business strategy and execution. You are part of a multi-functional business team, working closely with Brand Management, Finance, Sales, R&D and others, constantly exploring new opportunities for business growth. Your key to success will be your ability to build on and combine soft skills with analytical skills, and use integrative thinking to convey research findings to drive actions with your key business partners across levels and functions.

We believe people are endlessly fascinating and thereâ€™s always something new to discover. One day you could be exploring human decision-making & how the brain works and another deep-diving into big data sets to spot patterns and create insights to shape P&G business strategies. You will be growing your skills day-in, day-out, connecting with internal & external experts to explore new ways to learn and you will be exchanging your recommendations with the CMK family.

For this specific role, we are looking for someone with a strong technical toolkit and experience managing Big Data for a role in the Baby Care business unit. The role specifically sets out to understand how consumers experience the digital services we offer (websites, apps, ecommerce), so as to continuously guide our digital marketing efforts as we connect with Mums and Dads across the world.

So hereâ€™s your opportunity! Weâ€™re looking for passionate and driven individuals to join our thriving team. Join CMK and help us anticipate and identify consumer needs, wants and desires. To learn more about CMK click here: [wwwadr]

QUALIFICATIONS

We are looking for recent graduates engaged in extra-curricular activities, good English, analytical skills and team orientation, â€œcan-doâ€ attitude and ability to deliver breakthrough results. Specifically:

	Strong analytical skills, using multiple data sources. Comfortable with data analysis.

	Experience with Big Data technologies (e.g. Spark, Hive, Impala, Hadoop, Kafka).

	Proficiency in programming (e.g. Python), database querying (SQL) and knowledge of machine learning techniques all considered assets. 

	Creativity, innovation, initiative, follow-through, communication and priority setting.

	Data Analytics / Statistics, Economics, Mathematics

	Ability to contribute and influence your business team as well as management.

Geneva, Canton of Geneva Job Type: Full-time Req No: CMK00001345"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2019-03-02462-0-000001997", "text": "Senior Data Scientist

Senior Data Scientist

Help us shape the future of banking.

Avaloq is driving the digital transformation and automation of the financial services industry.

Our clients are the leading banks of today and tomorrow. Based on our fully integrated banking software, we create powerful digital experiences provided through a standardized Business Process as a Service (BPaaS) or Software as a Service (SaaS) model to banks and wealth managers.

To further spur innovation, we work with clients, other fintechs, universities and hundreds of third-party developers in a uniquely collaborative way we call the Avaloq Ecosystem.

Headquartered in Switzerland, Avaloq has more than 2,000 employees and has a presence in the worldâ€™s most demanding financial and innovation centres, including Berlin, Frankfurt, Hong Kong, London, Luxembourg, Madrid, Paris, Singapore and Sydney.

More information is available at [wwwadr]

The position

Are you passionate about data? Are you interested in shaping the next generation of data science driven products for the financial industry? Do you enjoy working in an agile environment involving multiple stakeholders?

A challenging role as Senior Data Scientist in a demanding, dynamic and international software company using the latest innovations in predictive analytics and visualization techniques. You will be driving the creation of statistical and machine learning models from prototyping until the final deployment.

We want you to help us to strengthen and further develop the transformation of Avaloq to a data driven product company. Make analytics scalable and accelerate the process of data science innovation.

Your profile

	PhD or Master degree in Computer Science, Math, Physics, Engineering, Statistics or other technical field

	5+ years of experience in Statistical Modelling, Anomaly Detection, Machine Learning algorithms both Supervised and Unsupervised

	Proven experience in applying data science methods to business problems

	Ability to explain complex analytical concepts to people from other fields

	Proficiency in at least one of the following: Python, R, Java/Scala, SQL and/or SAS

	Knowledgeable with BigData technologies and architectures (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, stream processing)

	Expertise in text mining and natural language processing is a strong plus

	Familiarity with network analysis and/or graph databases is a plus

	High integrity, responsibility and confidentiality a requirement for dealing with sensitive data

	Strong presentation and communication skills

	Experience in leading teams and mentoring others

	Good planning and organisational skills

	Collaborative mindset to sharing ideas and finding solutions

	Experience in the financial industry is a strong plus

	Fluent in English; German, Italian and French a plus

Professional requirements

	Use machine learning tools and statistical techniques to produce solutions for customer demands and complex problems

	Participate in pre-sales and pre-project analysis to develop prototypes and proof-of-concepts

	Analyse customer behaviour and needs enabling customer-centric product development

	Liaise and coordinate with internal infrastructure and architecture team regarding setting up and running a BigData & Analytics platform

	Strengthen data science within Avaloq and establish a data science centre of expertise

	Look for opportunities to use insights/datasets/code/models across other functions in Avaloq

Main place of work

Zurich

Contact

Avaloq Evolution AG

Allmendstrasse 140 - 8027 ZÃ¼rich - Switzerland

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2019-03-02713-0-000003342", "text": "Research Assistant in Cloud Computing

Research Assistant in Cloud Computing

As one of Switzerlandâ€™s largest multidisciplinary universities of applied sciences, the Zurich University of Applied Sciences ZHAW has over 12,000 students and 3,000 faculty and staff.

As one of the leading Engineering Faculties in Switzerland, the ZHAW School of Engineering emphasises topics which will be relevant in the future. Our 13 institutes and centres guarantee superior-quality education, research and development with focus on the areas of energy, mobility, information and health.

The Service Engineering research group of the Institute for Applied Information Technology â€“ InIT (init.zhaw.ch) is running the InIT Cloud Computing Lab - ICCLab, a research lab working on cloud computing technologies and solutions and the Service Prototyping Lab - SPLab, a research lab dedicated to advance the state of the art in service prototyping and migrating software to the cloud. More Information about the group can be found on  blog.zhaw.ch/icclab.

The Service Engineering research group is seeking applications of highly motivated candidates to complement the team of the ICCLab or SPLab as a

Research Assistant in Cloud Computing

In one of the following research and development fields:

	â€¢  High-Available Cloud Storage Systems (Object- and Block Storage)

	â€¢  Cloud Infrastructure- and Application- orchestration and management

	â€¢  Cloud Native Application design, prototyping engineering and deployment

	â€¢  Service Tooling to prototype networked services from the programming level

	â€¢  Cloud Accounting and Billing

	â€¢  Cloud Robotics: Cloud-native Application enablement (SLAM, Object Avoidance, Detection, Recognition, Manipulation, etc.) and development of Robotics Applications

Areas of responsibility will include:

	â€¢  Research and development in one of the above fields

	â€¢  Develop solutions in national and international R&D projects

	â€¢  Participate in transferring research results to industry

	â€¢  Writing papers, contributing to open source software, presenting at scientific conferences

Applicants must have a university degree (Bachelor or Master) in computer science or a related field. A healthy research curiosity combined with very good software development skills and interest in novel technologies is expected, as is demonstrated ability to work in an R&D context. A high level of ambition and willingness to take ownership and responsibility is very well considered. We expect the candidate to be an internationally oriented, enthusiastic researcher who enjoys working in teams with a healthy mix of scientific and applied ambitions. Good communication skills in English are a prerequisite, German is a plus.  

The position is provisionally limited to one year, but could be renewed for a maximum of three years upon mutual agreement. This is an entry level position, suitable for a recent graduate.

We offer a competitive, technically stimulating, and exciting environment. It is very open, multicultural and diverse comprising of people with all levels of expertise and experience from all over the world. As well as providing an excellent work environment, we provide intellectual liberty, opportunities for applied industrial collaboration, and competitive compensation based on Swiss standards.

Do you have any questions about this position? For additional information, please contact Christof Marti, Head of the Service Engineering research group, phone +41 58 934 70 63, e-mail [email].

Are you interested?

If you would like to apply, please use the online platform only to send your full application attn. Regina Peil, HR Consultant in Winterthur.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2019-03-09010-0-000000094", "text": "Data Scientist / Bioinformatician

Data Scientist / Bioinformatician
Data Scientist / Bioinformatician
The Ecole polytechnique fÃ©dÃ©rale de Lausanne (EPFL) is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of 16,000 people, including over 10,000 students and 3,500 researchers from 120 different countries.

Data Scientist / Bioinformatician
Your mission :
The Auwerx lab (LISP) is heavily focused on bioinformatics and multiomic data generation and analysis. We are looking for a dynamic data scientist with experience in bioinformatics to complement and support our multi-disciplinary team of scientists. The candidate should have good knowledge in programming and scripting best practices as well as the interest in learning systems genetics concepts and techniques. He/she will be working in close collaboration with the School of Life Sciences IT (SV-IT) department and the Swiss Data Science Center (SDSC) on getting systems genetics data and reproducible analysis pipelines on the SDSC Renku platform.
Main duties and responsibilities include :
Establish pipelines and best practices for multiomic data analyses on the SDSC Renku platform.
Analyze existing and new systems genetics datasets using above pipelines
Aid in the integration of Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS) with downstream data analysis pipelines to ensure traceability of results.
Your profile :
Masterâ€™s degree or PhD in bioinformatics, computer science, statistics, or machine learning.
Excellent knowledge in data management and storage with good proficiency in database management systems.
Sufficient understanding of biology for interpretation of results.
Experience with sequencing data. Experience with other omics data is considered a plus.
Good knowledge of statistical, computational and machine learning methods for handling high dimensional datasets.
Good programming proficiency as well as fluency in python and/or R.
Familiarity with Linux/Unix.
Knowledge in HPC, cloud computing, and container technologies are considered a plus
We offer :
Unprecedented access to big data (genetic, phenomic, and molecular datasets) across multiple organisms including human data.
The chance to work with a multidisciplinary team of scientists and developers in three different units at EPFL: LISP, SV-IT, and SDSC.
A full time contract for two years with a possibility of extension.

01.04.2019
Term of employment : 
Fixed-term (CDD)

24 months
Contact :

Software Engineer - 19013-TA
Brand and Design Database Section, Global Databases Division, Global Infrastructure Sector
Information Technology
Grade - P3
Temporary Appointment
Duty Station: WIPO Headquarters, 34, chemin des Colombettes, 1211 Geneva 20, Switzerland
Publication Date: 2019-02-28 Application Deadline: 2019-03-22
IMPORTANT NOTICE REGARDING APPLICATION DEADLINE:  Please note that the deadline for applications is indicated in local time as per the time zone of the applicantâ€™s location.

1.	Organizational Context

	a.   Organizational Setting

The position is located in the Brands and Designs Database Section of the Global Database Division, Global Infrastructure Sector. The Section is responsible for the WIPO Global Brand Database and Global Design Database which include millions of records from the collections of Madrid, Lisbon, Hague and Paris 6ter emblems and from an expanding number of national collections contributed by IP Offices with whom cooperation agreements have been reached.  These databases offer advanced Trademark and Industrial Designs search functions to the public, are used by thousands of users daily and are essential components of WIPOâ€™s Global IP Infrastructure on the internet.

b.	Purpose Statement

The incumbent will coordinate the trained neural models generated by the Advanced Technology Applications Center (ATAC) team and the lucene-based search engines of the Global Brand and Design Databases to apply machine learning to luceneâ€™s internal ranking algorithms.

c.	Reporting Lines

The incumbent will work under the supervision of the Head of the Global Brand and Designs Section

d.	Work Relations

The incumbent will work in close collaboration with ATAC colleagues.

2.	Duties and Responsibilities

The incumbent will perform the following principal duties:

a.	Manage the integration of image classification neural models with Solr or ElasticSearch based search engine to support next-generation image similarity searching and ranking algorithm for Trademark images.

b.	Take ownership of Global Brand and Design search schemas and propose ways to improve and optimize overall performance.

c.	Study and propose solutions for image similarity search for Industrial Designs.

d.	Define and extract data training sets using large amounts of data in varying structures and/or storage formats.

e.	Cooperate with the ATAC team to develop new ideas for new or improved machine learning algorithms and assist in the development of proof of concept prototypes.

f.	Keep abreast of new tools and techniques and propose innovative technologies and approaches to help optimize the search experience

g.	Perform other related tasks as required.

3.	Requirements

Education (Essential)
First-level university degree in Information Technology. An advanced university degree in a relevant discipline may be accepted in lieu of two years of experience.

Experience (Essential)
At least six years of relevant experience in working with lucene-based search engines.

Experience (Desirable)
Ease in working with multi-lingual search engines.
Experience in applying AI to search engine internal ranking algorithm. 
Experience in image low-level features extraction for the purpose of measuring image similarity

Language (Essential)
Excellent knowledge of written and spoken English.

Language (Desirable)
Ability to work in other UN official languages (Arabic, Chinese, French, Russian, or Spanish) would be an advantage.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2019-03-09018-1-024008106", "text": "Senior Consultant, Organization Design, Human Capital, Consulting, Switzerland (80-100%)

Senior Consultant, Organization Design, Human Capital, Consulting, Switzerland (80-100%)
Deloitte Switzerland
Zurich, German Region, Switzerland
	Add to job car	
Position summary
Our consulting team is looking for you!

Driven by accelerating connectivity, new talent models, and cognitive tools, work is changing. As robotics, AI, the gig economy and crowds grow, jobs and work are being reinvented. Our Human Capital practice is at the forefront of helping clients to respond to these fundamental new challenges. We are the global leader in this space and the largest practice of this kind in the Swiss market. We are widely recognized by our clients across all industries for our collaborative approach, insight and expertise, and the quality of our work. Our track record of success and our growth ambitions provide a fantastic platform for your career. Click here for more information about Human Capital Consulting at Deloitte Switzerland.

To support the continued growth of our Human Capital Consulting practice, we are looking for a Senior Consultant with Organization Design expertise. As part of the Organization Design team, you will collaborate with clients to better organize people to innovate, collaborate, and achieve customer and business outcomes in the context of changing work norms, technological disruption, and the possibilities of the future of work. If you are passionate about working with business leaders to execute on strategy, shape adaptable organizations, and develop high performing teams, we would love to hear from you!

You will

	Use our global methodology to plan, design and deliver organization strategy solutions for our clients
	Prepare organization design alternatives, test them against design criteria, and help align leadership groups around design selection and implementation
	Apply analytic and visualization tools to assess the impact of varying design and decision solutions
	Support the process of identifying, assigning, and implementing decision making authority and responsibility to both individuals (decision rights) and groups (governance)
	Prepare workforce transition plans and programs, including strategies to transition talent at all levels
	Design roles, create competency models and career paths to aid in the selection and transition of employees
	Be a key team member in liaising with client stakeholders, and the directing activities of people on project teams

You are:

	An incisive thinker, confident with concepts, analysis and frameworks, with the ability to structure work, lead a team and deliver under pressure
	Experienced in using organization and workforce analytics tools to draw out insights and identify structure, process and people issues and opportunities
	A strong communicator with interpersonal skills and the ability to conduct client meetings and workshops
	An excellent relationship builder with clients and fellow consultants
	Passionate about doing an outstanding job for the client
	An independent worker, taking initiative and happy taking on responsibility
	Excited to take on new challenges and demonstrate clear potential and ambitions to pursue a successful career with us

You have:

	Minimum 4 years of professional experience in Organization Design in a consulting or industry role with
	A University degree (Bachelorsâ€™ degree or preferably an advanced degree) in a related specialization
	Knowledge and understanding of Commercial, Finance, IT, Procurement, Supply Chain functions will be an advantage
	Fluency in English, German and/or French, additional languages will be an advantage
	Excellent people and team management skills and an enthusiastic, positive, 'can do' attitude 

Note that this role requires flexibility to travel.

Your chance

Deloitte offers an award-winning culture that supports our employeesâ€™ development of their personal brand through learning opportunities, professional experiences, inclusion, collaboration and personal well-being; ; learn more about life at Deloitte here

We provide a team-oriented environment that allows for both personal and professional growth. While focused on the Swiss market, our projects usually have an international scope and provide room for creative and self-motivated work. Competitive compensation and benefits are granted.

About Deloitte

Deloitte is one of the world's leading auditing and advisory firms in the areas of Audit and Risk Advisory, Tax, Consulting and Financial Advisory. In Switzerland, Deloitte Consulting is one of the fastest growing business consultancy firms, with over 1,900 people across offices in Zurich, Bern, Basel, Geneva and Lugano. Our experts develop strategies and solutions that help our clients manage the most complex of problems. We have a global presence with over 200â€™000 employees working in over 150 countries around the world.

Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom.

Requisition code: 162857

Deloitte AG

8022 ZÃ¼rich

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2020-03-00116-0-000003430", "text": "Director, Advanced Analytics Realization

Director, Advanced Analytics Realization
Saved Jobs 

Job Description

The Human Health Digital Accelerator supports the implementation and realization of Digital Transformation through a flexible team to capitalize on deep subject matter expertise through collaboration with global markets, franchises, Information Technology (IT) and other enabling functions. The Director of Advanced Analytics Realization will report to the Executive Director, Advanced Analytics in the Digital Accelerator.

This role will lead the global installation and evolution of advanced analytics applications, tools, and processes to facilitate embedding highly efficient and effective advanced analytics capabilities into international markets to support marketing and promotion investment decisions. The role will coordinate closely with the Advanced Analytics Leads in the prioritized markets, with colleagues in the Digital Accelerator (e.g., the Lead, Digital Data Innovation, the Lead, Advanced Analytics Solutions, and with the Lead, Marketing Technology), with external services/solutions providers, and with global and local IT colleagues to influence and make progress on the roadmap for Advanced Analytics Realization. More specifically, the Director of Advanced Analytics Realization will:

Be a key contributor on enterprise and divisional initiatives towards modernizing our data and analytics operating model to address current pain points for professional staff working along the data and analytics lifecycle.
Focus on enabling productization of repeatable processes (e.g., â€œmodels as softwareâ€), laying a foundation in our company to enable new ways of working, helping the enterprise adapt to the changing Artificial Intelligence (AI) landscape, and fostering collaborative learning/continuous improvement of best-practices in advanced analytics in the commercial space.
Be an integral part of cross-functional efforts aimed at achieving productivity improvements and driving consistency in advanced analytics processes executed by global data scientists in various markets by facilitating adoption of these productized processes. Examples of these processes include customer segmentation, promotion response modeling, marketing mix optimization, channel/content affinity prediction, test/control analytics, and sales force size and structure analytics.
Gain a deep understanding of needs for advanced analytics realization and translate these into business requirements for minimum viable products to introduce, enhance and/or replace existing solutions to facilitate efficient execution of advanced analytics capabilities across the globe. This will be achieved through collaboration with Advanced Analytics Leads in various markets, with the Data Science Team in our IT Technical Centers in Singapore and Prague, with enterprise and divisional IT leadership around data and analytics capabilities/investments, and with external analytical service providers.
Propose and gain ratification from local analytics leads in prioritized markets to move forward with installation of specific solutions by leading from a global business perspective:
adaptation of existing solutions developed at a market level to scale these for use by other markets,
adaptation of and/or creation of solutions by IT Technical Centers Data Science and other teams by bringing business context and facilitating iterative development informed by test-and-learn applications in prioritized markets, and
installation of solutions developed by outside service providers to achieve the objectives outlined above.
Collaborate with the Leads of Digital Data Innovation and Advanced Analytics solutions in the Digital Accelerator to ensure that:
global taxonomies for media tagging and content coding are influenced by the unique needs dictated by advanced analytics realization, and that
any synergies that can be gained as a result of common requirements for minimum viable products for customer engagement reporting and for advanced analytics tools are realized.
Collaborate with market-based data scientists and Advanced Analytics Leads to populate a Knowledge Center which documents use cases in commercial advanced analytics. The aim of this work will be to capture and share best practices of using data in our companyâ€™s Customer Information Management platform and Data Integration Layer, and of using advanced analytics, including the repeatable processes, to deliver empirically-derived decision support.
Qualifications:

Education:
Required: Masterâ€™s degree or international equivalent from an accredited university in a field related to quantitative business analytics
Preferred: Ph.D. degree in a field related to quantitative business analytics (not required)
Required Experience and Skills:
10+ years of experience in commercial analytics with demonstrated leadership in providing and pulling through empirically-based decision support results
Able to effectively and efficiently manage change and influence an organization to adapt a risk management approach over the analytics lifecycle in terms of ways of working, organizational transformation and strategy, technology use and skillset building
Deep understanding of best practices related to supporting business decisions in a commercial marketing organization using data and analytics across the continuum of descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive analytics.
Working knowledge of artificial intelligence/machine learning techniques to support commercialization operations, including customer engagement journey personalization/orchestration
Experience shaping state-of-the-art cloud analytics systems, working closely with IT to do so and grounded in a deep understanding of the role of IT in implementing end-to-end analytics processes.
Working knowledge of modern analytics platforms, tools and accelerators such as Datorama, data robot, veeva nitro, SF interaction studio, SF journey builder, Google optimize, Google Analytics Ml flow, Databricks, Algorithmia, etc.
Due diligence and grasp over the commoditized AI space to help enable markets to progress along the advanced analytics maturity such as h2o.ai, AWS comprehend, etc.
Strong project management skills
Ability to build highly effective cross-functional and/or cross-market partnerships and collaborative teams
Consulting experience coordinating across multiple stakeholders and building consensus
Keen business acumen to enable understanding of business stakeholder needs
Intellectual curiosity and ability to identify innovative approaches to meeting advanced analytics needs
Excellent presentation, analytics and communication skills, both written and oral, are required to synthesize key issues and communicate/persuade constituencies towards specific actions and initiatives
Preferred Experience and Skills:
Experience in the pharmaceutical industry in more than one of the following countries:US, Japan, China, France, UK, Germany
Experience with digitally advanced marketing companies/industries outside of the pharmaceutical industry
Hands on experience producing, delivering and/or overseeing decision support functions using commercial analytics techniques such as promotion response modeling, marketing mix optimization, targeting and segmentation, promotion planning, etc.
Foundational and hands-on knowledge of artificial intelligence/machine learning techniques (e.g., convolutional neural networks, genetic algorithm, deep collaborative filtering, reinforcement learning, NLP, semi-supervised machine learning and federated machine learning, etc.)
THE COMPANY

Our company has had a presence in Switzerland since 1963. With a regional office and manufacturing/packaging facility, Lucerne is considered the center of operations. Approximately 1,000 people work collaboratively at the four Lucerne locations (Weystrasse, Citybay, Schachen and Kriens). A fifth location has been recently established in Zurich, aimed at accelerating the development and commercialization of many of our companyâ€™s medicines and vaccines, which supports our mission to save and improve lives around the world. The new location has a target date of 2021 for operational readiness.

We are proud to be certified as a â€œTop Employer Switzerlandâ€ and â€œTop Employer Europeâ€ showing the companyâ€™s commitment to our employees and the community around us.

Zurich

The recently opened new location in Zurich focuses on accelerating research, data and commercialization of our medicines and vaccines. The new office will be staffed by teams working in strategic and operational roles in medical affairs, clinical development, access and marketing operations functions.

Who we are ...

Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA is known as â€œMerckâ€ in the United States, Canada & Puerto Rico. We are known as â€œMSDâ€ in Europe, Middle East, Africa, Latin America & Asia Pacific. We are a global biopharmaceutical leader with a diverse portfolio of prescription medicines, oncology, vaccines and animal health products.

We are driven by our purpose to develop and deliver innovative products that save and improve lives. With 69,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, we offer state of the art laboratories, plants and offices that are designed to Inspire our employees as we learn, develop and grow in our careers. We are proud of our 125 years of service to humanity and continue to be one of the worldâ€™s biggest investors in Research & Development.

What we look for ...

In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.

INVENT.

IMPACT.

INSPIRE.

We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one anotherâ€™s thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.

Titelbild
RF Development Engineer (12 months)
Your tasks
We would like to get in contact with young, talented and passionate RF Engineers, being keen to join a high tech fast paced development environment, and wishing to have a strong impact for todayâ€™s and tomorrowâ€™s challenges such as Automotive Autonomous driving and 5G.

Your role as a RF Development Engineer will put you in touch with both design and technology innovation participating to all aspects that relate to the release of new prototypes and product.

This means that you will participate to several RF activities like concepts creation, design, testing and reporting of our innovative RF Metallized Polymer products, ranging from classical to mm-wave frequencies.

Would you like to be part of a very dynamic development environment? Are you ready to share our enthusiasm and passion? A highly professional and international team will welcome and support you. Barbara Neurauter, HR Manager, is looking forward to your application. Do not hesitate to contact her for any further information in advance.
Herisau (AR)
Your profile
We are looking for somebody having a Master degree in Electrical Engineering with a focus on Electromagnetics / Antenna design. There is not working experiences required, but would be an asset. Your English knowledge should be on a very good level (B2).

We very much hope that you are interested in the vacancy and we look forward to receiving your completed application.
Barbara Neurauter, HR Manager

Apply now"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2020-03-00941-0-000000329", "text": "Support scientist in the Friedrich Lab

Support scientist in the Friedrich Lab

The Friedrich group at FMI is seeking a scientist to support and advance non-standard experimental applications and data analysis procedures in neuroscience. We analyze neuronal computations underlying higher brain functions using zebrafish as a model system ([wwwadr]). Most projects focus on information processing and memory formation in the olfactory bulb and cortex of adult or juvenile fish. Key methods established in the laboratory include multiphoton microscopy, optogenetics, electrophysiology, serial block face scanning electron microscopy, EM-based neuron reconstruction (connectomics), behavioral approaches including virtual realities, and others.

The successful candidate will interact well with members of our group and push the envelope of techniques to support different projects. A strong background is expected in at least one of the following areas:

	Optical engineering
	Advanced analysis of neural data and programming
	Machine learning approaches and data processing for connectomics
	Design and control of custom laboratory instruments

The candidate may hold an advanced degree in science (e.g., PhD) but this is not a strict requirement. The position is initially for a fixed term but may become permanent thereafter.

Please submit your application electronically at the portal [wwwadr]

For further information please contact Prof. Rainer Friedrich: [email]."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2020-03-01299-0-000002321", "text": "Global Regulatory Manager - Syngenta Professional Solutions

Job Description 
Global Regulatory Manager - Syngenta Professional Solutions - (18015654) 
Description

Role purpose

	Develop and implement the global regulatory strategy for designated Active Ingredients and products to meet global business objectives and to ensure that regions and countries have access to a comprehensive regulatory package to gain and maintain national registrations in line with business needs.
	Provide regulatory expertise, advice, leadership and advocacy skills to business partners (Product Managers, Technical Managers, Supply Chain Managers) for the allocated Syngenta portfolio to ensure that issues, challenges and opportunities are progressed and addressed in a timely manner. 

Accountabilities

	Develop global regulatory strategies for designated Active Ingredients in support of business objectives considering the sustainability of existing and new uses. These strategies allow regions and countries to operate within globally agreed regulatory frameworks.
	Provide global regulatory leadership for the substances of your assigned portfolio.
	Prepare high quality regulatory documents and provide associated support and advice. This includes updated regulatory strategy documents, SynCRAS and issue documents for all designated active ingredients which serve as accurate, self-service framework for territory and country organizations.
	Provide foresight, evaluation and thorough analysis of current regulatory issues and future threats critical to the assigned active ingredients.
	Provide regulatory expertise, advice and advocacy skills to business partners (Product Managers, Technical Managers, Supply Chain Managers) for the allocated Syngenta portfolio to ensure that issues, challenges and opportunities are progressed and addressed in a timely manner.
	Lead teams within Global Product Registration and Product Safety to ensure appropriate work plans are developed and implemented, and results are appropriately evaluated and integrated as required to support regulatory submissions and approvals worldwide.
	Act as Project Manager for the Active Ingredient (AI) Maintenance projects. Plan and initiate AI studies deriving from data call-ins and new data requirements to ensure registerability of the AI in line with the business plan; lead the associated governance processes.
	For designated active ingredients identify competitor products and track competitor databases, issues and development strategies, and use this knowledge to identify opportunities and promote optimal positioning of Syngenta products in the portfolio. 
	Lead important projects independently, receives minimal guidance.
	Together with MRL Lead in Regulatory Policy develop strategies for mitigating trade issues in case of ban/restrictions of assigned portfolio in other parts of the world
	Work close to 3rd party management team regarding regulatory aspects and requirements for global and large regional licensing agreements

Qualifications

Experience required 

	Detailed knowledge of worldwide product registration requirements and regulatory science issues with multi-year experience in the field
	In-depth knowledge of product safety or chemistry discipline such as toxicology, ecotoxicology or e-fate, etc. is preferred.

Minimum education and critical knowledge required 

	Degree in Science and preferably post-graduate qualification (MSc or PhD)
	Good understanding of agribusiness
	Fluent in English and preferably having skills in other languages

Critical technical knowledge, professional and personal capabilities

	Proven track record in results orientation and project management
	Proven ability to deal with complex regulatory issues and to develop effective strategies for managing them
	Proven ability to work within and contribute to cross-functional teams
	Leadership skills
	Analytical and strategic thinking
	Team player; flexible to work with different cultures and backgrounds
	Well-developed communication and presentation skills
	Excellent track record and consistent feedback on how/what

Primary Location: CHE-Basel-Basel 
Job: Business Sustainability - Regulatory & Stewardship"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2020-03-01299-0-000002326", "text": "Aquatic Risk Modelling Postdoc

Aquatic Risk Modelling Postdoc - (18015471) 
Description

Syngenta is a global leader in agriculture; rooted in science and dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanityâ€™s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources.

Aquatic Risk Modelling Postdoc
We invite you to help us shape the future of agriculture. To support this challenge, the Product Safety team is currently seeking an Aquatic Risk Modelling Postdoc in our Basel, Switzerland HQ office. 

The Aquatic Risk Modelling Postdoc will be a three years engagement where you will develop an indicator system for the environmental risk of crop protection measures on aquatic systems. This indicator will be a globally applicable digital tool and reflect local environmental conditions and agronomic practices

In this role you will:

	Review Scientific literature on environmental risk indicators
	Develop environmental risk indicator for aquatic systems system
	Coordinate with environmental fate, ecotoxicology and environmental risk assessment experts 
	Acquire & maintain scientific and technical modelling expertise
	Deliver and present relevant novel research (incl. scientific publications & conference presentations)

Qualifications

We are looking for:

Critical knowledge and experience

	A good understanding of environmental fate, ecological & effect modelling along with current knowledge of risk modelling techniques
	A PhD degree in a relevant area of science
	Track record relating to one or more of the following areas: environmental fate and ecotoxicology of chemicals, ecological modelling, ecotoxicological effects, environmental risk indicators, Bayesian Network Models, environmental models, agronomy models
	Experience in developing and applying models
	Ability to design, build and analyse environmental systems models
	Ability to analyse and interpret complex data
	Readiness for occasional international business travels

Critical technical, professional and personal capabilities

	Commitment to achieve objectives individually and within a team
	Effective communication skills
	Strong interpersonal skills
	Ability to skillfully plan, organize and monitor performance to meet deadlines
	Motivation towards publishing in peer-reviewed literature
	Creative problem solving skills

We Offer

	The opportunity to contribute to valuable and impactful work for the agriculture of the future
	A stimulating international environment -> #bringingplantpotentialtolife
	An open, multicultural and pleasant working environment with state of the art facilities
	Flat hierarchy and an open culture

Please submit an online application in English via the link enclosed. With your up to date CV please include a motivation letter and university degrees.

Primary Location: CHE-Basel-Basel 
Job: HR Gnrl Mgt & Other"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-02-2020-03-01772-0-000004566", "text": "Postdoctoral Position - Phenomics of Plant Disease 100%, Zurich, temporary

Ãœbersicht 
Drucken	Drucken icon
Postdoctoral Position - Phenomics of Plant Disease
100%, Zurich, temporary

This new postdoctoral position will be created between the Plant Pathology and Crop Science Groups.
Project background

Major areas of research in the Plant Pathology Group are population genomics and evolutionary ecology of fungal pathogens. A primary experimental organism is Zymoseptoria tritici (aka Mycosphaerella graminicola) which causes septoria tritici blotch (STB), the most damaging wheat disease in Europe. We have already developed and implemented high throughput phenotyping methods oriented around automated image analysis to acquire millions of phenotype data points for a variety of important traits in Z. tritici, including quantitative virulence, reproduction, fungicide sensitivity, and growth at different temperatures and under different stresses. We now aim to extend these methods to perform under field conditions to accelerate progress in breeding for STB resistance.

Research of the Crop Science Group focuses on the development and application of image-based phenotyping technologies. We have developed a unique field phenotyping platform (FIP) that is operated on our field site in Eschikon, 20 km outside of Zurich. There and at other field sites, we are engaged in experiments related to crop breeding, smart farming and precision agriculture. Most of our work is currently related to wheat. Imaging is done from the multi-sensor head of the FIP but also from drones and it encompasses sensors such as DSLR-cameras, thermal, multispectral and laser scanning devices. Data evaluation is partly performed with commercial solutions and partly with custom-made software.

The ETH and the Institute of Integrative Biology possess advanced infrastructure including the Genetic Diversity Center ([wwwadr]) and the Functional Genomics Center Zurich ([wwwadr]). Zurich is consistently rated as one of the most livable cities in the world.

The Plant Pathology Group ([wwwadr]) is currently composed of ~20 people from 11 countries, and English is the working language of the group. Knowledge of German or French is useful outside of the university.

The Crop Science Group currently consists of ~15 people mostly from Switzerland. Working languages are German and English.
Job description

We seek applicants with expertise in plant pathology, plant phenotyping, image analysis, machine learning, or proximal sensing, to lead a research group oriented around next generation phenotyping of plant diseases in both field and greenhouse settings.

For relevant references, please view the job announcement on the Plant Pathology website.

The successful applicant will be granted a high degree of flexibility in research direction and approach. The position is renewable annually for up to five years. Female scientists are especially encouraged to apply. 
Your profile

Applicants should be able to work independently and to publish their research in peer-reviewed journals. Applicants should have effective communication skills, both oral and written, and be able to lead and coordinate a research team of 2-3 people. A publication record should be provided. 

Applicants should possess demonstrated experience in research topics related to plant phenomics, including expertise in one or more of the following areas: plant pathology, automated image analysis, machine learning, spectral vegetation indices, proximal or remote sensing of vegetation. Experience with plant pathogens is desirable, though not required, but applicants who already have experience with plant pathogens will have an advantage. Experience with statistics and programming is expected. The ability to manage and analyze extensive phenotype datasets containing millions of data points is essential.
ETH Zurich
ETH Zurich is one of the worldâ€™s leading universities specialising in science and technology. We are renowned for our excellent education, cutting-edge fundamental research and direct transfer of new knowledge into society. Over 30,000 people from more than 120 countries find our university to be a place that promotes independent thinking and an environment that inspires excellence. Located in the heart of Europe, yet forging connections all over the world, we work together to develop solutions for the global challenges of today and tomorrow.
Working, teaching and research at ETH Zurich Link icon
Get connected
facebook icon
twitter icon
instagram icon
linkedin icon
youtube icon
Interested?

Applications consisting of a CV, publication list, and a detailed statement of research interests, with names and contact information for 3 references should be prepared as a single PDF file and sent by email before 1 June 2020 to Prof. Bruce A. McDonald at [email].

Applications will be processed as they are received, so it is possible that the position will be offered to an excellent candidate before 1 June 2020.

The position can be filled beginning on 1 June 2020 but will remain open until a suitable scientist is found."}

Post-doc position Digital Economic Policy
100%, Zurich, temporary

The Department of Management, Technology, and Economics invites applications for a Post-doc position at the Chair of Public Economics. The position is part of the eDemocracy & Digital Economic Policy program within the ETH+ initiative on Digital Transformation & Society.
Job description

The successful applicant is expected to work on issues related to the regulation of digital platforms and taxation of their activities. Potential topics include taxation of digital products, two-sided markets and network goods, net neutrality, privacy and public policy, value creation and taxation of corporate profits in the digital economy, the effect of the digital economy on tax competition, artificial intelligence and fiscal systems.

The work might be based on theoretical modelling and/or empirical analysis. The research will ideally combine insights from economics and e.g. computer science.
Your profile

Applicants should hold a Ph.D. in Economics or in Computer Science with a strong economic basis (or should be near completion of the dissertation) and should have shown interest in the topics of the research program. The preferred candidate has demonstrated her or his potential to conduct high-quality research, ideally by having some papers under revision or even accepted for publication in refereed international journals. The successful applicant is expected to independently conduct academic and policy-relevant research and also to contribute to ongoing research projects of the group. Excellent command of English is required. ETH Zurich offers internationally competitive working conditions. Living conditions in Zurich are excellent (Zurich is consistently ranked as one of the world`s premier cities in terms of living standards). The expected starting date is mid 2020 or later.
ETH Zurich
ETH Zurich is one of the worldâ€™s leading universities specialising in science and technology. We are renowned for our excellent education, cutting-edge fundamental research and direct transfer of new knowledge into society. Over 30,000 people from more than 120 countries find our university to be a place that promotes independent thinking and an environment that inspires excellence. Located in the heart of Europe, yet forging connections all over the world, we work together to develop solutions for the global challenges of today and tomorrow.
Working, teaching and research at ETH Zurich Link icon

Interested?

We look forward to receiving your online application with the following documents: a letter of motivation, your CV, university transcripts, a 2-3 page research statement, two academic references as well as a copy of the PhD thesis and/or academic papers. The applications will be reviewed starting mid-March 2020 and will continue as long as the job profile is advertised. Please apply exclusively via the online application portal.

For further information about the Chair of Public Economics, please visit our website [wwwadr] Questions regarding the position should be directed to Prof. Marko KÃ¶thenbÃ¼rger,  +41 44 632 54 46 or email: [email] (no applications)."}

Product Line Manager (Anti-Piracy)

Stimulating. Motivating. Challenging.

Stimulating. Motivating. Challenging.

NAGRA, a digital TV division of the Kudelski Group provides security and multiscreen user experience solutions for the monetization of digital media. The company offers content providers and DTV operators worldwide secure, open, integrated platforms and applications over broadcast, broadband and mobile platforms, enabling compelling and personalized viewing experiences.

Location: Cheseaux, Switzerland
Mission

Your mission is to provide solution leadership and strategic direction to NAGRA for value added Anti-Piracy Services extending the current solution feature set, with the goal to maintain NAGRA as a global leader in digital television systems.

Responsibilities

	Develop market, product and solution requirements, working with sales, security officers, associated Product Line Managers, system architects, R&D product leaders and partners as required
	Manages the Product roadmap and life cycle. Define EPICS with business value and support feature creation. Provides development cost and schedules
	Conduct market and industry regulatory body analysis in collaboration with Business Development and Marketing departments in order to establish short/medium/long-term strategies and business plans 
	Perform competition landscape analysis and build a view to support Sales by leveraging NAGRA product portfolio USPs
	Provide pre-sales support to Regional Sales, maintain close/regular contact with key customers to ensure needs are understood and met via appropriate strategy and roadmaps 
	Ensure customer satisfaction, product quality and on-time delivery, and that other important â€œsatisfactionâ€ components are monitored and correctly implemented 
	Develop partnerships with ecosystem players, suppliers and system integrators critical to solution success 
	Define clear solution value propositions and communicate them to sales and product marketing 
	Owns the product data sheets & technical specification. Work with product marketing to ensure that the necessary marketing programs, collateral, training are developed in a timely manner. 
	Support specific teams by giving strategic directions for the standards bodies and patents.

Requirements / Profile

	Advanced engineering degree
	Minimum 7 years experience managing full lifecycle of product-line/solution in an international business environment within the PayTV, media or telecom industry 
	Proven experience in managing product development in agile environments
	Previous experience in building and deploying solutions based on cloud infrastructures
	Track record of success in establishing and improving product-line/solution related processes 
	Experience with sales & service operations with direct exposure to customers
	In depth knowledge of TV/video/piracy industry current players, industry forces and trends

Profile:

	A self-driven, autonomous and highly motivated team player able to follow through and execute
	University degree in Business or Engineering. A MBA is a plus

Job description

The Department of Computer Science is a very dynamic entity of the Faculty of Sciences. It is involved in numerous research projects funded by the SNSF, the EU, industry and other foundations. The Department of Computer Science offers complete bachelor, master and doctoral courses, focusing on the basic theoretical concepts of computer science, the mastery and development of advanced tools, and their multidisciplinary application in fields as varied as theoretical computer science, formal methods, information theory, High Performance computations, numerical modelling and simulation, bioinformatics, etc.

The Department of Informatics is recognized worldwide for the quality of its research in several of these areas.

The Stochastic Information Processing Group (SIP) ([wwwadr]), University of Geneva, Switzerland, has two open PhD positions in machine learning.

Profile:

	Masterâ€™s degree or an equivalent in one of the following domains: computer science, data science, electrical engineering, theoretical physics or mathematics
	Previous experience with machine learning and signal/image processing
	Strong programming skills in Python with some experience in TensorFlow, PyTorch or Keras that will be verified
	Strong verbal and written communication skills in English and desire to learn French
	Strong analytical abilities and problem solving/troubleshooting skills â€¨

We offer:

	Great learning opportunities
	Flexibility in research subjects
	Support and guidance to publish papers and attending top international machine learning and image processing events â€¨
	Collaboration with academic and industrial partners
	Salary: about CHF 50â€™000 per year

The PhD positions are fully funded for two years from the Swiss National Science Foundation with an extension up to 5 years.

The successful applicants will be involved into a research project related to the development of machine learning based image processing methods in applications to digital forensics like deepfake detection, anti-counterfeiting including robustness to adversarial attacks and advanced imaging.

The project concerns fundamental research on the development of new machine learning methods for universal image processing using generative models. Additionally, the project covers the development of new machine learning methods based on variational information bottleneck framework. An important component of the project is a close collaboration with industry and access to real data.

The SIP group has a broad network of international collaboration and has excellent possibilities to organize scientific exchange visits and training. The SIP group has also a close collaboration with CERN in the domain of machine learning and is a part of Swiss SKA initiative.

STARTING DATE

October 1, 2020.

APPLICATION PROCEDURE:

Applications should include a CV, two recommendation letters, diploma with grades and motivation letter that should indicate (up to 7 lines per item):

	the relevance of your profile to this project
	why you are interested in this position
	details of your master project
	a link to your publicly available projects, codes or publications

Pre-selected candidates will be invited for a Skype interview.

CONTACT

For additional information, please contact Professor Slava Voloshynvoskiy [email]

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2020-03-09001-1-025606738", "text": "Analytics Solution Architect & Data Engineer

Sulzer is a global partner with reliable and sustainable solutions for performance-critical applications. We specialize in pumping solutions, separation, reaction, and mixing technology, as well as rotating equipment maintenance and services. Combining engineering and application expertise, our innovative solutions add value and strengthen the competitive position of our customers. Sulzer is a leading provider in its key markets: oil and gas, power and water. We serve clients worldwide through a network of over 150 locations.
Analytics Solution Architect & Data Engineer

For our BI & Analytics team at our headquarters in Winterthur we are looking for an

Analytics Solution Architect MS Azure

with strong expertise of Big Data (platform) Architecture and Analytics Solution Design.

As market leaders in industrial engineering and manufacturing, we are determined to further develop our business using smart technologies and analytical insights from operational data as key drivers for our digitalization strategy.
In this role you will shape the technical capabilities to efficiently and securely acquire, process and analyze both IoT and business data. Furthermore, this role provides a unique opportunity to translate our digital strategy into execution as a thought leader and forerunner from PoC to scale-up.

Key responsibilities

	Technical responsibility for the architecture, design and operations of our Analytics Solutions based on MS Azure, spanning across IoT, Big Data Management and Advanced Analytics Services
	Design, coordinate and execute pilots/proof of concepts with our partners, being able to challenge assumptions and scenarios with hands-on experience and attitude
	Oversee larger implementation projects, and coordinate internal and external resources
	Ability to move between high level architectural review/design and all phases of solution delivery projects, including challenges in the details
	Document and share technical best practices and insights within the Digital & IT community
	Operationalizing and industrializing analytical use cases including end-to-end data pipelines
	Advising on new technology trends and possible adoption to maintain competitive advantage
	Close collaboration with data scientists and analysts from various functions and business units
	Liaison with our global stakeholders in business, Digital & IT

Your profile

	Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science and/or Engineering with specialization in Data Science / Data Engineering
	Multiple years hands-on as well architecture experience around:
	IoT (IoT Connectivity & Device Lifecycle Management, Azure IoT Hub, IoT Edge, IoT Central)
	Data Ingestion & Processing (Azure Data Factory, Functions / Batch Ingestion, Stream Analytics, API Management)
	(Big) Data Architecture & Data Management (data modeling, batch/stream, Azure Data Lake Store, Blob, Cosmos DB)
	Data Engineering (Python/pySpark, Hive, SQL)
	Analytics (HDinsight, Data Science VM, Azure ML, Stream Analytics, Python, Databricks)
	Security (Active Directory, Application Gateway, Key Vault, Virtual Networks, Network Security Groups)
	DevOps (Continuous Integration / Delivery, testing automation, Azure DevOps, Git(-hub)
	Big-picture thinker with positive attitude while maintaining an attention to detail
	Experienced in managing vendors/partners as well as projects from PoC to scalable solution
	Effective communicator on all levels from subject matter expert to executive level
	Strong track record of delivering results in a global matrix organization
	Project Management skills are a big plus
	Experience in working with agile methodologies such as Scrum, SAFe etc. is a strong asset

We offer

...an interesting and challenging position in an international environment with various opportunities for further development within the company.

Interested? We are looking forward to receiving your application via our online-tool.

	[wwwadr]"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2020-03-09003-1-025606554", "text": "Electronic Design Engineer

Electronic Design Engineer

Intuitive (Nasdaq: ISRG), headquartered in Sunnyvale, Calif., is a global technology leader in minimally invasive care and the pioneer of robotic-assisted surgery. At Intuitive, we believe that minimally invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints.

Intuitive brings more than two decades of leadership in robotic-assisted surgical technology and solutions to its offerings, and develops, manufactures, and markets the da Vinci surgical system and the Ion endoluminal system.

Joining Intuitive Surgical means joining a team dedicated to using technology to benefit patients by improving surgical efficacy and decreasing surgical invasiveness, with patient safety as our highest priority. Intuitive Surgicalâ€™s Aubonne engineering group designs new imaging systems for surgical robotics. Within Intuitive Surgicalâ€™s overall engineering effort, the Aubonne engineering group designs cameras and imaging systems to be used by surgeons to see new information about the surgical site. We are looking for an engineer who can work well in a small group and is a hands on, self-motivated, self-directed, technically strong electronic design engineer, ideally with experience in imaging and an interest in medical & novel imaging methods.

Primary Function of Position:

The Electronic Design Engineerâ€™ primary function will be the design and implementation of electronics to create and interface imaging devices comprising imagers, SPADs, TOF sensors, and others to Intuitiveâ€™s robotic surgery systems.

Roles and Responsibilities:

Conducting detailed prototype design, test, and iteration

Managing short production runs of the board level systems designed

Identification of root cause and driving to resolution design issues that arise

Developing metrics, protocols and test fixtures for qualifying imaging system designs

Validating designs using empirical and analytical methods

Ability to work effectively as a member of a team in a rapidly moving environment

Assisting with difficulties involving imaging system components

Some travel likely required both inside Europe and to the USA

Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience:

Minimum a BSc in Electrical Engineering, Systems Design, Physics, or a related discipline. MSc and PhDs a plus.

Ideally a Minimum 3 or 4 years relevant experience in a similar role

Experience and expertise in Electronic design from board level to self-contained sub-systems

Design, implementation, and first bring-up of board level systems

Experience with Cadence design tools, eg OrCAD, FPGA, ideally in Verilog,

Experience in Digital and analog design

Fluent in English both spoken and written

Self-motivated and ability to self-direct with a track record of successful project completion

Preferred knowledge, skills, and Experience:

Knowledgeâ€™s in 3D CAD with SolidWorks (or an interest in learning this)

Experience with imaging systems involving illumination and cameras

Experience with systems comprising multiple engineering disciplines

Experience with LIDAR or FLIM or SPADs or TOF"}

In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices that deliver enterprise value in a dynamic business environment.

The Analytics & Cognitive team leverages the power of data, analytics, robotics, science and cognitive technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. Together with the Strategy practice, our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients transform their business by architecting organizational intelligence programs and differentiated strategies to win in their chosen markets.

Analytics & Cognitive works with our clients to:

	Modernize their data landscape using next generation cloud-enabled platforms and big data architectures to enable analytics and implement large-scale data ecosystems including data management, governance and the integration of structured and unstructured data to generate insights leveraging cloud-based platforms.

	Develop strategies that allow them to harness the power of Artificial Intelligence and other emerging technologies.

	Develop next generation and traditional algorithms to generate predictions and insights from structured and unstructured data, augmenting human decision-making, leading to algorithms with more autonomous decision making abilities.

	Support clients in transferring support functions into the digital era by innovating the delivery of traditional services delivered from Business Process Outsourcing or Shared Service Centers

	Provide a suite of AI-related managed services including managed analytics, RPAaaS, Insights as a Service, co-sourcing.           

You will:  

	Autonomously manage innovative advisory projects and lead teams in the area of Data, Analytics and Cognitive

	Design and develop tailor-made solutions, strengthen our presence in the market, identify revenue-generating opportunities and get involved in proposal writing, pitch presentations, etc.

	Build global trusted relationships with key clients

	Support the development of the Analytics and Cognitive team in Switzerland

Your qualifications: 

Required: 

	You have a Bachelor's or Master's Degree

	You have 5 to 10 years of consulting background with solid experience in the sales cycle and in leading project teams

	You have strong understanding of either structured and unstructured data mining, visualisation and analytics or Intelligent Automation

	You know how to design and develop Analytics solution

	You enjoy working methodically and with a great attention to detail.

	You grasp new concepts quickly and are both customer and goal-oriented.

	You are happy to travel.

	You communicate confidently in English and French. Any further languages would be an advantage.

	You are based in the French speaking part of Switzerland 

Preferred:

	Experience in one or more of the following areas is desirable: Visual Analytics and Reporting (Qlik, Tableau, PowerBI, or SAP Analytics), Machine Learning and AI (R, Spark, Python ...), RPA, Cognitive technologies. 

How youâ€™ll grow:

	At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe thereâ€™s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world.  From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.  

Deloitteâ€™s culture and benefits: 

At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. 

Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. 

Any questions? Get in touch. 

We look forward to hearing from you! Please submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates, using our online career portal [wwwadr]

We do not accept applications from recruitment agencies for this position.

Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom.
