{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05588-1-000081685", "text": "Lead Data Scientist, Biogen Digital Health - Digital Biomarkers, Gait & Posture

Job Description

Neurological diseases are highly complex, devastating, and there are still significant challenges in how we understand and treat them.

At Biogen Digital Health (BDH), we aspire to transform patientsâ€™ lives by making personalized & digital medicine in neuroscience a reality. Leveraging data-science and digital technologies, we drive solutions to advance research, clinical care, and patient empowerment.

We stand with our colleagues at Biogen developing pioneering treatments in neuroscience. We believe that now, more than ever, biology and technology should go hand-in-hand to better meet patient needs, while enabling a shift towards more prevention-focused, affordable, and equitable care.

Our team at Biogen Digital Health rejects the status quo and lives by agile principles. We strive for impact through excellence, innovation, and collaboration.

We bravely go where others wonâ€™t.

Our people are interdisciplinary, passionate, and champion caring deeply, working fearlessly, and changing lives.

The Lead Data Scientist for Gait & Posture in Digital Biomarkers Data Science will advance precision and personalized medicine through the development and validation of transformative digital measures and algorithms using biometric monitoring technologies (BioMeTs) for people living with MS, neuromuscular diseases (amyotrophic lateral sclerosis [ALS] and spinal muscular atrophy [SMA]), Parkinsonâ€™s disease (PD) and/or Alzheimerâ€™s Disease (AD).

Principal accountabilities:

Design digital outcome measurement development strategies quantifying gait and posture, including technical verification, analytical and clinical validation together with BDH Science, Medical, and Measurement Solutions

Lead the development of end-to-end signal processing pipelines, feature engineering and disease and behavioral models for potential biomarkers/endpoints from sensor-based BioMeT data, including clinical studies using KonectomTM, a BDH smartphone-based digital outcome assessment of cognitive and motor functions

Lead the analyses and the communication of results, including at conferences and in peer-reviewed publications for audiences in the therapeutic area of interest, sensor science, machine learning and digital medicine.

Develop and grow your team

Form and foster Biogen internal and external alliances to advance the field of digital outcome measurements acceptance

As a Lead Data Scientist in the Digital Biomarkers Data Science team within BDH Sciences, you will:

	â€¢  Design digital outcome measurement development strategies quantifying gait and posture, including technical verification, analytical and clinical validation together with BDH Science, Medical, and Measurement Solutions

	â€¢  Lead the development of end-to-end signal processing pipelines, feature engineering and disease and behavioral models for potential biomarkers/endpoints

from sensor-based BioMeT data, including clinical studies using KonectomTM, a BDH smartphone-based digital outcome assessment of cognitive and motor functions

	â€¢  Lead the analyses and the communication of results, including at conferences and in peer-reviewed publications for audiences in the therapeutic area of interest, sensor science, machine learning and digital medicine.

This role is of key importance to achieve the strategic vision and objective to make Biogen a recognized leader in digital health neuroscience, hence contributing to our corporate vision & strategy â€“ this role will report to the Head of Digital Biomarkers Data Science.

Qualifications

	â€¢  PhD in biomechanical engineer, data science, bioinformatics, computer science, or applied mathematics

	â€¢  More than 10 years Pharma/Biotech/Tech industry experience, alternatively extensive leadership experience in academic/clinical centers of excellence

	â€¢  Thought leadership in the field of sensor-based signal processing and disease modelling leveraging state of the art methodologies, programming languages, and tools for the development of digital outcome measures

	â€¢  Experience initiating and leading complex, interdisciplinary research, and development projects, especially in the fields of software and technology implementation in support of clinical studies

	â€¢  Solid track-record of scientific publications in the field of digital measurements of function and human behavior for gait and posture

	â€¢  Fluent in English

Additional Information

Why Biogen?

Our mission to find therapies for neurological and rare diseases is a unique focus within our industry and this shared purpose is what connects us as a team. We work together to overcome obstacles and to follow the science. We are resilient as we strive to make an impact on our patientsâ€™ lives and on changing the course of medicine.

Together, we pioneer. Together, we thrive."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05603-1-000096812", "text": "Senior Solution Architect with D365 FO Knowledge 80-100% (m/w/d)

Senior Solution Architect with D365 FO Knowledge 80-100% (m/w/d)

Your Mission

As a senior Solution Architect, you join the newly established IT Architecture team and participate in shaping the future architecture, organization and strategy, especially with respect to agility and cloud. You bring strong hands-on expertise with Microsoft D365 F&O and its integration with other systems in a hybrid landscape (on-premises and Azure Cloud). You bring experience in designing and building solutions and can readily switch in a bi-modal IT world between taking architecture ownership in projects mode and acting as a change agent and servant leader for agile products teams. You ensure the solutions and products to developed or implemented are fit for their intended purpose by providing end-to-end leadership on solution design encompassing all solution layers - business, software, data, integration, infrastructure and security.

Your tasks

Contribute to the definition of the IT Cloud Strategy, Governance (incl. costs), IT applications architecture blueprints (AS-IS and TO-BE), roadmaps, security principles, standards and reusable patterns.

Define, contribute to and communicate a shared technical and architectural vision across our major ERP program (D365 FO implementation), projects, and different products team

Participate in planning, definition, and high-level design of the solution and exploration of solution alternatives for future enablers (IT and Business capabilities)

Work with IT Portfolio Manager, to define, analyze (workload assessment), split, and realize the implementation of enabler epics (Business and IT capabilities)

Ensure that IT solution design balances functional, service quality, security and system management requirements

Assess and translate internal customersâ€™ processes and requirements into D365 solution or best of breed solutions, including systems integrations and recommended ISV's

Review and approve design documents and solution from external partners

Provide advice on ERP system performance by proposing metrics to measure business and operations systems success

Ensure solution integrity, compliance, testing, and documentation

Coaches, supports and advices the department and business partners

Stay up to date and share industry best practices and provides feasibility studies when building new solutions

Your qualifications

10-15 years of total experience in Software development, integration, data and solution design

5+ yearsâ€™ experience in Solution Architecture

Bachelor or Master of Computer Science or a related discipline and several years of work experience in solution architecture roles

Experience and deep understanding of Dynamics 365 for Finance & Operations

SAFe (or similar) and TOGAF Enterprise Architect certification is a plus

Deep knowledge in Microsoft Azure technologies (such as Power Apps, Azure Web Apps, Logic Apps, API Gateway, Application Gateways, DB-PaaS, Azure Service Bus)

Strong learning aptitude; ability and drive to learn new technologies independently

Strong ownership mindset; self-motivated and passionate; able to deliver without being asked

Excellent leadership, communication, visualization and presentation skills in English (German at B2 or higher a plus), able to communicate with technical and business audiences effectively

Are you interested in this sophisticated position to be a part of building the future for Bossard? Please contact Sibylle Bachmann or apply here. For further information please contact StÃ©phane Hinderer (+41 41 749 61 78)

Bossard AG
Human Resources
Postfach
6301 Zug"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05641-1-000092975", "text": "Data Engineer Digital Transformation & Products Labs 80-100%

Your field of responsibility

An outstanding opportunity to join us as an Experienced Data Engineer to drive and build solutions for our internal customers within a big data platform. Your future colleagues

The Chief Risk and Compliance Officer function is a highly visible, dynamic area where you can be an integral part of the decision-making that supports the bankâ€™s business. We drive strategic and sustainable returns, and offer risk, controls and regulatory advice. You will join a team that is renowned for its dynamic and engaged culture. We believe our colleagues are our best asset. Become part of a highly motivated Analytics team at Credit Suisse. Join an international, demanding environment and work with us on the latest innovations in predictive analytics and visualization techniques to pioneer in building the state of the art technologies. Become part of an open-minded team with a strong team spirit in a collaborative, dynamic, and flexible working environment. We are a department which values Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) and is committed to realizing the firmâ€™s D&I ambition which is an integral part of our global cultural values.

Remote Working? N/A - pending TWWW agreement
Your skills and experience

You are willing to co-operate in a highly collaborative environment and contribute to the team's success while be taking on additional responsibilities to become a respected knowledge carrier within the team. 5+ years of work experience as Data Engineer, preferably in the financial industry

Experience in working with distributed computing environments (e.g. Spark, Hadoop or similar)

Demonstrated ability in building data pipelines and ability in understanding & creating efficient data models for complex business problems

Demonstrated ability in applying statistical modelling, machine learning and exploratory analysis to large datasets: anomaly detection, classification, scorecard models, segmentation, clustering

Experience working in agile software team, good knowledge in software life cycle management including version control (GIT)

Ability to manage stakeholder to effectively collaborate and build professional relationships across all organizational levels

Excellent written and verbal communication skills with proficiency in English, German is an asset.

Dedication to fostering an inclusive culture and value diverse perspectives

*LI-CSJOB*

Mr. Albinus would be delighted to receive your application.
Please apply via our career portal.

Your new employer

Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success. Why youâ€™ll love AppDynamics:
AppDynamics is an application performance monitoring solution that uses machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI) to provide real-time visibility and insight into IT environments. With our unique AIOps solution, you can take the right action at exactly the right time with automated anomaly detection, rapid root-cause analysis, and a unified view of your entire application ecosystem, including private and public clouds. Using AppDynamics, youâ€™ll finally align IT, DevOps, and the business around the information that helps you protect your bottom line and deliver excellent customer experiences. We make the digital world work. Our vision is to empower people and machines to continuously advance business performance to benefit everyone.
What You'll Do:
AppDynamics are looking for a strong performer who strives to push boundaries and develop their career each and every day. Evolving at a rapid pace, AppDynamics are dominating the Application Intelligence marketplace thus require experienced a-players with a thirst for action and an appetite for massive earnings.
This role entails that you establish trust and credibility with end users & partners through conducting product demoâ€™s both in-person and via web-based technologies as well as:

Articulate and lead AppDynamicsâ€™ complex sales cycles to present the value of our full product suite to decision makers

Developing relationships within enterprise organizations, presenting to C-level executives the value of our integration services

Forecast sales activity and revenue achievement in salesforce.com, while creating satisfied customers

Who You'll Work With:
Working in an individual contributor position within a high-energy team who have a track record of significant over achievement. Pipeline generation is the lifeblood of our operation and in joining this team; you must possess that same aim to uncover new opportunity as part of your daily operating rhythm. While especially hardworking, the team retains a significant focus on personal and professional development, therefore we will only seek individuals wishing to grow and develop their careers.
Who You Are:
First and foremost, you will ideally have a Bachelorâ€™s Degree or strong Software Sales experience, along with excellent negotiation skills.

5+ years of quota-carrying experience in a complex technology solution-selling environment, consistently meeting and exceeding sales quota

Both SaaS and on-premise selling experience a MUST

Previous Sales Methodology training in MEDDIC, SaaS Performance Management or Applications experience, and strong customer references preferred

Excellent presentation and poise

Strong digital literacy, including Salesforce.com, Microsoft Word, Powerpoint and excel

Looking at the future of AppD within Cisco, people need to be able to work with channel partners, Cisco and our OEM products. This is essential for success

Why AppD+Cisco?:
The world is changing. Today, people and devices are more connected than ever before, raising the bar for performance and the customer experience alike. At AppDynamics, weâ€™re unified in our mission to empower the enterprise with an AI-powered application performance monitoring solution that provides visibility and insight into the IT environment, as well as unified monitoring down to the network, so you can make mission critical and strategic decisions that drive business forward in real-time. When AppDynamics was acquired by Cisco for $3.7B it was the day before we were planning on going public. This strategic acquisition was 2.4 times more than we were planning to exit at, which highlights how much Cisco values the AppD business. So, why did they invest so much in us? As part of Cisco, AppDynamics will serve a critical role in helping drive Cisco's continued transformation into a software company. Being a part of the Cisco family allows us to benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05865-1-000079923", "text": "Data Scientist Intern - QuantumBlack

You will join QuantumBlackâ€™s leading data science team for ~12 to 16 weeks in either Spring or Autum in Zurich. You will gain experience working in interdisciplinary teams consisting of data scientists, data engineers, machine learning engineers, designers and McKinsey experts.

You will also be joining a team that will challenge you and invest in your professional development through client projects and R&D workstreams as a plus. You will be helping the best organizations in the world solve their most difficult problems.

QuantumBlack helps companies use data to drive decisions. We combine business experience, expertise in large-scale data analysis and visualization with advanced software engineering know-how to deliver results. From healthcare to Formula One, we help companies prototype, develop, and deploy bespoke data driven solutions to make better decisions.

You will work closely with our team of data scientists with backgrounds in fields such as (but not limited to) robotics, machine learning, physics, applied mathematics and neuroscience.

In this role you will work on either R&D workstreams, on live client projects, or a mixture of both. You will attend data science journal clubs and attend interdisciplinary team meetings.

You will be exposed to the most challenging problems by connecting real world business questions to machine learning methods and translating the results of your R&D work into actionable business solutions.

You share our curiosity for new methods and technologies, and our enthusiasm for data science challenges. As such, you will support our client services lead to identify business hypotheses and metrics, and you'll have the opportunity to define and drive the analytical scope and method for projects, including formulating and shaping the models.

You will communicate complex analytics concepts in a clear and concise manner to business leaders. You will use math, stats and machine learning to derive key insights across various industry sectors including Formula 1, pharma, automotive and high-tech. You will have the chance to write highly optimised code to advance our internal Data Science toolbox, and you'll develop world-class data science products for clients as well as for our data science team.

Real-World Impact â€“ No project is ever the same; we work across multiple sectors, providing unique learning and development opportunities internationally.

Fusing Tech & Leadership â€“ We work with the latest technologies and methodologies and offer first class learning programmes at all levels.

Multidisciplinary Teamwork - Our teams include data scientists, engineers, project managers, UX and visual designers who work collaboratively to enhance performance.

Innovative Work Culture â€“ Creativity, insight and passion come from being balanced. We cultivate a modern work environment through an emphasis on wellness, insightful talks and training sessions.

Striving for Diversity â€“ With colleagues from over 40 nationalities, we recognise the benefits of working with people from all walks of life.

Our projects range from helping pharmaceutical companies bring lifesaving drugs to market quicker to optimising a Formula1 carâ€™s performance. At QuantumBlack you have the best of both worlds; all the benefits of being part of one of the leading management consultancies globally and the autonomy to thrive in a fast growth tech culture:

Healthcare Efficiency â€“ We helped a healthcare provider improve their clinical trial practices by identifying congestion in diagnostic testing as a key indicator of admissions breaches.

Environmental Impact â€“ We designed and built the first data-driven application for a state of the art centre of excellence in urban innovation by collecting real-time data from environmental sensors across London and deploying proprietary analytics to find unexpected patterns in air pollution.

Product Development â€“ We worked with the CEO of an elite automotive organisation to reduce the 18-month car development timeframe by improving processes, designs and team structures.

BenefitsThis is a paid internship.

Visit our Careers site to watch our video and read about our interview processes and benefits"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05888-1-000098820", "text": "Applied AI/Research Analytics Lead

Applied AI/Research Analytics Lead - (18029196)
Description

About Syngenta:

Syngenta is a leading science-based Agtech company; dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries works together to solve one of humanityâ€™s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture.

Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture

About this opportunity: Help drive adoption of advanced machine learning in our Technology and Digital Integration (TDI) function, Crop Protection R&D

As part of Syngenta's digital transformation journey, there is an increasing emphasis on data-driven approaches in R&D. From exploiting new digital technologies in the lab to extracting maximum value from existing knowledge, data- and model-driven decision making is changing the way we do science and develop new solutions for sustainable food production.

We are looking for a data scientist or machine learning engineer with a solid technical foundation, a sense of curiosity and interest in applying diverse AI technologies to a broad range of real-world R&D challenges.

Reporting into the Digital Science & Technology team, you will be responsible for building a strategic vision for deployment of advanced machine learning capabilities across the R&D organization and driving its adoption for maximum impact. As a technical expert, you will collaborate with a diverse set of predictive modellers, data scientists and R&D domain experts from many different scientific disciplines to understand problems and use your judgment to find the best solutions.

Qualifications

With your background in machine learning, you should be familiar with major ML approaches used to solve analytics and decision problems in different domains, such as machine vision, generative algorithms or agent-based policy optimization. You have enough understanding of ML algorithms to tweak models, and from experience, you understand practical aspects of deploying different AI technologies, such as data needs, tooling, and scalability. Rather than needing to be an expert in a specific field, you will work with diverse scientists and IT delivery teams to understand which features to exploit, and identify approaches that can be used across different parts of the organization. A background in life sciences is a plus, but not essential.

Ideally, you are a hands-on person who enjoys working with a diverse set of people and bringing them together, is motivated to continuously learn and expand your horizon, and likes prototyping and creatively applying new methods.

Good communication skills, strategic thinking and the ability to work flexibly in cross-functional teams are essential.

In return for your skills and knowledge Syngenta will offer:

Flexible working location in office base and or home working

Competitive benefits package

The opportunity to work with and learn from highly qualified and experienced employees

We embrace and encourage diversity, and this is what drives our innovation and lets us outperform the market. [wwwadr]

Primary Location
: GBR-Berkshire-Bracknell
Other Locations
: CHE-Basel-Basel
Job
: R&D - Research"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05888-1-000098824", "text": "AI Planner Trainee

AI Planner Trainee - (18035421)
Description

Syngenta Group is one of the worldâ€™s leading agriculture innovation companies, with roots going back more than 250 years. Its 48,000 people across more than 100 countries strive to transform agriculture through breakthrough products and technologies that play a vital role in enabling the food chain to feed the world safely, sustainably and with respect for our planet. Swiss headquartered and Chinese-owned, the Group draws strength from its four business units â€“ Syngenta Crop Protection headquartered in Switzerland, Syngenta Seeds headquartered in the United States, ADAMA headquartered in Israel, and Syngenta Group China â€“ that provide industry-leading ways to serve customers everywhere.

AI Planner Trainee â€“ 12 months (18035421)

In this 12-month internship position you will maintain agreed service levels of the business by managing the end-to-end supply chain for a number of allocated active ingredient families - Ensure efficient use of the end-to-end inventory, whilst minimizing working capital - Work closely with various stakeholder (commercial, supply chain managers, sourcing team).

Accountabilities:

Manage the overall supply/demand balance for the respective portfolio by reviewing the sales forecast, AI net demands, and then creating balanced production/purchase plans for the planning horizon

Proactively identify demand uncertainties and future supply constraints to develop options/scenarios, ensuring that future supply plans are optimized

Provide operational coordination across the end-to-end supply chain to achieve the right balance between inventory and customer service levels

Utilize financial metrics to optimize cash management when managing trade-offs between inventory, production, purchases, and logistics decisions

Actively contribute to and coordinate execution of supply chain (re)design activities in close

Qualifications

Degree or equivalent in Business, Logistics, Science or Engineering, formal supply chain qualification preferred

Learning culture (Together we Grow) and wide range of training options

Please be aware that the job title may differ from the position title.

Learn more about our team and our mission.

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, or any other employment practices for reasons of race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05892-1-000089379", "text": "Software Engineer III, Front-End, Android System UI Engineering

Build Androidâ€™s core user experience in Kotlin and Java.

Work with PM and UX to imagine and refine the interactions and surfaces that users live with every day on their devices.

Minimum qualifications:

Bachelorâ€™s degree or equivalent practical experience.

Experience with data structures or algorithms in either an academic or industry setting.

Experience with software development Java programming languages.

Experience with graphical user interface.

Preferred qualifications:

Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field.

Experience with front-end frameworks, full-stack development, and/or API development.

Experience with one or more of the following: UI Design, User Experience, Graphical User Experience, Critical User Journeys, Animation, Operating Systems, Mobile, Mobile Interfaces, Kotlin, Android, and/or Android Apps.

Experience developing accessible technologies.

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Googleâ€™s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.
With your technical expertise you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.

Android System UI is the tight-knit but growing team responsible for the overall user experience of the Android OS. We work with our UX and Product Managers counterparts through the entire lifecycle of every feature to craft the essential interactive parts of the operating system itself, including: ambient display, lock screen, authentication, biometric UI, notifications and related APIs and policies, including do-not-disturb, and wallpaper, theming, and customization, notably Material.

We relentlessly pursue performance, robustness, and user delight, because code will end up in the Android Open-Source Project and find its way into devices built by of original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) globally.

Android is Googleâ€™s open-source mobile operating system powering more than 3 billion devices worldwide. Android is about bringing computing to everyone in the world. We believe computing is a super power for good, enabling access to information, economic opportunity, productivity, connectivity between friends and family and more. We think everyone in the world should have access to the best computing has to offer. We provide the platform for original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and developers to build compelling computing devices (smartphones, tablets, TVs, wearables, etc) that run the best apps/services for everyone in the world."}

Like Google's own ambitions, the work of a Software Engineer (SWE) goes way beyond just Search. SWE Managers have not only the technical expertise to take on and provide technical leadership to major projects, but also manage a team of engineers. You not only optimize your own code but make sure engineers are able to optimize theirs. As a SWE Manager you manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy and help develop your team. SWE teams work all across the company, in areas such as information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. Operating with scale and speed, our exceptional software engineers are just getting started -- and as a manager, you guide the way.
At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun â€” and we do it all together."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05892-1-000089428", "text": "Staff Software Engineer, YouTube

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05895-1-000083838", "text": "Professur fÃ¼r Healthy Ageing (Departement Gesundheitswissenschaften und Technologie)

Professur fÃ¼r Healthy Ageing

Hauptinhalt

The Department of Health Sciences and Technology ([wwwadr]) at ETH Zurich invites applications for the above-mentioned position.
The new professor will be expected to be a world-renown expert in the field of ageing research, in the promotion of healthy ageing or in the prevention of ageing-associated diseases like neurodegeneration or diabetes. In particular, she or he may have a long-standing expertise in the elucidation of biological mechanisms of ageing using human cohorts and/or model organisms to apply expertise in functional genetics or pharmacological/nutritional interventions. Alternatively, the successful candidate is an expert in applying exercise to prevent or mechanistic aids to ameliorate symptoms of functional decline. The research will provide unprecedented approaches to promote healthy ageing by preventing or reverting physiological, yet widely undefined hallmarks of higher age. Specific expertise may include (i) biological mechanisms of ageing, using model organisms like yeast, fruit flies, roundworms and/or mice, (ii) genetics of ageing and age-associated diseases, including neurodegeneration and metabolic disorders, (iii) mechanism-based prevention of physiological decline by pharmacological, nutritional or exercise interventions, as well as tissues engineering and replacement, and (iv) the quantification, maintenance and restoration of movement capacity applying high-end engineering and robotics approaches. Particular interest goes to researchers with a translational medical focus.
Additional prerequisites are a strong motivation and an indisputable commitment to teaching. The professorship will be embedded in the Departmentâ€™s programme in Health Sciences and Technology, Food Sciences, as well as Human Medicine. In general, at ETH Zurich undergraduate level courses are taught in German or English and graduate level courses are taught in English.
Please apply online.
Applications should include a curriculum vitae, a list of publications, a statement of future research and teaching interests, a description of the leadership philosophy, and a description of the three most important achievements*. The letter of application should be addressed to the President of ETH Zurich, Prof. Dr. JoÃ«l Mesot. The closing date for applications is 31 May 2022. ETH Zurich is an equal opportunity and family friendly employer, values diversity, strives to increase the number of women professors, and is responsive to the needs of dual career couples.

*Die ETH ZÃ¼rich legt Wert auf eine qualitative Bewertung akademischer Leistungen. In diesem Sinne sind Sie gebeten, eine kurze Beschreibung Ihrer drei wichtigsten Errungenschaften den Unterlagen beizufÃ¼gen (maximal je eine halbe Seite). Dies kÃ¶nnen neben Forschungsergebnissen auch besondere Leistungen in der Lehre und deren Weiterentwicklung, Dienstleistungen zugunsten der akademischen Gemeinschaft oder der Gesellschaft, Softwareentwicklungen, Patente, Wissens-? und Praxistransfer, Spin-?offs und dergleichen sein."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05895-1-000083846", "text": "Cloud engineer 60%-100%, fixed-term

Cloud engineer
60%-100%, fixed-term
The Swiss Data Science Center (SDSC) is a national center between EPFL and ETH Zurich, whose mission is to accelerate the use of data science and machine learning techniques broadly within academic disciplines of the ETH Domain, the Swiss academic community at large, and the industrial sector. The SDSC is composed of a large multi-disciplinary team of data & computer scientists and experts in relevant domains, distributed between our offices in Lausanne and Zurich.

Project background

The main mission of the SDSCâ€™s engineering team is to build and deploy Renku (see our beta deployment at renkulab.io), an open source software platform that empowers data scientists to produce reproducible, reusable and verifiable analyses.

Job description

We are looking for a creative engineer to join our ranks. In this role, you will help build the infrastructure and application backbone of the Renku project. Your contributions will enable new features and ensure smooth access to instances of Renku for hundreds of researchers, analysts and students from around the world in fields as varied as astronomy, ecology, and personalized medicine. In addition, you will work closely with the rest of the Renku team to enable uninterrupted platform development by providing rock-solid internal infrastructure.

More specifically, you will contribute to the following areas:

Deployment, monitoring, profiling and troubleshooting of our development and production environments

Automating the lifecycle of our cloud infrastructure

Improving the deployment recipes of our platform

Consolidate and further the devops culture across the Renku project

Your profile

You are an engineer with a minimum of a BSc in Computer Science or a related discipline and feel capable of working with our technology stack:

We deploy and manage several Kubernetes clusters in an Openstack-based cloud environment.

Terraform is our tool of choice for infrastructure management.

We use GitOps (Flux) and Helm to manage the applications lifecycle.

Our CI/CD pipelines are based on GitHub actions and Bash/Python scripting.

Please note that we do not expect successful candidates to have deep knowledge in all the above technologies and frameworks. Ideally, you will have experience with some and be eager to learn more along the way.

We offer

Our engineering and operations team loosely follows an agile methodology. We work with a very flat hierarchy which gives individual engineers a high degree of autonomy and responsibility, and we encourage all of our team members to contribute their unique viewpoints to the overall decision making. The platform we are building is multi-faceted which means that our team is equally varied and constantly learning.

We offer a stimulating, collaborative, cross-disciplinary environment in a world-class research institution. Our engineering team of 19 hails from more than 10 countries and we are committed to upholding the teamâ€™s diversity in the future. We value work-life balance and will readily consider part-time employment options as well as occasional or regular home-office work.

In this dynamic position, you will make full use of your engineering skills. We encourage experimentation and creativity by actively promoting learning of new technologies and approaches on the job. We are dedicated to open source software and we encourage our team members to seek out opportunities to engage with and contribute to open source communities as a part of their development process.

ETH Zurich
ETH Zurich is one of the worldâ€™s leading universities specialising in science and technology. We are renowned for our excellent education, cutting-edge fundamental research and direct transfer of new knowledge into society. Over 30,000 people from more than 120 countries find our university to be a place that promotes independent thinking and an environment that inspires excellence. Located in the heart of Europe, yet forging connections all over the world, we work together to develop solutions for the global challenges of today and tomorrow. Working, teaching and research at ETH Zurich"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05898-1-000087083", "text": "ML Engineer for Imaging

EPFL, the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne, is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs more than 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of more than 16,000 people, including over 12,000 students and 4,000 researchers from more than 120 different countries.

The EPFL Center for Imaging serves as a hub for state-of-the-art technologies in imaging science. The only one of its kind in Switzerland, the center pools the expertise of over a hundred laboratories distributed across the five EPFL schools. Its mission is to facilitate cross-disciplinary research in the field and anchor EPFLâ€™s position as a world-leading institution in imaging science. It is also responsible for addressing the ever-growing needs in image handling and analysis of the EPFL imaging community. [wwwadr]

ML Engineer for Imaging
Your mission :
You will use Machine Learning and Deep Learning for image quantification on various projects in the Image Analysis Hub of the EPFL Center for Imaging.
More specifically you will:

Support EPFLâ€™s wide community of scientists (ranging from astrophysics through biomedical imaging to quantum physics) with machine learning for image quantification. This requires experience and critical use of ML, knowing when ML is a viable strategy, which pitfalls to avoid and in what cases outputs can be trusted;

Contribute to the development and safe use of ML applied to image analysis at EPFL. This means creation of best-practice advice, as well as well-documented software tools and pipelines. This will be done in a strong context of Open Science and will benefit from professional programming experience with documentation and testing.

This technical role is closely linked with the â€œImage Analysis Engineerâ€ also being recruited within the EPFL Center for Imaging. Main duties and responsibilities include :

Application of ML and DL techniques to the multitude of different image-analysis problems that the Image Analysis Hub will be involved in

Development of innovative learning-based techniques with wide applicability

Deploying ML at scale with optimised pipeline to run on large computers

Overseeing the correct use of ML in the Hubâ€™s projects and collaboration through the creation of best-practice guides, as well as critical testing and evaluation of trained networks

Promote and co-supervise student projects led by specialised laboratories that address concrete problems generated by other actors in imaging

Be involved with student projects on imaging topics, providing supervision and training

Animate and support our â€œImage Analysis Hotlineâ€ chat

Your profile :
You are an image-analysis specialist with a MSc degree in a technical field (Engineering or Maths) who has used ML in a number of projects.

Essential skills and experiences:

Experience with creating and training networks for different image quantification tasks

Excellent familiarity with at least one of the main ML frameworks

Understanding of the decisions and importance of creating a suitable network for training

Good programming skills for imaging, especially in Python and CUDA

Desirable qualifications:

Experience with the development of open-source libraries and are familiar with various open environments (Jupyter notebooks, github)

Experience with advanced, scientific visualisation

We offer :

A stimulating, collaborative, cross-disciplinary environment in a world-class research institution that is at the forefront of imaging science

Over a hundred laboratories perform elite research in imaging, covering all scales from the atomic to the cosmological one, and spanning a broad range of applications

Equipment with advanced imaging facilities that provide access to the latest cutting-edge technologies

You will engage on a daily basis with a dynamic and creative community of scientists, and you will be involved in a large variety of exciting research problems in imaging. By joining the EPFL Center for Imaging, you will consolidate a growing team of experts working to anchor EPFL at the cutting edge of imaging technology for research applications, at a time when many exciting opportunities for imaging science are also emerging at the Swiss level.
Start date :
As soon as possible (July 2022 at the latest). Term of employment :
Fixed-term (CDD)Work rate :
100%Duration :
1 year, renewable (for at least 2 years). Remark :
Only candidates who applied through EPFL website or our partner Jobupâ€™s website will be considered. Files sent by agencies without a mandate will not be taken into account.Reference :
Job Nb 2215apply online"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-06172-1-000090245", "text": "Ph.D. positions within ERC project: "Perceptually-Driven Optimizations of Graphics Content for Novel Displays"

Faculty of Informatics

Ph.D. positions within ERC project:

â€œPerceptually-Driven Optimizations of

Graphics Content for Novel Displaysâ€

The Perception, Display, and Fabrication Group at the UniversitÃ  della Svizzera italiana
(USI) in Lugano, Switzerland, is looking for highly motivated Ph.D. candidates to work at the
intersection of computer graphics, novel display technologies, and visual perception within
the ERC Starting Grant project â€œPerceptually-Driven Optimizations of Graphics Content for
Novel Displaysâ€. The positions are fully-funded. We offer a competitive salary in line with
Swiss universities.

The goal of the project is to develop new content adaptation and generation techniques for
future displays, such that the displayed images closely match the capabilities of novel
display devices as well as the requirements of human perception. The approach should
assure that the computational resources are not wasted for generating content which is
irrelevant to observers, and guarantee the highest perceived quality possible. We would like
to focus on the newly emerging display technologies such as virtual reality and augmented
reality displays which allow for addressing all visual cues available in the real world.

Asuccessful candidate should have:

Master degree in computer science or a closely related field,

a good programming and math skills,

knowledge of computer graphics/vision tools, such as OpenGL, OpenCV, Matlab,

fluent English, both written and spoken,

a strong desire for research and publishing at top venues,

an experience with deep learning frameworks will be an additional advantage.

The course work and interests in one or more of the following areas are desired:

computer graphics & rendering,

image & video processing,

new display devices (such as VR and AR),

human visual perception,

eye tracking,

machine learning.

Applications should be sent directly to Prof. Piotr Didyk ([email]). The subject of
the e-mail should start with the phrase â€œ[Application]â€.
The documents should include:

CV,

transcripts of records,

a statement of purpose,

contacts to 2-3 persons who agreed to write recommendation letters,

a complete list of publications, if any.

page 2 / 2

Perception, Display, and Fabrication Group at the USI Lugano in Switzerland conducts
high-quality research in the field of computer graphics and computer vision. Their goal is to
combine computational techniques with human perception and hardware design to create
better display and fabrication techniques. The areas of expertise include computer graphics,
new display technologies, image/video processing, 3D printing, computational fabrication,
and human perception. We focus on publishing at the top computer graphics and computer
vision venues. Many of our works have been presented as technical papers at the ACM
SIGGRAPH conference series. We expect the candidates to contribute to this success. The
group has several ongoing collaborations with world-leading research centers including MIT,
Harvard, University of Toronto, Adobe Systems, Nvidia, and Max Planck Institute. The future
group members are expected to take an active part in these activities.

The Faculty of Informatics at UniversitÃ  della Svizzera italiana is defined by its passion
for scientific research. Around 200 top researchers from around the world conduct research
in several computer science areas, with tens of millions of Swiss francs in competitive
funding obtained to date. Over the years, the Faculty has become one of the leading
research centers in Switzerland and an international point of reference in many fields.
More information about the faculty: [wwwadr]

More information about the positions and the group:

contact: [email]

visit: [wwwadr]"}

This applies to degree courses and work, as well as academic careers, university management positions and the reconciliation of studies, work and private commitments. We are committed to this with various measures in the areas of teaching, research, administration and the Presidency.

In our canteen you will find a wide selection of freshly prepared meals - from vegetarian to fish dishes - at discounted prices.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-06228-1-000103117", "text": "Post-doctoral Researcher in Accounting

Introduction

UNIL is a leading international teaching and research institution, with over 5,000 employees and 17,000 students split between its Dorigny campus, CHUV and Epalinges. As an employer, UNIL encourages excellence, individual recognition and responsibility.

Presentation

The Department of Accounting and Control (DAC) invites applications for a

Post-Doctoral Researcher in Accounting

Job information

Date of start:                  01.05.2022 or to be agreed
Duration of contract:        2 years (for the duration of the funding)
Employment rate:           100%
Work location:                HEC Lausanne-UNIL, Anthropole Building

Your responsibilities

70% of the time will be allocated to research and teaching activities linked to the research project granted by the Sandoz Family Foundation â€“ Monique de Meuron programme to the supervisor, Professor Gaia Melloni.
The specific research programme that Prof. Gaia Melloni was awarded is in the field of sustainability accounting and looks at the incorporation of social and environmental information into traditional financial reports and approaches that make possible to track organizationsâ€™ financial performance alongside their environmental and societal impacts.
A second main area of investigation explores whether businesses that have adopted sustainable behaviours have been more resilient during the Covid-19 crisis.
More information are available here:
[wwwadr]

30% of the time will be allocated to research and/or other related activities.

Your qualifications

	â€¢  PhD degree (or near to completion) with excellent skills of quantitative data collection and analysis;

	â€¢  Strong interest for research in the fields of Sustainability accounting, Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) disclosure and/or performance measurement, Corporate Social Responsibility (CRS).

	â€¢  Skills in textual analysis, coding and programming language (e.g. Python) and/or data mining, machine learning.

	â€¢  Fluency in English and strong academic writing skills.

What the position offers you

We offer a nice working place in a multicultural, diverse and dynamic academic environment. Opportunities for professional training, a lot of activities and other benefits to discover.

Contact for further information

For further information about the position, please contact Professor Gaia Melloni. E-mail [email].

Your application

Deadline : 28.02.2022

Applicants should submit a curriculum vitae, a letter of motivation, two letters of recommendation, university transcripts, job market paper and/or other working papers.

Applications should be sent only through the UNIL website [wwwadr] position no. 18782. Only applications submitted through this website will be considered.

Description

This is a unique opportunity to work in the team that builds our Artificial Intelligence Review Assistant (AIRA) - which has been featured on numerous news outlets.

Key Responsibilities

Create and own the data acquisition roadmap for our AIRA suite of products

Lead the acquisition of third party datasets, via data crawling initiatives, partnerships or engaging with vendors

Solid background of working as a Product Manager / Product Owner

Prior experience with cloud data platforms, such as Databricks

Strong analytical skills and independent, entrepreneurial approach

Experience with software development and data processing

Experience with Agile Methodologies

Solid communication skills in English, both written and verbal are vital

Desirable Skills

Statistical analysis and mathematical experience is welcome

Previous experience with Salesforce projects

Experience with defining technical specifications describing requirements for data transfer, transformation and storage, with attention to big data topics,

Ability to understand and challenge architectural decisions

Benefits

Competitive salary.

Participation in Frontiers annual bonus scheme

25 leave days + 4 well-being days (pro rata and expiring each year on 31st of December)

Great work-life balance.

Opportunity to work remotely

English classes.

Team building/sport activities and monthly social events.

Lots of opportunities to work with exciting technologies and solve challenging problems

Who we are

Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher. We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability and we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.
Apply for this job"}

Codos platform motivates people all around the world to shift their commuting patterns away from regular combustion engine cars, towards environmentally friendly modes of commuting. Possess the willingness to maintain a flexible work schedule necessary to fulfill the responsibilities of this position, including occasional evenings and weekends.

Masterâ€™s degree in business, finance, engineering or a related field

A natural leader able to shape the future of climate change and building up and motivating an international team

Minimum of 3 years' experience as a CEO, CTO or similar management background

In-depth understanding of risk management, compliance, and regulatory requirements

In-depth understanding of budgeting, and capital planning management

Experience with corporate governance, business development and business planning

Strong negotiation skills in bringing together stakeholders

Strategic leadership ability and proven experience in building and leading a team

Fluent oral and written English skills; any additional language skills are advantageous

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05036-1-000258319", "text": "Application Engineer

WyzoTM is a fast-pacing spin-off from delta robotic pioneers' company whose vision is to set the new benchmark for accessible workplace automation in pick and place technology. The WyzoTM ecosystem design seamlessly integrates with and complements human operation, empowering new enterprising manufacturers to grow and transform their business - a big mission that requires people driven by big passion. So join us in this journey, and let's make the industrial workplace "Fast and further, together"!

Job Description

We are now looking for an Application Engineer to integrate our cross-functional structure in the Lausanne area to train, support and develop high performing integrators' base to meet the needs of business and our customers today and in the future. The aim for you is to be the first and best sidebot provider for existing and new integrators and distributors. In addition, you contribute to optimizing the value chain that creates a better ecosystem with our end-users and partners.

While reporting to the Business Developer Manager, you will work closely with development team and integrators.

Among Other Things, You Will

Evaluate and research solutions and concepts in the scope of developing the product Wyzo and its eco-system to support the development team.

Conduct validation of new release of WyzoTM products and accessories.

Support the development engineers and the industrialization team in supply chain management.

Prepare and deliver integrators training on the product WyzoTM on software, safety, vision, grippers technologies.

Provide on-site or remote support to integrators on deployment and implementation of the sidebot WyzoTM.

Support sales in helping integrators to understand the capabilities of the WyzoTM.

Create customized demos and assist with a technical proof-of-concept to demonstrate WyzoTM capabilities and how the solution will work within the customer's existing environment.

Provide after-sales technical support on WyzoTM programming and applications.

Communicate integrator's needs and product enhancement feedback to the development team.

Generate applications notes and knowledge base documentation.

Willingness and ability to travel domestically and internationally.

To shine and succeed in this role, we wish that you:

Hold a Bachelor's degree or higher in Mechanical or Mechatronic Engineering

Have experience with structured sales, plans, budgets, and pipeline management.

Have excellent communication & negotiation skills and the ability to build trustful relationships

Having overseas working experience in an English-speaking environment would be nice.

Bachelor/Master degree, in degree in mechanical/mechatronic engineering, robot technology

Have passion for robotics and solving technical problems

Have good debugging skills and innovative mindset

Be customer oriented and able to communicate with customer / integrators positively and in a timely manner.

Have business proficiency in English and/or German (written and spoken).

Must have very good communications skills, both written and verbal.

Does this sound like you? Yes? Then, why not apply?

We offer you a position in a fast-paced, truly global environment with an endless supply of future opportunities!"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05098-1-000258625", "text": "IIoT Solution Architect

Our Opening and Your Responsibilities With increased integration of our solutions into IT and OT, system understanding, and architecture will gain further importance. Our Global Industrial Division is expanding the Global R&D team by building a new R&D competence center in Switzerland, facilitating an end-to-end development of our high-end terminals, paving the way to leverage Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT), with the terminal as a key-component in edge computing.  That is why we are looking for a motivated IIoT Solution Architect 80%-100% (f/m/d).This role is based in our global operational Headquarters in NÃ¤nikon-Greifensee.
In this role, you will be part of the new R&D team who will shape the future of METTTLER TOLEDO products in the journey towards device connectivity and IIoT solutions.
Your responsibilities would include:

Be a key member of the team who defines the future system architecture for the Industrial division. This involves software solutions across the entire technology stack, with IIoT and device connectivity as a major part of it.

Define the IIoT solution architecture design, which will shape and optimize the production environment of our customers.

Design solutions that comply to all demands in terms of cyber security, have strong customer orientation with an emphasis on scalability, modularity, flexibility, serviceability, and performance.

Bring experience in Device Identity Provisioning, Connectivity Configuration / Management, device claiming and device â€œfleetâ€ monitoring area etc.

Define / consult IIoT capability roadmaps and embed these into the overruling divisional software roadmap.

Shape the underlying data-pipeline and define criteria, how customer data is used in our IIoT solutions.

Shape the selection process for client, server, storage, and cloud infrastructure solutions, and be part of strategic decision making (buy, build, partner).

Guide innovation projects with the target to develop outstanding IIoT services.

Work closely with your cooperation partners, who are product managers, software development team, IT security and cloud infrastructure team.

What You Need to Succeed Following requirements are necessary for this role:

Master/ Bachelorâ€™s degree in engineering or science (Informatics, Computer Science or equivalent)

Several years of experience in IIoT solutions, supporting in similar industries and connected devices.

Strong technical knowledge and experience of IIoT device life cycle management capabilities

Know the relevant industrial communication protocols, such as OPC-UA, MQTT, WebSocket streams and Kafka.

Solid knowledge of integration patterns and best practices such as synchronous vs. asynchronous communications, RESTful APIs, messaging, publish-subscribe

Cloud system architecture, best practices, container-based architectures, Docker, Kybernetes as well as Azure and Alibaba cloud technologies.

Basic knowledge of data engineering, data science, advanced algorithmics and machine learning in industrial applications. Programming skills in relevant languages, such as Python, C, C# and C++.

Hands-on experience with containers and orchestration platforms

Ability to communicate across different functional teams with various cultural backgrounds

Experience in working in CI/CD, knowledge in DevOps and Agile Frameworks

Experience working in industrial environment

Fluent in English, German is a big advantage

You have the capability to learn fast in case you donâ€™t fulfill all of the above requirements.

Learn more about our solutions:  METTLER TOLEDO Get Ready for Industry 4.0 - METTLER TOLEDO Industrial - en - YouTube Our Offer to You We are offering:

Where applicable flexible working hours, a hybrid work model and a wide portfolio of training opportunities

40h week with at least 25 vacation days per year plus 4 to 7 additional days off (i.e. in between bank holidays)

Free parking spaces and direct access to public transport from our facilities

Healthy menus cooked onsite and special prices for employees at our own METTLER TOLEDO restaurant

A range of additional attractive benefits like discounts for sport clubs and others

You can expect challenging, interesting, and varied tasks in an innovative and international environment, with the opportunity to network globally and realize your next career goal.
Have we raised your interest? Then we look forward to receiving your online application. If you have any question, please do not hesitate to contact us. Our e-mail address is
[email]
.
We consider only direct applications. About Mettler Toledo METTLER TOLEDO is a leading global supplier of precision instruments and services. We are recognized as an innovation leader and our solutions are critical in key R&D, quality control, and manufacturing processes for customers in a wide range of industries including life sciences, food, and chemicals. We operate throughout the world with a culture shaped by innovation and international flair. Equal Opportunity Employment We promote equal opportunity worldwide and value diversity in our teams in terms of business background, area of expertise, gender and ethnicity. For more information on our commitment to Sustainability, Diversity and Equal Opportunity please visit us
here
.
For those who prioritize precision, Mettler Toledo is precisely where you belong.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05219-1-000247583", "text": "Supply Chain Compliance Manager (f/m/d)

Job Purpose
Compliance of external suppliers (component suppliers, contract manufacturers, service providers, 3rd party product suppliers) and goods/services purchased with Straumann procedures and applicable regulations.

Execution of the supplier audit program

Perform audits according to the supplier audit program.

Manage supplier audit records in order to ensure correct documentation, effective closure, including re-audits and observations handling

Inform the corporate level on audit results allowing the corporate hierarchy to take preventive action.

Monitor and follow-up Corrective Action and Preventive Action (CAPA) derived from corporate supplier audits.

Supplier compliance and Vendor Management

Define the qualification requirements for external suppliers and support during the qualification process.

Process changes and requests for new suppliers. Reevaluation of existing suppliers.

Maintain the Approved Supplier List (ASL): Maintenance of quality related data in Vendor Management module in SAP.

Supplier performance monitoring including trending, data mining and reporting.

Quality assurance

Create, update, maintain and train the incoming product inspection planning and release the quality data packages for Headquarter

Formal batch/product release based on quality certificates and/or record review for goods delivered from external suppliers (excluding Straumann manufacturing sites) to HQ.

CAPA processing

Investigate, Review and Approve in the Exception Management Process

Assess non-conforming products and decide on their disposition

Main Tasks and Responsibilities

Ensure that an appropriate quality assurance system is established throughout the supply chain in order to support the marketing activities.

Set up and maintain quality assurance agreements (QAA) with the suppliers

Ensure application of quality assurance agreements and verify their application.

Identify quality issues and escalate them in an appropriate manner (analytical skills)

Support Straumann and its subsidiaries and distributors with regards to compliance with distributor obligations.

Ensure that required regulatory documentation for 3rd party products is available for the distribution chain.

Maintain and improve processes

Support other Departments in regard of interpretation of quality assurance requirements

Communicate new quality assurance requirements and support in implementing these.

Identify possible improvements in the supplier compliance and QA processes, define and lead the implementation.

Share best practice realization among the Straumann organization to ensure a more functional business development opportunity.

Auditing (if qualified): Lead Auditor for Quality System Audits (Supplier, Corporate, Internal).

Profile:
Education:

University degree or equivalent in an applicable field (quality, engineering or other relevant scientific discipline). Advanced graduate studies/degrees are an asset.

Formal qualification / training / certification on medical devices regulations such as ISO13485, Regulation (EU) 745/2017 (MDR), US FDA 21CFR Part 820 and other MDSAP regulations.

Experience:

3+ years of previous experience within the medical devices/pharmaceutical industry or 5+ years of experience within quality management, preferably at manufacturing site.

Proven experience of Supplier Management and Purchasing Controls regulatory requirements.

Proven experience with medical devices, including product design, manufacturing, life cycle management.

Expert understanding of global medical device regulations and quality requirements as well as industry practice.

Experience in audit process as auditor or lead auditor. Strong analytical and investigational skills.

Proven project experience, preferably for process improvement projects (Lean, Six Sigma), are an asset.

Personal Attributes
:

Excellent communication skills, as demonstrated in a multi-cultural and multi-lingual environment. Distinct customer orientation both internally and externally. Team player with open, positive attitude and respect for others

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability.

Employment Type: Full Time

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05236-1-000254145", "text": "Internship Software Engineering (w/m) 80-100%

Internship Software Engineering (w/m)

Operations Research

Internship Software Engineering (w/m)

Operations Research
You will contribute to the software development of optimisation applications in the energy environment and independently implement performance improvements, new functionalities and prototypes. We offer you the opportunity to apply your knowledge of mathematical optimisation and your programming skills in an innovative environment and to implement your ideas profitably in a 3-6 month internship. We are looking for a new team member in this interesting field with a passion for mathematical optimisation (operations research) and software development in Python.
Adrian Hauswirth
, Senior Data & Optimisation Scientist, has found the following position for you:
You are passionate about this field
You will support the Endaprime team in the further development of the HIVE application for the planning of cellular energy systems. You will be responsible for improving the code quality and the computing times of the central optimisation application (linear optimisation). For this purpose, you will perform refactorings, evaluate alternative optimisation solvers (GUROBI, CPLEX, etc.) and optimise parameters. Thanks to your previous experience and know-how, you can offer your help in developing new features for the optimisation application. You also enjoy helping to develop innovative prototypes and proof-of-concepts in the area of optimisation and machine learning for energy systems.
We're impressed by your expertise

You have completed your Bachelor's or Master's degree in natural sciences or engineering and attended lectures on mathematical optimisation.

You have programming experience in Python (incl. object-oriented programming) with a focus on numerical computations (numpy, pandas, pyomo), ideally in a collaborative environment (incl. code versioning, issue tracking, etc.).

You have already applied your knowledge of mathematical optimisation and machine learning in projects or internships.

With your careful and structured way of working you write clear and efficient program code of high quality and you understand how to explain technical issues in a simple way.

Thanks to your willingness to learn and apply yourself, as well as your enjoyment of new topics, you take responsibility for your tasks.

We are not interested in enquiries from recruitment agencies.

What you can look forward to
As a responsible employer, we offer:

Fair and market-oriented remuneration

Flexible working models

Personalised training and development opportunities

Comprehensive health management system

A progressive infrastructure

Adrian Hauswirth

We look forward to receiving your online application.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05850-1-000270024", "text": "Technical Solutions Architect - Cloud Infrastructure & Software Group

We change the World and you'll love it. Our employees' groundbreaking ideas make huge impact on everyone's life and our digital world. We address challenges and take ideas from the drawing board to real-world solutions. Become part of an outstanding team that cares about customers, lives technology and enjoys having fun while learning every day. We are waiting for you to join us and to become passionate about your employer and the brand we represent.

What You'll Do

As a Technical Solutions Architect, you play a key role in the success of Cisco field sales teams in selling our technology products and solutions tailored to customers. You will work together with other Cloud Infrastructure & Software Group (CISG) specialists to position our software, unified computing & cloud networking solutions. You will drive presales engineering and will collaborate with other teams across organizational boundaries and geographies to overcome technical and commercial challenges to win against opposing offerings.

You'll Work With

In a strong team, covering Switzerland you are free to put innovation to practice and seek tremendous opportunities for growth. You will succeed because we have your back, and because we do listen to our customers and help them anticipate market shifts and technology transitions.

Our customers span from government to private enterprises. They are diverse, but all need technology to adapt fast and grow purposefully. The Specialist Team provides you with outstanding opportunities to succeed at Cisco. You will love the team and a spirit that supports and empowers you.

Who You Are

You are curious and inspired. You are enthusiastic about technology, and love the hard work, getting things up and running. But you also love having fun with colleagues and customers. You enjoy to learn and grow along with your work.

Your background is around Software Development, Cloud, Compute & Network Architectures. If you have experience with Cisco products, even better. Software solutions and distributed systems, monitoring and observability tools, data center networking, converged and hyper-converged infrastructure, storage systems, backup solutions. Experience with cloud Technologies, virtualization and observability are of high interest.

Our minimum requirements for this role include:

Self Starter + Team Spirit + Desire to Learn

Stamina to overcome challenges

The ability and comfort level to present easily to customer architects, engineers, managers, and executives to effective position the value of the Cisco solutions and how it solves the customer problems or achieves their goals

Basic knowledge of Cisco Data Center product portfolio is a must

Hands-on experience with large-scale distributed systems, infrastructure (networks and servers) and software solutions are a must

Knowledge and understanding of cloud computing and cloud architectures - IaaS, SaaS, PaaS, Private and Public Clouds

Familiarity with the Cisco Full-Stack Observability tools (AppDynamics, ThousandEyes and Intersight) are a big plus

Network routing and switching with extensive knowledge of L2 and L3 protocols

Programming or scripting skills are seen as a plus

CCNA, CCNP, CCIE or Cloud Certifications are a plus

Fluency in German, French and English is a strong plus.

We Are Cisco

#WeAreCisco. Each person counts, we bring our talents to work and make a difference. We learn, we have fun and here is how we do it:

We live digital, and we help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we're 30 years "old" and only about hardware. But we're also a software company, and a security company, we implement and use Machine Learning. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do - you can't put us in a box!

We take difference to heart, because without diversity and a commitment to equality and free thoughts for all, there is no moving forward. So, you have colorful hair, tattoos? Don't care. Like polka dots? That's cool.

Cisco is an Equal Opportunity Employer and you will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, or any other legally protected basis.

#li-emeaam1#li-priority"}
