{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05879-1-000260799", "text": "Capital Markets Enterprise Architect - Sell-side

Capital Markets Enterprise Architect â€“ Sell-side

Location: Switzerland, Zurich preferred

Type: Permanent

Cognizant is enabling customerâ€™s Digital transformation journey using our proven â€œDigital at Scaleâ€ framework. Our â€œDigital at Scaleâ€ framework is based upon customer centric innovation and core modernization by using technology as transformation lever and being agile to bring time to market. Technology transformation involves moving from legacy landscape to new platform foundation and it helps deliver enhanced customer experience, scalability, maintainability, and security with reduced TCO (including CAPEX & OPEX).

BFS Transformation and Architecture Office (BFS TAO)

BFS TAO is the group responsible for driving emerging technologies across leading financial services clients of Cognizant, nurturing and delivering a holistic competency, focusing on technology and business transformation initiatives of our clients working with senior client stakeholders, Cognizant internal service lines and industry partners.  This is a niche group of Enterprise and Solution Architects across the globe actively providing solutions on Architecture, Design and Technology Road map for leading financial services providers.

Why is this a good opportunity?

As a Technology Leader, you will get a chance to drive technology thought leadership, architecture, and solution engineering capabilities in the Capital Markets, specifically focusing on the Broker /Dealers, Execution venues, settlement and clearing domain areas.

The Role

This job opportunity will fulfil the role of Capital Markets Enterprise Architect â€“ Sell-side. This is an anchor role to drive business growth â€“ working closely with commercial and delivery leadership in the region, bringing domain aligned technology thought leadership in creating the mindshare, identifying, and qualifying opportunities and positioning with clients and prospects.

You are also expected to build the team of capital markets domain aligned solution architects to fulfil demand and deepen client engagements.

Key Responsibilities

Domain aligned technology thought leadership â€“ emerging technology trends and adoption, impact on the business and future directions, approaches for addressing key industry pain points such as technology modernization, engineering, and automation focus

Engagement in key client / prospect conversions bringing Cognizant point of view, understanding, and translating client business and technology context to solution ideas and value propositions

Drive innovation in ideating, qualifying, and elaborating industry aligned repeatable solutions ideas, value proposition, and frameworks / reference models

Support commercial teams in RFX, proactive proposals and business development activities in this domain

Anchor end to end solution for large complex pursuits, involving customer, internal and partner stakeholders. Steer win themes, solution considerations and supporting financial construct for complex deals through effective solution design and clearly articulated architecture guiding principles

Build a reputation as a trusted partner who understands the business and collaborates to deliver on commitments and drive business result, supporting customers in their technology roadmap, Digital Journey and share industry views

Build a team of domain aligned solution architects

Qualifications & Experience

15+ years of experience in capital markets sell-side industry across broker-dealer / execution venues / clearing and settlement firms as domain enterprise architect, technology leader, consultant, or equivalent role focusing on architecting solutions of strategic importance to respective organizations

Track record as technology consultant, enterprise architect aligned to broker-dealer / clearing / execution venues / market infrastructure functions in reputed financial services firms, technology consulting firms

Established credential as thought leader in the investment banking space â€“ broker-dealers /market infrastructure / custodial firms; having architected, designed, and led transformation for leading market players

Domain aligned technology leadership in driving business outcomes with technology leverage â€“ across modernization, new business, operations, and technology operating models

Established credentials in providing thought leadership such as thought leadership papers, developed solution ideas, addressing industry pain points, participation in industry forums, etc.

Understanding of data architecture and analytics, data democratization, leveraging the power of data in context of sell side, securities services, and market infrastructure â€“ thinking in terms of data products, opportunities to monetize data, as well integrate third-party data products

Knowledge, understanding of business and technology trends across AI / ML, Cloud, Intelligent Process Automation, Engineering practice in the Capital Markets, with specific focus on the broker / dealers, execution venues, clearing and settlement area, and articulation of business impacts â€“ threats, opportunities and emerging technology enabled business models

Ability to communicate at all levels of the organization, with public speaking expertise presenting at meetups and conference

Solid understanding of different software development lifecycle models and expert knowledge in agile and traditional principles, with the ability to blend processes to find the right fit for technology and business.

Understanding of the breadth of end-to-end technology stack and depth with at least one platform, especially contemporary cloud-oriented platforms being used in enterprise business software space (GCP, Azure or AWS).

A strong foundation in systems thinking, design thinking, complexity management and domain driven design paradigms

Ability to get the hands-dirty/roll-up the sleeves to â€œlead by exampleâ€ on the ground.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05882-1-000268483", "text": "PAS Senior Consultant / Manager- Learning Transformation (in Geneva, Basel or Zurich)

PAS Senior Consultant / Manager- Learning Transformation (in Geneva, Basel or Zurich)
Location:	Grand-Lancy / Geneva Other locations:  Anywhere in Country Salary:CompetitiveDate:  06-Feb-2023
Job description
Requisition ID:  1404589
At EY, youâ€™ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And weâ€™re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

Our People Advisory Services business (PAS) is focused on people management and our vision is to help our clients get it right in all its facets. PAS has three key pillars: Transformation (Workforce Advisory), mobile talent and workforce enablement (Integrated Mobility) and transactions (Reward). In Workforce Advisory, where this position is located in, we help organizations put talent and purpose at the heart of their transformation agenda.

To further strengthen our People Advisory Services â€“ Performance team we are looking for a Senior Consultant / Manager  to join either our Geneva, Basel or Zurich offices.

The opportunity

As a member of our Learning & Change Team, you will be working with high profile clients and leaders to identify additional solutions to increase transformation projects and strategically partner with various customers to identify learning needs and possible solutions for organization, departments and individuals.

Your key responsibilities

Act in a high-profile client facing capacity, working with clients to deliver and shape the implementation of their learning strategy and transformation projects (this role does not cover any internal learning projects within EY).

Assist with go to market activities and the development of our propositions with clients to achieve personal and team new business targets.

Analyze, design and deliver creative and innovative learning & change solutions tailored to client needs to help with their strategy or transformation projects.

Influence clients as a result of your deep learning & change knowledge regarding latest market trends whilst taking into account the complexities of Learning within large organizations.

Lead multi-disciplinary teams to deliver high quality services in line with our proven global methodologies and tools

Conduct and manage teams responsible for learning or change needs analysis initiatives and present recommendations when required.

Provide strategic recommendations on the use of learning technologies / digital tools to enhance innovative, effective learning experiences to our customers.

Promote the professional and personal development of your team members and take the lead in knowledge sharing and training delivery activities.

Develop long-term client relationships by introducing and presenting PAS offerings as well as by keeping up to date with current developments and trends in learning and industry knowledge

Skills and attributes for success

To qualify for this role, you must have

Bachelor or Master degree in relevant topic areas

8+ years of relevant Consulting (or Sales experience) in our focus areas of Learning and Development, Leadership and Organizational Design.  Industry experience will be considered as beneficial.

Experience of managing a sales pipeline, budgets and understanding of engagement economics

You demonstrate experience in supporting Learning projects (project management & facilitation skills)

Proven ability to conduct and/or analyze research related to consumers, teams and individual performer

Excellent command of English â€“ French and / or German seen as a benefit

Ideally, youâ€™ll also have

Strong and effective strategic thinking and problem-solving skills with high degree of emotional intelligence and the ability to identify and solve tactical issues involving training across varied regions/divisions

The ability to excel in dynamic and unconstrained environments framing complex and ambiguous issues

What we look for

People with energy, passion, a strategic mind, a will-do attitude, an eye for detail and a motivation for delivering the best

People with intellectual curiosity, adaptability, and a desire to be of service to the team and the broader community

People who build long-term relationships and overseeing the continued development, performance and profitability of key accounts

This role will help develop and execute on the future of human performance.  We highly encourage candidates from diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.

What we offer

International multi-cultural team of highly motivated professionals

Continuous personal development with a steep learning curve â€“ a system of trainings, mentoring, counselling and on-the-job learning

Modern working environment and equipment, fostering mobile working flexibility

Transparent performance-based recognition and progression system

Acquire a fully accredited corporate MBA (EY Tech MBA) from Hult International Business School, whilst working with EY, completely free*

If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

For further information please contact our recruitment team ([email] / +41 58 286 33 66).

* exception of EY contractors, interns and alumni.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05888-1-000261994", "text": "Head of Data Excellence

Syngenta is a leading AgTech company, dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 30,000 employees in more than 100 countries work together to solve one of humanityâ€™s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture.

Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us now and help shape the future of agriculture.

Syngenta Crop Protection is headquartered in Switzerland.

This role can be based either in Basel, Switzerland or Jealott's Hill, UK.

In Crop Protection R&D, we design and evolve cutting-edge data capabilities to allow us to access, connect, share and harness our R&D data at an unprecedented scale and pace. We cover a wide spectrum of data from Research (chemistry and biology research data) to open field IoT (environmental sensors, drones), NLP and image analysis. We firmly believe in FAIR, shared and connected data products, empowered and data-savvy people, agile delivery and open source.

We are looking for a progressive leader with deep expertise in R&D data management processes, coupled with outstanding interpersonal and business skills to play a key role in CP R&D-wide foundational capabilities and transformation efforts, such as data quality, master and reference data management, ontologies, data catalogues and data platforms for analytics and innovation.

Key accountabilities and expectations

Drive the effective creation, management and exploitation of trusted and reliable FAIR data assets within and across R&D functions to drive project and business decisions and enable more effective analytics and data science

Set the CP R&D strategy on the priority, application and platforms for proactive and impactful data management, including data quality

Define and govern a set of CP R&D-wide standards on data, metadata and access/security within Syngenta R&D and CROs

Establish and chair data excellence activities to ensure business data ownership, stewardship and sponsorship, prioritize work and resolve data issues

Lead CR R&D-wide data transformation initiatives, such as the creation and management of data access, data glossary, data catalogue, and data harmonisation/interoperability in our R&D data platform

Lead change management campaigns on FAIR, data culture and data literacy

Act as the business product owner for cross-functional data capabilities such as the management of master data, data quality, ontologies and data access platforms.

MSc/PhD in STEM or data-related sciences and engineering

More than 10 years of experience leading data management initiatives in complex organizations and related industries (chemical, pharma, science-driven R&D) with deep technical understanding of R&D concepts and how scientific data is produced, managed and used

Advanced knowledge of data governance practices, business and technology issues related to management of enterprise information assets and approaches related to data quality, privacy and architecture

Superb consulting skills, coupled with change management concepts and strategies, including communication, culture change and performance measurement design

Proven knowledge and experience of data management tools and technology solutions, such as data catalogues, data modelling and ontology management platforms

Knowledge of agile and product management principles and methodologies is desired

Essential personal capabilities

Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills and proven ability to explain complex data management concepts as simple comprehensible messages for senior leaders

Ability to challenge, shape and influence the way things are done

Ability to self-direct and take on broad, R&D-wide projects from beginning to end

Ability to build networks across regions, cultures, and countries

Highly organized and structured in planning and execution of responsibilities

Proven people management skills, mentoring and coaching.

Please send your complete application with CV and motivation letter.

We offer a variety of financial and non-financial benefits including:

A position which contributes to valuable and impactful work in a stimulating and international environment

	A superb working environment with an open culture and diverse workforce where new ideas are always welcome

The opportunity to work with and learn from highly qualified and experienced employees and gain scientific and technical excellence

Learning culture (Together we Grow) and wide range of training options

Competitive pension fund plan, attractive bonus system, onsite doctor, fitness room, canteen, and other benefits (Family friendly initiatives, Child and Family allowance...)

	World-class headquarters in Basel, R&D Science Campus in Jealottâ€™s Hill and the Global Research Center in Stein

Did you know? Syngenta has been ranked as a top employer by Science Journal.

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05895-1-000266421", "text": "Postdoc position in the field of medical data/neurorehabilitation 100%, Zurich, fixed-term

Postdoc position in the field of medical data/neurorehabilitation

100%, Zurich, fixed-term
print Drucken
The shared position is associated with the ETH Zurich's Rehab Initiative and its coordinating competence center for Rehabilitation Engineering and Science (RESC) with the aim of strengthening and expanding Switzerland's excellent position as a leading international hub for rehabilitation research (resc.ethz.ch). You will join and profit from a large interdisciplinary network and will be involved in core activities in the field hosted by RESC. At ETH Zurich, you will be directly affiliated with Prof. Robert Rienerâ€™s research group, the leading chair of RESC. At the University of ZÃ¼rich, you will be associated with Prof. Andreas Luftâ€™s research group which has a long history of large-scale clinical trials in the area of stroke rehabilitation and home rehabilitation. Within this group, you will work closely with the cereneo Foundation, a non-profit research foundation that specializes in developing and deploying digital data collection tools and health interventions into clinical practice ([wwwadr]).

Project background

â€œSwissNeuroRehabâ€, an Innosuisse flagship project, aims to develop a new model of neurorehabilitation which address the whole continuum of care - from in-patient rehabilitation to decentralized home therapy. The blend of conventional therapy approaches augmented with digital tools and completely novel technologies for home rehabilitation affords an opportunity to provide truly personalized care to patients and people living with disabilities. The flagship project unites the major academic, clinical, and industrial players in Switzerland towards this common goal. ETH Zurich and the University of Zurich are part of this team and are offering in this context a shared position for a postdoctoral researcher.

Job description

Your responsibility will be to carry out research and development in medical data acquisition and medical standards in collaboration with other research and development teams within the Innosuisse flagship project. You will act within a joint function between ETH Zurich and the University of Zurich and will be required to travel between the various collaborators. Within the role, you are expected to develop digital pathways and warehousing solutions for clinical data that are interoperable, user-friendly, secure, and compliant with ethical and regulatory requirements. User-facing digital data acquisition tools and rehabilitation technology will be able to interact with your centralized warehousing solution, and your solution will provide the flexibility and performance to run large-scale analyses. In the completed state, the solution will be extended to remote rehabilitation settings and enable data analysis over the entire continuum of care.

Your profile

Doctorate in computer science, data engineering, or a related subject

Proven record of leading interdisciplinary projects

Proven track record in big data processing and deploying machine learning models into production

Preferred with experience in digital health, mobile health, and biomedical sensor data acquisition

Strong analytical, mathematical, and algorithmic capabilities

Experience in databases and recent data interoperability frameworks (e.g. FHIR, OMOP)

Proficiency in programming, preferably in Python and Java, SQL is a must

Experience with clinical/human trials will be considered an asset

Very good knowledge of English, German/French/Italian is a plus

Project management skills and the ability to supervise master theses and internship students

Your workplace

Your workplace

We offer

You will join a team of clinical and research scientists in the task of improving rehabilitation systems through physiological and clinical data systems design and analysis. The focus of this work will bring you close to intelligent health management while exploring various health data frameworks. You will experience multimodal data from robotic rehabilitation, digital data collection, general clinical practice, and detailed clinical studies focusing on interoperability, data transfer, and standardization among multiple clinical systems and devices. As part of the position, we will enable you to interact and gather deep experience working closely with our wide range of collaborators, including the clinical data warehouse (CTC, USZ), digital trial intervention center (dTIP, ETH), SCAI Lab (SPZ Nottwil), Sense Innovation Research Center (HES-SO Valais), cereneo Foundation. A versatile and challenging task at the interface of clinic and academia awaits you.
chevron_right Working, teaching and research at ETH Zurich
We value diversity
In line with our values, ETH Zurich encourages an inclusive culture. We promote equality of opportunity, value diversity and nurture a working and learning environment in which the rights and dignity of all our staff and students are respected. Visit our Equal Opportunities and Diversity website to find out how we ensure a fair and open environment that allows everyone to grow and flourish.
Curious? So are we.

We look forward to receiving your online application with the following documents:

Curriculum vitae

Cover letter describing your motivation and research experience (max 1 page)

Copy of one relevant journal publication

Name and contact details of two referees

Please note that we exclusively accept applications submitted through our online application portal. Applications via email or postal services will not be considered.

Questions regarding the position should be directed to Chris Awai [email] (no applications).

Located in the heart of Europe, yet forging connections all over the world, we work together to develop solutions for the global challenges of today and tomorrow.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05898-1-000261966", "text": "Data Integration Specialist (W/M)

EPFL, the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne, is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs more than 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of more than 16,000 people, including over 12,000 students and 4,000 researchers from more than 120 different countries.

Data Integration Specialist (W/M)
Your mission :
The aim of the EPFL Blue Brain Project (BBP), a Swiss brain research initiative founded and directed by Professor Henry Markram, is to establish simulation neuroscience as a complementary approach alongside experimental, theoretical and clinical neuroscience to understanding the brain, by building the worldâ€™s first biologically detailed digital reconstructions and simulations of the mouse brain.
Blue Brainâ€™s Data and Knowledge Engineering team is building a Knowledge Graph used to perform large-scale semantic and spatial data integration, exploration, inference and access within 3D Brain Atlases to support biologically detailed digital reconstructions and simulations of the mouse brain. Graph analytics as well as state of the art methods for machine learning on graphs (e.g. Graph Embeddings, Graph Neural Networks, Graph-to-Text generation) are applied on top of the knowledge graph to support scientific downstream tasks through for example recommender and inference systems, link prediction, NLP language model augmentation with knowledge background.
To strengthen its Data and Knowledge Engineering team, BBP is looking for a:
Data Integration Specialist W/M
Main duties and responsibilities include :

Work closely with BBP scientists and data providers to acquire, curate and integrate data in a knowledge graph with high quality metadata.

Develop and maintain pipelines to semantically represent, in the BBP knowledge graph and 3D brain atlases, data with relevant scientific context, from different sources and of various formats and modalities.

Contribute to the development of data and knowledge structures for improving data integration and accessibility from a knowledge graph to support reasoning with knowledge graphs

Implement best-practices for maintainable data products and deliver production quality code following best-practices for maintainable software development

Experience and preferred skills:

Expertise in Python and its ecosystem

Experience in curating, wrangling and annotating (metadata)data in life science,

Great communication skills,

Experience with large scale (meta)data integration in the life sciences,

Experience in any of the following areas would be a plus:

Neuroscience or Biology,

Semantic web technologies (RDF, SPARQL, SHACL),

Profile:

Master degree or PHD in Neuroscience, Biology or Computer Science with a strong application in life sciences

At least 2 years of relevant professional experience,

English written and spoken. French would be a plus.

We offer :

A world-recognized leader in simulation-based research in neuroscience

A dynamic, multidisciplinary, international and collaborative working environment committed to benefitting the global community

A modern working environment, based at the Biotech Campus in Geneva SÃ©cheron

Start date :
as soon as possible Term of employment :
Fixed-term (CDD)Work rate :
100%Duration :
1 year, renewable Remark :
Only candidates who applied through EPFL website or our partner Jobupâ€™s website will be considered. Files sent by agencies without a mandate will not be taken into account.Reference :
Job Nb 2728apply online"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-06169-1-000269947", "text": "Senior Manager, Patient Recruitment (Remote)

JOB DESCRIPTION Your new employer is Labcorp Drug Development, the worldâ€™s most comprehensive drug development company, dedicated to improving health and improving lives. Our unique perspectives, built from decades of scientific expertise and precision delivery of the largest volume of drug development data in the world, along with our innovative technology solutions, help our clients identify new approaches and anticipate tomorrowâ€™s challenges as they evolve.
In this role, you will lead the delivery across patient recruitment projects and retention strategies for assigned trials.

This is a full-time, permanent and home-based position.

Study Delivery

Lead project recruitment and retention initiatives

Support and coach Project Managers in implementing aspects of their Patient Recruitment and Retention plan

Provide additional support to Project Leaders by collecting data and re-working aspects of the Strategic Patient Recruitment and Retention Plan at times when project intervention is deemed necessary

Provide Project team support to ensure the implementation of Patient recruitment and retention principles and tools

Ensure Patient Recruitment and retention strategies and plans are focused upon patients, parent, caregivers and/or family members

Input into the Balanced Score Card for vendors used to evaluate the success of patient recruitment strategies and retention campaigns

Work with the feasibility team on early planning

Lead the recruitment and retention strategy for a particular group of projects

Client

May serve as support for Patient recruitment and retention plans for Business Development and Project Leaders

Demonstrate ownership and accountability in support of clients through effective study program solving

Support client facing meetings regarding patient recruitment and retention which may include, but are not limited to capabilities, strategies and site performance and relevant budgetary elements

Relationships

Work with Vendors to understand the costings, provision of services and the ongoing study progress

Proactively manage the multiple relationships as well as accelerated patient recruitment and retention throughout the trial duration

Support collaboration across Investigator, Patient and Operational Quality Management group functions to provide predictive modelling of patients and site opportunities to accelerate deliverables and consistency meet client expectations

Perform other duties as assigned by management

Minimum Required:

Clinical research experience to include a minimum of 2 years project management background

Minimum of 3 years of relevant clinical research experience at investigational site or relevant research institution, pharmaceutical, biotech or contract research organization

Thorough understanding of global drug development and the clinical trial project management process, with a special emphasis on patient recruitment, engagement and retention

Strong abilities to negotiate and liaise with customers (internal & external) in a professional manner

University/college degree (preferably post graduate and life sciences) or certification in a related allied health profession (i.e. nursing, medical or laboratory technology) from an appropriately accredited institution or equivalent education and experience

Thorough and practical working knowledge of ICH-GCP Guidelines, including relevant international requirements/guidelines for the conduct of global clinical development programs

An understanding of aspects surrounding business development (time and cost estimates, bid defense, contracts)

Fluency in English

Labcorp is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer:

As an EOE/AA employer, Labcorp strives for diversity and inclusion in the workforce and does not tolerate harassment or discrimination of any kind. We make employment decisions based on the needs of our business and the qualifications of the individual and do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy or other medical conditions/needs), family or parental status, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, personal appearance, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic. We encourage all to apply.

For more information about how we collect and store your personal data, please see our Privacy Statement.

Postdoc position in physics-informed deep learning

'The work environment here is very dynamic and demanding. I work closely with different departments at BFH and beyond. That broadens my horizons and brings me joy.' Priscilla Caliandro

Postdoc position in physics-informed deep learning
90 % / Limited for 2 years / Biel / Start according to agreement
To start with, here are some of our strong points

An almost unbelievably large variety of themes and topics and a great mix of research and teaching.
,
Plenty of contact with eager young people from all over the world who are set on achieving things.
,

,

,
Working with smart people of different professional backgrounds who want, like you, to do things and make a difference.

And here are even more good reasons to opt for BFH
What you'll be doing here

You will develop physics-informed machine learning algorithms for condition monitoring and asset health prediction

Our group offers a stimulating interdisciplinary research environment and a strong network with industry partners

The position is part of the Swiss National Science Foundation project "Artificial intelligence for improving the reliability and resilience of industrial fleets"

The project aims at developing deep learning algorithms to enhance the reliability of industrial fleets

What you'll bring with you

PhD in computer science, engineering, applied mathematics, physics, or a related field

Strong experience in deep learning, physics-informed machine learning, signal processing

Ideally, you are also proficient in physical modelling of power system infrastructure such as battery modelling

You are self-driven and you have a strong publication record

Apart from being incredibly interesting, this is also a lot of fun, and we get to learn a lot as well. This cutting-edge knowledge benefits all who are studying here or doing part-time continuing education courses. We have great plans for the future: We join forces to make an effective contribution to a sustainable, digitally literate and health-conscious society. {"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-06438-1-000246246", "text": "Senior Python Engineer

We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet

Who we are

Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.

We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.

Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.

About the opportunity:

To empower scientists and radically improve how science is published, evaluated and disseminated to researchers, innovators, and the public, we have built our own state-of-the-art Artificial Intelligence Review Assistant (AIRA). At the heart of AIRA, resides a process that evaluates the quality of a submitted article. This process is vital to ensure high quality articles are published in our platform.

We are now looking for a passionate Senior Software Engineer, skilled in
Python
, to join our growing team and help us evolve AIRA and the article evaluation process.

Key Responsibilities:

As a Senior Python Engineer, you will be responsible for optimizing or re-designing AIRA's quality process to support our next generation of product features and data initiatives. You will be expanding and optimizing our quality pipeline architecture as well as the service layer that supports it. You will be defining the architecture and implementing the solution in Python following the best practices.

The ideal candidate is an experienced Python developer that enjoys defining an architecture and building solutions from the ground up, with strong background in API development, relational databases, algorithms and data strictures. You will work together with other software engineers, data engineers, machine learning engineers and data scientists.

Requirements:

Strong experience in API development and experience with at least one Python framework to create APIs (e.g. Django, Flask, FastAPI)

Strong experience with relational databases

Experience with background tasks

Experience with Docker (build custom Docker images for deployment)

Deep understanding of system design, data structures and algorithms

Up to date with the latest trends in Python

Fluent English

Benefits

With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.

Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.
This includes:

100% remote working

Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Workplace/IT jobs due to nature of role requiring presence onsite, in the office).

Learning and development

All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.

Wellbeing

We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.

Volunteering opportunities

Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.

Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination â€“ including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives."}

Cloud and Foundry specialist (all genders) - Risk Technology

Step into the World of Consulting between Technology and Risk

In our Risk Advisory business, we support our clients in identifying and anticipating potential risks in all areas of their business. We consider financial, technological and business-relevant risks to ensure the long-term success of the company.

While working in the Strategic & Operational Risk area, you will support our clients in the strategic development, optimization and implementation of IT security and security technologies. In addition, you will advise organizations on how to effectively mitigate financial and non-financial risks and make informed and intelligent risk decisions based on data and analytics to maximize opportunities

How you can make an impact:

You are actively driving digitalization forward by introducing new technologies, you will support the top management of international and national companies across all industries in digitizing their business processes

You create the connection between business and technology by understanding the technical requirements of the customers and linking them with technological solutions

You take responsibility for cloud and bid data solutions (e.g. Palantir Foundry, AWS, Azure) from requirements analysis to implementation in various business areas and countries

You analyse processes and help to improve them by accompanying our customers in the strategic conception and technical implementation of compliance, risk and governance processes and help to mitigate external and internal risks

You are part of a strong team within a dynamic environment where you will continuously develop our topics in close cooperation with experienced experts

Who we are looking for:

Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.

Experience and knowledge in cloud solutions and hyperscalers such as Azure, AWS or Palantir Foundry as well as fundamentals of software and cloud architecture.

Experience with at least one of the main programming languages for the implementation of Machine Learning solutions (e.g. Python, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras, R, Java or Scala)

You are fluent in English, fluency in German would be advantageous and French fluency is required for applications to the Geneva office

Be willing to take ownership and drive topics to help the team grow further and farther.

Your team

Become part of an entrepreneurial, innovative and international team of 100 risk professionals across Switzerland. We are passionate about bringing best in class risk solutions to our clients and helping our people grow both personally and professionally through trainings, mentoring programmes and on-the-job learning.

Careers at Deloitte. Choose your impact.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. With more than 2,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, a place where you can be you and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible working conditions as well as wellbeing and parental programmes.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by

	addressing climate change

	or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit

	[wwwadr]

	.

How to apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on "apply now" to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.

If you have any questions, please contact Rebecca at

	Write an email

*We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for
roles unless they match all the criteria; don't hold yourself back - apply today.

We do not accept applications from recruitment agencies for this position.

Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom.

Requisition code: 11827

Swiss Federal Institute for Forest, Snow and Landscape Research WSL

The Swiss Federal Institute for Forest, Snow and Landscape Research WSL is part of the ETH Domain. Approximately 600 people work on the sustainable use and protection of the environment and on the handling of natural hazards.

The Research Unit Forest Dynamics assesses the effects of changing environmental conditions on forest ecosystem functioning. In the Research Group Ecosystem Ecology we offer a

	2-year

	position as

Postdoc in Ã¢??Nowcasting drought stress indices in European forestsÃ¢?  80-100% (f/m/d)

Climate change and other environmental stressors such as air pollution create increasing pressure on forest ecosystems. Pan-European monitoring and evaluation of the impacts of climate change on forests are crucial and the ambition of the EU H2020 project FORWARDS. Within this EU project the target of your post-doc position will be to nowcast drought stress at several sites in Europe. Based on high resolution dendrometer data and a soil-vegetation-atmosphere transport model, you will establish a daily operational data processing pipeline to run simulations and merge it with other data sources. Further, you will develop statistical and machine learning models to derive drought stress proxies for display at a webpage and as an input to the ForestWard Observatory. Finally, you will publish the results in international journals and present them at conferences.

You hold a PhD degree in hydrology, plant physiology, environmental sciences or a related field. You have a strong background in hydrological and statistical modelling with excellent programming skills in R. Additionally, you are experienced in handling and managing large data sets. Good skills in scientific writing are essential. You are ambitious, used to a high standard of independent, structured, and careful work, and have a high level of self-motivation and good team spirit.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05112-1-000363773", "text": "Software Engineer C++ - Real-time Vision - High-performance computing (W/M)

The Bobst Group R&D division carries out innovative technology and product developments to shape digital transformation in the packaging industry. Within this group, the Quality Control Product team which develop the next generation of machine vision products is looking for a talented Software Engineer to participate in the design, implementation, and testing of our products that increase the competitiveness of our machines.

Main Responsibilities

Design, Implement and Improve functionality for our Machine Vision products

Perform code reviews and ensure that its own development passes CI on a daily basis

Maintain software of existing product portfolio

Improve teamâ€™s knowledge about adequate technology evolutions (performance, robustness, security...)

Ensure the required Software Quality standard with adequate automated tests

Participate in agile activities (standups, sprint planning, sprint reviews...)

Collaborate with stakeholders (Software and Vision engineers, Product owner, field technicians, customers, ...)

Your Profile

Strong knowledge in Computer Science (Concurrency and Distributed Computing, Relational Databases, TCP/IP, Computer Architecture)

Demonstrated experience in industrial development in modern C/C++ (11, 17, 20)

Excellent knowledge of C++ STL especially containers and algorithm

Strong debugging and profiling skills

Basic knowledge of SDLC, development models and principle design patterns

Team spirit oriented, able to work with multiple actors

Accomplishing tasks with autonomy and result oriented

Open-minded and proactive

Demonstrated experience with Git, ideally using GitFlow Workflow

Would be a significant asset:

Experience in CUDA

Designing advanced database schemes / requests

Experience with ML framework (Pytorch, Tensorflow, Keras...) and particularly with Convolutional Neural Network (CNN)

Would be a plus:

Skills in image processing

Experience with Azure DevOps, or as a Scrum Master

Experience with VMWare ESXi, Cloud and networking infrastructures

Our Software Stack

Languages : C/C++20, C#, Batch scripting

Frameworks : Boost, Matrox Imaging Library, OpenCV, CUDA, ZeroMQ

Database : PostgreSQL

Agile Portal, CI/CD : Azure DevOps

IDE : Visual Studio

Your education and languages skills

M.Sc. degree or equivalent in Computer Science

Business fluent in English

French is an asset

For more than 130 years, and over 50 countries, BOBST has always been at the forefront of innovation and we want to accelerate connectivity, digitalization, automation and sustainability to make packaging better than ever.
BOBST is one of the worldâ€™s leading suppliers of equipment and services to packaging and label manufacturers in the folding carton, corrugated board and flexible materials industries. Join our highly qualified staff and together, letâ€™s shape the future of the packaging world.
The production site of Mex, near Lausanne in Switzerland, is also the headquarters of the Bobst Group. It is the most important site, employing approx. 1500 passionate people.
It also trains each year roughly 200 apprentices. The site offers an idyllic work environment. In the countryside and close to major highways, it is also well served by public transport. It offers many amenities, such as a corporate restaurant, sports fields, a fitness and a nursery. The facilities have been recently renovated and represent a model for sustainable development."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05710-1-000349856", "text": "Revolutionize enterprise search with Generative AI - Internship 6 months COO_IT

Karriere und Ausbildung Vacancies

Revolutionize enterprise search with Generative AI - Internship 6 months

Description

The Bankâ€™s entire operations are managed by COO Division and are headed up by the Chief Operating Officer. It strives to provide both in-house and external clients with a first-rate service to ensure our business operates efficiently and at the best possible cost. The COO division comprises Operations, Finance, Information Management, Human Resources and Logistics. COO employees are committed to providing, with professionalism and enthusiasm, an efficient, proactive, high-quality service that meets the needs of clients within the context of the Bankâ€™s overall strategy.

Mission

The goal of this internship is to investigate how we can build and interrogate a knowledge base in natural language like you would do it with Chat-GPT but without exposing client identifying data outside the bank.

Challenges

Finding the right information at the right time is a challenge that can elevate the enterprise's capabilities, making it more efficient and setting it apart from competitors.

Main responsibilities

Research within the enterprise plays a fundamental role in improving the work of employees. However, in the age of numerous information sources, this task has become complex. A recent study revealed that 44% of users made wrong decisions because they were unaware of information that could have helped, and 43% of users reported failing to notice important information.

Deploy a search engine, as a Proof of concept, based on one of the solutions studied.

Demonstrate how generative artificial intelligence, based on LLMs, can revolutionize the way we design search engines.

Demonstrate how Intelligent enterprise search prevents information islands and enables organizations to easily find, surface, and share information and their corporate knowledge of their best employees

Measure the improvements brought about by our new research approach and propose an architecture and solution for implementation.

Estimate the implementation budget and total cost of ownership (TCO) of the recommended solution.

Education

Education: Master Degree

Technical skills: Specialization in AI, or at least demonstrates a strong interest in AI

IT Tools: Development (Nodejs, Python, java, .NET/C#, ...). Knowledge of modern development environment (DevOps)

Experience

Years of experience: N/A

Experience in private banking: N/A

Language

English: Fluent

Personal skills

Swiss resident: Optional

Excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a team, collaborating with developers, and stakeholders. Creativity and passion for exploring new ideas, pushing the boundaries of generative AI technology.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05721-1-000366992", "text": "(Senior) GenAI Platform Engineer (all genders) 70 -100 %

Come to AXA, Switzerland's leading insurance company, as

(Senior) GenAI Platform Engineer (all genders)

70-100% , Winterthur / Smart Working

You want to be part of something big? We can offer you a great team in a dynamic environment in one of the hottest topics around!
The Competence Center Data & Analytics focusses on solving complex business problems using Generative AI and Machine Learning. Your ambition is to use Generative AI to optimize our business across the insurance value chain. Current projects are Call Center Automation, Underwriting Knowledge Assistants, Complex Claims Handling and many more.
You will actively develop our GenAI â€“ Core Platform that provides the technical foundation for the GenAI-Applications in AXA Switzerland The platform is going to provide capabilities in the handling of unstructured content (documents, voice), GenAI-capabilities (e.g. RAG) and AI-safety and guardrail features.
At AXA you get the space you need to implement your ideas. We support you in training and offer you a culture where you can thrive. And of course, you are going to work with state of the art technologies.
Your contribution

Developing the GenAI Core Platform using state of the art software engineering methods

Provide stable operations incl. security and regulatory compliance

Setting developer standards and provide education to your colleagues in the product teams

Analyze technical trends in the field and drive innovation

Participate or lead knowledge exchanges within the local and global AXA GenAI Community and work with technology companies (e.g. Langchain)

Effective communication with different stakeholders to drive user adoption

Setup and live a new way of working with the product teams (inner source)

Your capabilities and talents

A solid understanding of Software Engineering

Experience in the principles of GenAI (e.g. RAG, CoT, Agents) and GenAI Frameworks (e.g. Langchain/Langsmith, Vector Stores)

2-3 years of experience in DevOps (Git Flow)

Proficiency in Python

Proficiency in working with cloud technologies, preferably Google Cloud Platform

Collaborative, creative, product and user focused

Passionate about generating business value and drive the user adoption

Master or Ph.D. degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Math, Physics

Around 600 software and system developers work for AXA in Switzerland and are developing tomorrow's technology inhouse. To do this, we are also working in global teams and networks. Our agile product teams organize themselves and work independently where they are responsible for everything from A to Z. Our tasks include programming, integrating the latest tools and arranging hackathons.
Your future workplace Pionierstrasse 3, Winterthur, Switzerland Contact us Apply online now Questions?
Please contact for any questions you may have regarding this open position Angela Capaul via E-Mail [email]

We are unable to accept applications through staff referral agencies for this position.

Advantages
Health

Own AXA health management

Massage offers

Various sport and relaxation courses

Health management seminars

Relaxation rooms

Mobility

Refund of half-fare subscription (GA) (pro rata)

private insurance for occupational and non-occupational accidents

About AXA

Every success story starts with self-belief.
At AXA, we see ourselves as a partner that supports and believes in you. This is why we challenge and encourage you and proactively show you opportunities for your future. We motivate you and offer you freedom so that you can bring together things that are important to you. Together with your commitment and individual contribution, this creates a forward-looking partnership. For you, for us and for our customers. And not just for now. But also for the long term.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05735-1-000358431", "text": "Master Thesis - Analyst AI roadmap

Your team

The Pictet Group is one of the worldâ€™s leading independent wealth and asset managers. Founded in 1805 and headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland, the Group is represented in 27 offices in financial centres worldwide and currently employs over 5300 people. Pictet Wealth Management combines more than 200 years of Swiss banking heritage with global investment expertise. The partner-owned financial services group offers a comprehensive service for wealthy individuals and families, including discretionary and advisory investment solutions and family office services.

We are seeking to recruit a Trainee who is keen to become immersed in the world of finance and banking. You will work alongside a diverse group of professionals and be part of one of the internal project management teams. Your mission will be to consolidate internal requirements related to the potential use of AI within the Wealth Management division of our bank, conduct in-depth research to identify AI technology directions and priorities in the banking sector, and suggest a strategy on how to implement such technologies to enhance internal investment expertise and improve internal efficiency, productivity and customer experience.

Your role

You will be responsible for :

Consolidating internal requirements related to AI applications across units within the Wealth Management division (Investment Platform, Risk & Compliance, Communications, Operations & Middle Office, etc.).

Conducting in-depth research to identify AI technology trends and priorities in the banking sector considering input from peers, top consulting firms and technology leaders (fintech, software solution providers, etc.).

Identifying viable project options and conceptualising ideas for AI integration aimed at enhancing efficiency, productivity and customer experience in banking

Developing a concise short-to-medium-term AI strategy and roadmap, focusing on quick wins and alignment with internal needs

Suggesting priorities for AI projects, providing well-structured business cases for shortlisted topics

Delivering a comprehensive written report and presentation to senior management outlining findings, strategies and recommendations

Your profile

Masterâ€™s student in Management or Finance.

A strong interest in the finance and banking sector, encompassing all aspects of operations (investment products, client interactions, transactions execution & processing, compliance, etc.).

A solid interest and understanding of technology, specially AI and its potential future uses.

Proficient in the use of standard office tools (MS Office, etc.).

Demonstrable ability in written and verbal communication for presenting research findings.

Strong organisational skills, attention to detail, proactive and solution-oriented mindset.

Ability to analyse, evaluate and come up with conclusions/recommendations.

Capacity to work independently.

Proficient in both French and English.

Start date: 01.01.2024

Location: Geneva

Ref: MTAAIR/SN/CJ

Note
We will not accept any CVs via agencies
Diversity & Inclusion

Please note this posting is to advertise potential job opportunities. This exact role may not be open today, but could open in the near future. When you apply, a Cisco representative may contact you directly if a relevant position opens.

Who We Are
We are a part of Outshift by Cisco focused on identifying breakthrough emerging solutions that create new markets and businesses for Cisco. Own the creation of Minimal Viable Product (MVP) definition and then defining a product roadmap that elevates the competitive differentiators at every stage. Define customer value prop and return on investment at each stage

Work with marketing and business development teams in identifying and executing effective Go-To-Market (GTM) strategies for your product. Establish Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track progress

Key metrics & measures â€“ Establishing milestones & metrics to evaluate the success and failure of the project. Also, pay close attention to metrics and measures important to customer stakeholders and establish a compelling Return On Investment (ROI) for them

Collaborate with marketing team in identifying key collaterals â€“ product documents, data sheets, value props, sales decks, ROI calculators, demo videos (it is especially important for the product manager to own demo scripts and video during MVP and initial stages of the product life cycle).

What You'll Do
In this role, you will work in an innovative team, apply, and advance powerful AI technologies in products that make tangible business impacts, create the latest AI-powered user experiences on various platforms, work alongside committed generative AI product management, software engineering teams gain expertise in the most in-demand AI domains for the future, and contribute to shaping Ciscoâ€™s AI strategies for the next decade.

The Impact Youâ€™ll Make
If you want the challenge of fast-paced growth, the satisfaction of seeing your thoughtful ideas come to life, and the pride in helping grow a best-in-class AI team, this is the place for you.

Your Responsibilities Will Include

Lead a team of applied scientists and drive applied ML initiatives across products.

Drive the Generative AI strategy and lead pivotal initiatives to employ the most recent advances in ML/AI including Large Language models (LLMs) in a fast-paced, experimental environment and create differentiation.

Lead development, implementation, and optimization of LLMs and generative AI technologies, including training, fine-tuning and computation optimizations, and deliver novel and highly impactful features.

Work with peer leaders in Outshift and wider Cisco Senior AI practitioners (PE, DE, Fellows) from other business groups to align strategies and collaborate on AI initiatives.

Conduct research and develop innovative AI models using state-of-the-art techniques across various modalities including NLP, CV, time series, and multimodal.

Guide the team on State-of-the-Art techniques, and model architectures including LLMs and Gen AI.

Minimum Requirements

PhD in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related quantitative field.

12+ years of industry experience in Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing/understanding, Reinforcement learning.

10+ yrs exp in Java, C++, Python, or other related languages.

Practical experience in developing, training, deploying, and evaluating AI models in real-world applications and knowledge of deep learning frameworks.

Understanding and hands-on experience in Large Language Models, Natural Language Processing, Computer vision, Image Processing, and generative AI techniques.

Preferred Requirements

Depth and breadth in state-of-the-art machine learning technologies.

A highly driven leader who is known to deliver in high growth and highly dynamic environments.

Be an advocate for creative technical trends. Acknowledged for driving decisions collaboratively, resolving challenges, and ensuring follow-through.

Extraordinarily resourceful & rigorous, you can operate successfully among forward-thinking and charismatic people.

Equally comfortable and capable of interacting with technologists as with business executives.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Why Cisco?

#WeAreCisco. We are all unique, but collectively we bring our talents to work as a team, to develop innovative technology and power a more inclusive, digital future for everyone. How do we do it? Well, for starters â€“ with people like you!

Nearly every internet connection around the world touches Cisco. Weâ€™re the Internetâ€™s optimists. Weâ€™re helping businesses of all shapes and size to connect with their employees and customers in new ways, providing people with access to the digital skills they need and connecting the most remote parts of the world â€“ whether through 5G, or otherwise.

We tackle whatever challenges come our way. We have each otherâ€™s backs, we recognize our accomplishments, and we grow together. We celebrate and support one another â€“ from big and small things in life to big career moments. And giving back is in our DNA (we get 10 days off each year to do just that).

We know that powering an inclusive future starts with us. Because without diversity and a dedication to equality, there is no moving forward. Our 30 Inclusive Communities, that bring people together around commonalities or passions, are leading the way. Together weâ€™re committed to learning, listening, caring for our communities, whilst supporting the most vulnerable with a collective effort to make this world a better place either with technology, or through our actions.

So, you have colorful hair? Donâ€™t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? Thatâ€™s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05876-1-000367625", "text": "PostDoc in Spatial-Temporal Scaling of Thermal Landscapes 80-100% (f/m/d) 80% - 100%

Swiss Federal Institute for Forest, Snow and Landscape Research WSL  The Swiss Federal Institute for Forest, Snow and Landscape Research WSL is part of the ETH Domain. Approximately 600 people work on the sustainable use and protection of the environment and on the handling of natural hazards.
In a collaboration between Yale University and the WSL, we are working to understand how heat extremes, and refugia, change across spatial and temporal scales, in order to project thermal landscapes on an ever-changing plant. This project is part of a larger, multi-institutional initiative led by Yale University to understand how life adapts (or not) to hot climate states. In the framework of this program, the Spatial Evolutionary Ecology Group in the Research Unit Biodiversity and Conservation Biology, in collaboration with the Dynamic Macroecology group in the Land Change Science Research Unit of WSL, is searching for a one-year (with option for one year of extension) with a start between March 1 and May 1, 2024PostDoc in Spatial-Temporal Scaling of Thermal Landscapes 80-100% (f/m/d)Extreme heat affects life at the individual scale â€“in the location and time in which they exist. On a warm and warming planet, how thermal refugia scale in space and time is a key factor for survival. A goal of this research is to explore the relationship of (macro-)climate to microclimate as it varies in response to major determinants like topography, land cover, distance from water, etc. As part of this project, we aim to generate a number of bioclimatic variables related to heat stress in different major groups of organisms (ecotherms, endotherms, plants). This project will be carried out in close collaboration with the technical support scientist in the Dynamic Macroecology group downscaling the climate data, as well as the project mentors. You will investigate the spatial-temporal scaling of temperature extremes in using highly resolved climate data in order to project the effect of extreme heat on organisms in the coming decades. In the second phase of the project, you will leverage these relationships to model the likely thermal exposure of a range of organisms to extreme heat by 2100. You will be based at WSL in Birmensdorf in the Research Unit Biodiversity and Conservation Biology, and will work in collaboration with the Dynamic Macroecology group at WSL and with Yale University in the United States.You have a PhD in climate science, environmental sciences, geography, ecology or a related field. Experience in handling and analyzing big data sets and in working with environmental layers and ecological data is a requirement. Skills in Python and R are a necessity in this position. Strong skills in using computing, data science and/or AI, are a plus. You should be proficient in English, have a demonstrated capacity to write scientific papers, and be ambitious, creative, and highly motivated. You should also be used to a high standard of independent, structured, and careful work, and be excited to work in a collaborative team of international and interdisciplinary researchers. If this describes your background and working style, you have the right qualifications for this position.
Please submit your complete application to MichÃ¨le Bucher, Human Resources WSL, by uploading the requested documents through our webpage. Applications via email will not be considered. For further information, contact Dr. Catherine Graham catherine.graham(at)wsl.ch, Dr. Pincelli Hull pincelli.hull(at)wsl.ch and Dr. Dirk N. Karger dirk.karger(at)wsl.ch. WSL strives to increase the proportion of women in its employment, which is why qualified women are particularly called upon to apply for this position. Applications will be considered until the positions are filled, but we will start evaluating applicants immediately and thus encourage submissions by mid to late January 2024.Apply now ZÃ¼rcherstrasse 111, CH-8903 Birmensdorf

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05882-1-000353976", "text": "(Senior) Manager - Technology Risk Consulting / EMEIA Financial Services in Zurich

(Senior) Manager - Technology Risk Consulting / EMEIA Financial Services in Zurich
Location:	Zurich Other locations:  Primary Location Only Salary:CompetitiveDate:  Feb 9, 2024
Job description
Requisition ID:  1466733
The world is changing more and faster than ever. Our global promise: "Building a better working world" guides our more than 300,000 employees around the world and provides the basis for the work we do every day. With our innovative services in auditing, tax consulting and transaction and management consulting, we lead our clients into the future.

Our advisory business offers a wide range of functional and cross-border services aimed at providing high quality and trusted advice to our clients. Our Financial Services Organization (FSO) is the only one of the Big 4 companies with a functional and international specialization in the financial services sector. In this way, we provide seamless, consistent, and high-quality services to our clients around the world.

The Opportunity

Work on exciting technology risk projects with leadership roles at some of the largest Swiss banks, asset management and insurance companies.

Gain insight into state-of-the-art IT environments and our established practices based on global methodologies

Learn frontline thought leadership in response to today's changing marketplace, ever-increasing regulatory requirements and new digital challenges

Grow your expertise with each project alongside our partners and mentor less experienced consultants

You will have the opportunity to work with people from all over Europe and the world

Your most important tasks

Your focus is on technology risk consulting, information security and IT risk management for banks, asset managers and insurance companies

You will manage a portfolio of clients while working on projects on current topics such as digital resilience, cloud risk management, third party management, data management, transformation, and artificial intelligence.

In addition, you will take on tasks in the areas of technology risk assurance in terms of internal controls as well as risk and compliance management

As an Engagement Manager, you will be responsible for the successful planning, execution, and completion of complex projects with various internal and external stakeholders

You further develop our consulting services and thereby contribute significantly to the strategic development of the team

You actively doing go-to-market and acquire consulting mandates as well as audit-related additional services for our financial services and insurance clients

Skills and qualities for success

What you bring with you:

Bachelor's or masterâ€™s degree in business administration or (business) information technology is a prerequisite, relevant certifications (e.g. CISA, CRISC, etc.) round off your profile

Relevant experience (min. 5 years for Manager and min. 8 years for Senior Manager) in the areas of Technology Risk such as IT Risk, Governance and Compliance, Digital and Cyber Resilience, Cloud Risk Management, Transformation Risk, Artificial Intelligence Risk or similar

Sound organizational and technical knowledge in the area of technology risk, including experience with relevant security standards and frameworks (e.g. ISO 27001, COBIT, ITIL, NIST, etc.)

A must: Passion for consulting and technology risk issues and proven entrepreneurial skills

Experience in the areas of leadership, team mentoring, customer and project management

Success factors that will get you ahead with us: Ability to work in a team, determination, readiness for action and a quick grasp of things

As an international company, we require German and English (fluent)

What we are looking for:

Are you as ambitious as we are? As a member of our high-performing teams, you'll develop the tech skills and mindset to become the leader you want to be - the leader the world needs. Use our reach, our technology, our teams and our culture to fulfil your potential and change the world. Learn from the best, surround yourself with the brightest minds and ask better questions to get even better answers. The unique experiences you gain at EY will stay with you for life. It's in your hands - It's yours to build.

What we offer:

An international, multicultural team of highly motivated professionals

Broad and established national and international client portfolio

A culture that promotes diversity and continuous learning

An innovative and dynamic environment that constantly opens new doors for you through the exchange of knowledge, flexibility and recognition

An open and collaborative work culture based on honesty, integrity and mutual respect

Numerous training opportunities and online courses to improve your knowledge and skills in technical and non-technical areas

During your employment with us, you will have the opportunity to earn an accredited, proprietary and free MBA (EY Tech MBA) from Hult International Business School*

Are you interested? Do you think you meet the above criteria? Do you want to advance your career and experience a unique culture? Then apply to us now and take the next step! Apply online for your new challenge.

For more information, please contact our recruitment team ([email] / +41 58 286 33 66).

The exceptional EY experience. Itâ€™s yours to build."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05892-1-000372059", "text": "Research Scientist, Machine Learning and Neuroscience

As an organization, Google maintains a portfolio of research projects driven by fundamental research, new product innovation, product contribution and infrastructure goals, while providing individuals and teams the freedom to emphasize specific types of work. As a Research Scientist, you'll setup large-scale tests and deploy promising ideas quickly and broadly, managing deadlines and deliverables while applying the latest theories to develop new and improved products, processes, or technologies. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, our research scientists work on real-world problems that span the breadth of computer science, such as machine (and deep) learning, data mining, natural language processing, hardware and software performance analysis, improving compilers for mobile platforms, as well as core search and much more.

As a Research Scientist, you'll also actively contribute to the wider research community by sharing and publishing your findings, with ideas inspired by internal projects as well as from collaborations with research programs at partner universities and technical institutes all over the world.

Google Research is building the next generation of intelligent systems for all Google products. To achieve this, weâ€™re working on projects that utilize the latest computer science techniques developed by skilled software engineers and research scientists. Google Research teams collaborate closely with other teams across Google, maintaining the flexibility and versatility required to adapt new projects and foci that meet the demands of the world's fast-paced business needs.

Minimum qualifications:

PhD in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.

One or more scientific publication submission(s) for conferences, journals, or public repositories.

Preferred qualifications:

Candidates will typically have 2 years of coding experience.

Candidates will typically have 1 year of experience owning and initiating research agendas.

Author research papers to share and generate impact of research results across the team and in the research community.

Help in growing research business across teams by sharing research trends and best practices within the community.

Define the data structure, framework, design, and evaluation metrics for research solution development and implementation under minimal guidance. Identify timelines and obtain resources needed.

Identify new and upcoming research areas by interacting with potential external and internal collaborators. Help in developing long-term research strategy and plans to expand the impact of Google research with some guidance.

Contribute to conducting experiments based on the research question. Develop research prototypes or conduct simulations to further evaluate the impact of research, finalize hypotheses, and refine the research methodology under minimal guidance."}
